loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is engaged in soft drink retailing, but she also sells other commodities aside from soft drinks. She is also managing a school canteen but only on school days. Since it is vacation now, her focus is her retail business. She would like to request a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional business capital. She also plans to purchase some commodities for her canteen in preparation for the school year.

Lydia's income is just enough to meet the needs of their family and she hopes that she can have the opportunity to make her business grow and hopefully expand it someday. Lydia believes that “if there’s a will, there’s a way”. She knows that they will be able to survive life’s difficulties because she never gives up looking for resources for her family. Lydia is 46 years old. She is married to Alfredo and they are living in the rural and mountainous village of San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21) of Ilagan, Isabela. They were blessed with four children; three of them are still studying. They are: Jeffrey, 25 years, criminology student; Janice, 23 years old, a college graduate but still unemployed; Jo-em, 12 years old, and Jinky, 10 years old; the younger two are still in grade school.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora and her husband are engaged in buying and selling animals and this has been the source of income for their family.  She is 37 years old and married to Ruben. They live in San Rafael Ilagan, Isabela, a rural and mountainous place. Their two children are still studying. They buy cows and carabao in Pangasinan and sell them in Isabela.  They only sell animals once or twice a month since Pangasinan is approximately five hours from their place.  She is now requesting a loan of PHP12,000.00 that they can use as additional capital for their business.  

Nora wants her children to have a better life and she is hoping that she can send them to college after high school.  She believes that she can make it by working hard.  She hopes that her loan will be granted so she can have a continuous source of livelihood, which is a big help in sending her children to school.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif was born in 1967. He is married and has four children. Akif is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Kayidish village. This village was built for IDPs. Fve years ago he started a sheep-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 20 sheep to improve his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification A. formerly sold food in the streets. Now she grows rice, which she uses to feed and clothe her six children. Her husband is also a farmer. Together they work very hard to provide for all their needs. She wants to start  another business. She also wants to grow her rice field so that later on she can buy additional lots for a bigger income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy insecticide and herbicides. The loan will really help her increase her yield. The loan will definitely increase her income.

CEVI provides not just loans. They also provide credit, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide and herbicides

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul was born in 1969, and is married. This young woman lives in Baku city. Four years ago she started her beauty salon business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving her beauty salon.

loans.name: 02-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Minh N. Thị is a 44 year old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Minh is the group leader of a 7 member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Đông Hải (16.02.02).

Minh is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Minh owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Minh has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 900.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Minh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Minh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Lê Thị Oa is a 46 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  N. Thị Lập is a 46 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  N. Thị Quy is a 62 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Lê Thị Thắm is a 26 year old female who is requesting a 3.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

5.  Lê Thị Bình is a 37 year old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  N. Thị Xuân is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Note: Many FPW borrowers have expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses. In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6.000.000 VND with a 20 month term to its Thanh Hoa City branch portfolio. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Minh N. Thị (22) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Minh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Đông Hải (16.02.02).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Minh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Minh kiếm được khoảng 900.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Minh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Minh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Lê Thị Oa (21) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
2.  N. Thị Lập (23) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
3.  N. Thị Quy (26) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
4.  Lê Thị Thắm (60) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
5.  Lê Thị Bình (99) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
6.  N. Thị Xuân (6) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.
*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru:
Шамсиддин Садриддинов проживает в Истаравшане,родился он в 1956 году, женат и имеет 4 детей.
 Занимается Шамсиддин животноводством, имеет 25 летний стаж работы.Откармливает скот и перепродает его на рынке Истаравшана.Дома у него есть дойная корова, которая дает в среднем до 10 литров молока в день.Жена Шамсиддина перерабатывает молоко, делает из него кефир и масло, и продает их соседям. 
 Сын Шамсиддина помогает отцу в откорме скота.
 Шамсиддин хочет получить займ 400 сомони сроком на 6 меясцев, для того чтобы купить быка.
texts.en:
Shamsiddin S. lives in Istaravshan. He was born in 1956, is married and has four children. Shamsiddin does animal husbandry and has 25 years of experience in this field. He feeds cattle and then resells on the Istaravshan market. At home he has a milk cow which gives on average ten liters of milk a day. Shamsiddin's wife processes the milk and makes buttermilk and butter and then sells it to the neighbors. Shamsiddin's son helps his father in feeding of the cattle. Shamsiddin wants to get a loan for 400 somoni (US$125) for a six months term to buy a calf.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Victorine F.

texts.en:
Victorine is married to Joseph A. and they have four children. She lives in Ntasen, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. Victorine and her entire family live in a house with 3 bedrooms, one sitting room and a kitchen. Being a very hard working woman, Victorine has had to overcome some challenges in life such as her husband losing his job and the ill health of her children.

Victorine runs a small poultry farm in her compound with the support of her children and husband. Besides this, her daughter is also a seamstress. She will invest in her workshop by buying her a sewing machine. With this loan, she plans to buy more fowls, feeds, oil, cocoyam, fish, and cultivate vegetables.

This will be Victorine sixth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2001.  She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main road), the quality of her products, and her reasonable prices.  She buys in bulk which causes the price to be minimal and her children help her to process “ekwang” (smash cocoyam into a paste and boil with oil and other ingredients). She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
Part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of Victorine’s children. The other part will be used for completion of her house for the family. Victorine does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments every month. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cocoyam, oil, fish, fowls, feed for fowls, and cultivate vegetables.

loans.name: Sahliyali

texts.en:
Sahliyali was born in 1970. He is married, with 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in the Fizuli region, in a Kayidish settlement. This settlement was built for IDPs.

He has been in the sheep breeding business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 18 sheep for improving his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 18 sheep.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is married, with 2 children. He lives in Baku city. He was born in 1961. Eight years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru:
Хамрокул Маруфов с детства любил наблюдать за работой родных и соседей в огороде. Ему нравилось помогать сажать деревья и сеять семена, а особенно собирать плоды и урожай. Поэтому, совместив приятное с полезным, Хамрокул уже в юношеском возрасте начал заниматься сельским хозяйством, который приносил и приносит неплохой доход по сей день.
 Дополнительно к сельскому хозяйству, он торгует овощами (картошкой и морковью) на рынке города Худжанда. Товар он привозит из Истаравшана. В этом бизнесе ему помогают его брат и супруга.
 Хамрокул подал заявку, для получения займа в размере 1500 сомони сроком на 8  месяцев.     Использовать займ он хочет для того, чтобы посеять и вырастить лук, а так же реализовать его вместе с другими видами овощей, на рынке города Худжанда.
texts.en:
Since he was a child, Hamrokul M. liked observing his family and neighbors doing the gardening. He liked helping planting seeds and trees, and he especially enjoyed harvesting. Therefore, when he was young, he got involved in agriculture, an occupation which is still quite profitable these days. In addition to agriculture, he sells potatoes and carrots at Hujand's market. He brings the vegetables from Istaravshan. His brother and wife help him with the business. Hamrokul submitted an application for an eight-month loan of 1500 somoni. He would like to use the loan for planting onions, which he could later sell at Hujand market.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plant onions

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Етмишев Илхом-молодой человек 36-ти лет,женат имеет 4-х детей.Ильхом занимается продажей мяса на продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района.Раньше Илхом покупал на сбой 2-х быков в неделю.Сейчас,расширив свой товарооборот,он покупает 4-5 быков и 3 барана.Илхом вместе со своим братом покупает скот на скотном рынке района,а также в соседней республике Кыргизия.Он очень доволен свом бизнесом,так как это помогает ему прокормить его большую семью.
texts.en:
Ilhom E. is a young man of 36, who is married and has four children. Ilhom sells meat at the Spitamen regional produce market. In the past he would purchase the less desirable cuts from two head of beef per week, but now he has expanded his selection and he buys four to five steers and three sheep. Ilhom and his brother buy their livestock at the regional cattle market, as well as in neighboring Kyrgyzstan. He is quite satisfied with his business as it helps him to feed his large family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Dadajon

texts.ru: Дадажон Махкамов-мужчина 50-ти лет,женат имеет 2-х детей.Занимается продажей одежды на вещевом рынке. Один раз в неделю  он ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан.Ему помогает его жена и дети. Дадажон имеет 20 летный стаж работы и у него большой опыт. Кроме этого он роботает художником театре.На новый займ он хочет привезти сезонный товар на летнее время.Он рад,что кредитуется в нашей организации.
texts.en:
Dadajon Mahkamov is 50 years old and is married with two children. Once a week he travels to Istaravshan to purchase clothings that he later sells at the market. His wife and children help him with this business. Dadajon has 20 years of work experience. In addition, he works as an artist in the theater. He would like to use the new loan for bringing summer clothing. He is happy to be our client.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase summer season clothing for sale

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
Che L. is married to Beatrice and is blessed with seven children. One of the children is less than 15 years old. He lives in Ntasen, Bamenda, Cameroon. He is a very hardworking man. He has faced numerous financial difficulties, especially when he was addicted to alcohol and was not able to meet his family's needs and educate his children. He also lost both of his parents at a very tender age. With the previous loans he succeeded in providing his community with white stuff (white liquid from raffia palms) for their social activities.

L. joined GHAPE on February 17, 2000 and now he is requesting his 8th loan from GHAPE. He plans to invest this loan in the purchase of farmland. L. intends to contribute from his savings the sum of 50,000 ($100) towards the realization of this business project. The farmland will be used for cultivation of food crops for sale.

The profit which he will have from the loan will be used to educate his children and pay hospital bills. Part of the loan installment repayments will come from previous investments.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy S. manages a small parcel of rice farm. She is 37 years old and has 7 children. She wants to develop her business more, and also dreams of buying additional lots to better support the needs of their family. Her husband, William S. is also a farmer, and they have been together for 17 years already. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will really help her increase her yield. Fertilizers are vital components to improve the soil conditions of the farm, and as a result of using fertilizer, she believes she can achieve the maximum yield of her rice. 

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides its clients not just with loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Isroilhon

texts.ru: Исроилхон Тиллоев  1971 года, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее. Жена сидит дома с детьми. Исроилхон с детства  помогал родителям ухаживать за скотом и сам научился разводить. Сейчас он учит своих детей  разводить скот.  Он недавно начал сотрудничать с Микроинвест. Он разводит скот почти 20 лет.  Планирует расширить свой коровник и поголовье скота. Он всегда отправляет на пастбище свой скот вместе с  сыном. К вечеру скот возвращается сытым. Исроилхон благодарен за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en:
Isroilhon T. was born in 1971. He is married with three children and has a university diploma. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. Since he was a child, Isroilhon helped his parents tend to the cattle and breed livestock. He has been doing it for 20 years and is now trying to pass on this knowledge to his children. Recently Isroilhon became a client of Microinvest. He is planning to get more cattle. He sends his cattle to the pastures with his son for the day. Isroilhon is grateful to Kiva for its support.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Abduhamitchon

texts.ru:
Абдухамитчон Бобоев опытный сельскохозяйственный работник. У него есть 0,7 гектаров участка земли, на котором он выращивает дыни и арбузы. Отец Абдухамитчона помогает ему в этом деле.
Сам же клиент, подрабатывает таксистом,  развозит пассажиров по городу.
 Абдухамитчон родился в 1967 году, женат и имеет одного ребенка. .
 Для выращивания бахчевых культур, ему необходима сумма в размере 1500, с целью получения которой он обратился к нам, в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Abduhamitchon B. is an agricultural worker with good experience. He has 0.7 hectares of land where he grows melons and watermelons. His father is helping him in this business. Abduhamitchon also works as a taxi driver and transports passengers around the town. He was born in 1967, is married and has one child. He needs a sum of 1500 somoni (US$400) to grow melons and has come to MicroInvest with this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow melons

loans.name: Aboubacry

texts.fr: ABOUBACRY D. EST NE EN 1964 A THIES .IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE DEUX ENFANTS .IL EST INSTITUTEUR DANS UNE ECOLE PUBLIQUE A THIES .IL EST MEMBRE DE LA MUTUELLE DEPUIS CINQ ANS .IL SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE SUBVENIR AUX SOINS MEDICAUX DE SA MERE.
texts.en:
Aboubacry D. was born in 1964 in THIES. He is married and the father of two children. He is a school teacher at a public school in THIES and has been a member of the mutuelle for five years. He's requesting this loan with the goal of covering the medical care for his mother.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Anabe

texts.en:
Anabe S. is a rice farmer. She has 5 children and big dreams for her family. At first, she was hesitant to go into farming. Her husband, Nicolas S., convinced her to have a small farm to provide their livelihood, and they started by renting a farm. Later on they were able to buy the lot and earn a larger income for their family.

She wants to use the loan to develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
Mirzoali H.'s economic activity is agriculture, which he has dedicated himself to for several years. He is married and the father of 4 children. Mirzoali learned farming business from a young age and now has a lot of experience. It is very important to point out that his business requires a lot of effort, which is why he dedicates himself to growing potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. This requires a lot of exposure to the sun as well as moving the product long distances. The reason why Mirzoali is requesting a loan from IMON International is to invest in technological assistance in cultivation. With this loan he will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of his products after the harvest. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary F., born in the year 1959,  is happily married with eight children. Being a very hard working woman with a large family she has faced some challenges in life such as the death of her son. She lives in  in Bamenda, Cameroon.
Mary has seen GHAPE as a source of relief since the year 2000. In that same year Mary received her first loan of 15,000 FRS and the repayment was done promptly. With her current loan (her eighth) she plans to buy two types of firewood to split and pack in her compound and to sell.
She will start repayment three months from the day of disbursement. The success of the business is guaranteed because she is experienced in the business and she has a ready market for dry firewood. Mary plans to use the profit from the business to pay school fees for her children, give good medical attention to her family and also provide balance diet to her family members.
Mary is a member in GHAPE, and  she has been taught how to manage the loan from GHAPE. The method of repayment is comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying, transporting, splitting and selling of fire wood

loans.name: Bibinor

texts.en:
Bibinor B.  is 53 years old. She is married with 9 children. Together with her husband (pictured) and sons Bibinor is running a manufacturing business. They are producing  wooden doors and window frames. The shop is located right in their house. Mostly Bibinor takes part in selling their production at the market. Working in this business for 19 years, Bibinor and her husband have become rather experienced masters. Producing goods of good quality and acceptable prices Bibinor has got many customers. In general the business is successful and generates a stable incomes for the family. Now Bibinor is planning to hire an additional woodworker required for expansion of her business. With this purpose she requests 4000 Somoni. Her goal is to continue expanding and improving their family business every day, and, more importantly, to ensure that her younger children will always be able to attend a good school. Bibinor is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams with this loan.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To hire a woodworker to expand the business

loans.name: Muhammadchon

texts.ru: Мухаммадчон – мужчина средних лет (48 лет), женат и отец 6-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. У Мухаммадчона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 30 овец и 20 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Мухаммадчон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Мухаммадчона пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Мухаммадчон за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Мухаммадчон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, и благодарен партнерам КИВА.
texts.en:
Muhammadchon is a middle age man of 48 years old, married and is a father of six children. He has secondary education. Muhammadchon has a herd of small cattle which consists of approximately 30 sheep and 20 goats. His wife is a housewife, but in her free time she processes wool. Muhammadchon sends the herd to the mountains every morning and brings them back home in the evening. He does not have very many large cattle. Muhammadchon wants to use this new loan to buy two medium calves. After feeding them for three to four month he can resell them for a better price. Muhammadchon is very happy to be working with us and is thankful to Kiva and lenders.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Mavlida

texts.en:
Mavlida H.  is 30 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Together with her husband (pictured) they are running the business of manufacturing  wooden doors and window frames. Mostly Mavlida participates in selling their products. Her husband inherited the business from his father. Now Mavlida wishes to improve the working conditions of their shop  to be able to provide the services of the best quality in the neighborhood. After 13 years of operation, Mavlida is applying for a loan for the tenth time. She has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. Mavlida requests 4000 Somoni. She would like to thank everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.

loans.use: Purchasing materials like lumber and improving working conditions.

loans.name: Thilo

texts.fr: THILO B. EST NEE LE 26 JUIN 1967 A THIES .ELLE EST MARIEE ET FAIT DU COMMERCE DEPUIS LONGTEMPS.ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET POUR ALLER ACHETER DES BOLS ,des tissus et des draps à ROSSO.CELA LUI PERMETTRA d'augmenter son stock de marchandises et d'améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Thilo B. was born on June 26, 1967 in THIES. She is married and has been working in commerce for a long time. She's requesting this loan to buy bowls, cloth, and bed sheets in ROSSO. This will enable her to augment her stock of merchandise and to improve her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Ruabso

texts.en:
Ruabso B. is 43 years old. She has been married for about 20 years. Ruabso together with her husband (pictured) has been running her business for about 12 years. She rents a retail store where she sells different kinds of housewares. Her business is the main source of income. As a rule Ruabso travels to the neighboring town to purchase the goods. She always tries to have a wide range of goods of good quality to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today, Ruabso requests 2000 Somoni for the term of 10 months. This is the tenth time that she has asked for a loan through IMON. The loan will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the variety of her goods. Due to the profitability of her business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and her experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new housewares for increasing the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим молодой человек 22 лет. Женат, детей пока нету. Его жена готовится стать матерью их первого ребенка. Абдкрахим очень рад и готовится такому событию. У него будет пополнение семьи и он теперь должен  больше зарабатывать. Он живет отдельно от родителей. Жена Абдурахима помогает мужу как только может. Абдурахим хочет взять кредит для увеличения количества своего скота.
texts.en:
Abdurahim is a young man of 22 years of age. He is married and has no children yet. His wife is getting ready to become a mother of their first child. Abdurahim is very happy and is preparing for this event. There will be an addition to the family and he now has to start earning more. He lives separately from his parents. Abdurahim's wife helps him as much as she can. Abdurahim wants to take out a loan to increase the number of his cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.en:
Sadullo J. is a hardworking young gentleman who works in the cattle raising business. He is married and provides for his little son. He works hard to provide everything his family needs. Presently, Sadullo is making sacrifices and working hard to make his business grow. For that he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase baby cows with the purpose of feeding them and raising them. His goal is to then be able to get the most return from the sale of milk products. This will be his first loan with IMON and Kiva, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing of calves

loans.name: Amadou Souleye

texts.fr: mr N. est né en 1963 à THIES .IL est travailleur municipal depuis sept ans ;il s'est marié récemment et sa femme doit rejoindre le domicile conjugal .C'est dans le but d'équiper sa chambre qu'il sollicite ce pret pour acheter un lit et une armoire .
texts.en:
Mr. N. was born in 1963 in THIES. He has been a municipal worker for seven years. He got married recently, and his wife must join the marital home. With the goal of fixing up his bedroom, he's requesting this loan to buy a bed and an armoire.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an armoire and a bed

loans.name: Kimmat

texts.en:
K. Kimmat has worked in the agricultural field since she was young. Her parents instilled in her the value of hard work, which she demonstrates today. She buys and sells cattle and, in this manner, earns income for her family. Kimmat does not have a lot of confidence in agricultural production, so she has now opted to devote her time to raising animals. She uses her land now only to produce food for herself and her animals. Kimmat is married and has 5 children. She hopes to improve the rearing conditions of her young animals and in this way improve her living situation. For this reason she is seeking a loan.

loans.use: Purchasing of calves

loans.name: Astou Mbene

texts.fr: ASTOU MBENE F. EEST NEE EN 1963 A THIES.ELLE EST MARIEE ET EST MERE DE JEUNES ENFANTS .SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER POUR REVENDRE DES FRUITS DE MER,DE LA PATE d'arachide et de l'huile de palme.AVEC CE PRET ELLE VEUT RENFORCER SES STOCKS DE PRODUITS POUR MIEUX SATISFAIRE SA CLIENTELE.
texts.en:
Astou Mbene F. was born in 1963 in THIES. She is married and a mother with young children. Her work involves buying and then selling seafood, peanut butter, and palm oil. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock of goods to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuff

loans.name: Aissatou Aimady

texts.fr: Aissatou Aimady, 49 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Son activité est la restauration et la vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte acheter des provisions pour préparer les repas et acheter des arachides à  transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut  renforcer son captal pour mieux assurer les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Aissatou Aimady, age 49, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group of Sinthiang Coundara for six years. Her works in food catering and in selling peanut butter. She plans to buy provisions to make meals and to buy peanuts for processing into peanut butter to sell. She wants to boost her capital to make sure she can cover family expenses better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and peanuts for producing peanut butter and making meals

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
With three children and the responsibility of providing food for his family, M. Furkat has raised cattle and farmed for 5 years. He has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today Furkat finds himself in need of more calves to raise, to sell them when necessary, or when their sale will be most advantageous. Furkat is borrowing a loan from IMON International in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Sultonmurod

texts.en:
Sultonmurod is a married man and the father of four children. Together with his wife he has been raising cattle for more than 14 years. This produces the income which allows him to feed his children and his wife. As well as caring for his livestock, he also cultivates wheat, which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. Sultonmurod has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Awa Diop

texts.fr: AWA DIOP D. EST UNE VEUVE QUI VIT AVEC SES ENFANTS AU QUARTIER DIXIEME DE THIES .POUR SUBVENIR A SES BESOINS ET A CELUI DE SES ENFANTS ,elle fait du commerce de détail;elle vends des tissus et des produits alimentaires;elle sollicite ce pret pour augmenter son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Awa Diop D. is a widow who lives with her children in the Dixieme district in Thies. In order to support herself and her children, she is a retailer who sells cloth and groceries. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A., 50 years old and the mother of 11 children, owns a small rice field, her only source of income to feed and clothe the family. In order to sustain her business, Rosita is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides. The loan will ensure a good harvest and help her family grow the business.

“I am grateful to CEVI for giving me an opportunity to have a business," she says. “Now I receive not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well,” she added.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Ashrafjon

texts.en:
The agriculture business takes a great deal of effort, requiring as it does exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another and the hard work of tending to various crops. M. Ashrafjon has dedicated himself to cattle-raising for eight years now to support his humble family which so relies on him.

Currently, Ashrafjon is requesting of IMON International a loan of $700 to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife, the family he greatly loves.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Baldé, 51 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Mariama veut un prêt pour promouvoir son activité de transformation et vente de pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
Mariama Baldé, 51, is married and raising 4 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 6 years. Mariama wants a loan to bolster her little business producing and selling peanut butter.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Bobo

texts.en:
M. Bobo has dedicated himself to raising livestock since he was very young. He is a married father who supports his children, none of whom need his help to complete their studies. His wife also helps him with business. Bobo is faced with the need is to purchase calves. The animals Bobo raises are sold to farmers who then resupply him with calves. To acquire the animals, Bobo has come to IMON International to obtain the necessary credit so he can continue to maintain his dear home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: the purchase of calves

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: DAOUDA S. EST UN VIEL HOMME QUI EST EMPLOYE DANS UNE BOULANGERIE A THIES.IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE CINQ ENFANTS.AVEC CE PRET qu'il demande il veut acheter un four d'occasion qu'il souhaite utiliser chez lui pour avoir des revenus supplémentaires.
texts.en:
Daouda S. is an older man who works in a bakery in Thies. He is married and the father of 5 children. With this loan he wants to buy a used oven that he intends to put to work in his home to make supplementary income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of an oven

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
K. Naim is a married father of two. His family lives in Kanibadam where Naim runs a small grocery store selling food downtown. Naim's store is well known in the neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with work. Naim has been in business for 9 years. Currently he is seeking a loan of $800 US to purchase more inventory to increase the variety of goods he offers. Naim had some struggles when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing additional food to increase his store's inventory

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita L. is engaged in swine production. She raises pigs to support the needs of her family. She is 64 years old and unmarried. She wants to grow her business to help her siblings and her nieces. Oftentimes, Enriquita feels lonely for having no husband or child. She is happy, however, doing business and taking care of her pigs.

Enriquita is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (or about $150 US) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. She will also buy additional piglets to increase the size of her pig farm. The loan will really help Enriquita earn a larger income.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Halimatou Abibou

texts.fr: Halimatou Abibou  Diallo49 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Son activité est la restauration  Elle compte acheter des provisions pour préparer les repas à vendre. Halimatou veut entretenir son activité.
texts.en:
Halimatou Abibou D., 49, is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 6 years. Her business is selling cooked food. She intends to buy ingredients to use in preparing meals to sell. Halimatou wants to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making cooked food to sell

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en:
K. Hadiya is a married mother of four. Her husband works as a farmer, and she has been helping him for the last 16 years. Hadiya has a small piece of land on which she cultivates wheat and corn. Her business helped give her children an education, and she wishes to continue the working so she can take care of them while they live with her. Hadiya is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Hadiya and her family thank you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mansour

texts.fr: MR MANSOUR G. EST NE EN 1980 A DIOURBEL .IL EST CHAUFFEUR DE PROFESSION ET POSSEDE UN VEHICULE PERSONNEL QUI EST SA PRINCIPALE SOURCE DE REVENU .AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT REPARER SON VEHICULE QUI A QUELQUES PANNES.
texts.en:
Mr. Mansour G. was born in 1980 in Diourbel. He is a professional driver and has his own car which is his principal source of revenue. With this loan, he wants to repair his car which has several things wrong with it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing his vehicle used for public transport

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en:
M. Zarif is a farmhand. He learned to grow different kinds of vegetables from his parents. Now that Zarif has his own family, he works his hardest to increase his yield to support the needs of his children well. Zarif is 30 years old and has 2 children. He wants to send them to school. His harvest is what he depends on for the future of his family. Almost all of it is saved for family consumption, while the remainder is sold in the market by his wife. Zarif is requesting a loan of $800 US. He will use the loan to buy the necessary fertilizers and seeds for his crop. His loan will truly give Zarif an increased yield. In this way, he will have more to give to his family. Be an important part of the wellbeing of this humble family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariama Kesso

texts.fr: Mariama Kesso, 51 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Mariama achète des arachides pour les  transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales
texts.en:
Mariama Kesso, 51, is married and raising four children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 6 years. Mariama buys peanuts to transform into peanut butter which she sells. She wants to bolster her little business so as to help her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.en:
M. Ravshanjon is married and has four children. He believes that his children must go to college to get ahead, and to make this possible he began processing and selling dried apricots to make enough money to pay for their tuition. This was his goal when he started his business seven years ago, and now he is experienced and able to expand his clientele day by day. To continue doing this, Ravshanjon needs a loan for $800 for nine months. He is going to spend the loan to buy dried apricots for processing and resale. With your help, Ravshanjon will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and are honorable people.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.A civil war, which erupted soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients, and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried apricots for processing and resale

loans.name: Mouminatou

texts.fr:
Mouminatou D., 55 ans, est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité est la restauration et la  vente de fruits (oranges, mangues et autres). 
Elle veut renforcer son capital pour rendre son activité plus rentable.
texts.en:
Mouminatou D., age 55, has been a member of the village lending group of Sinthiang Coundara for two and a half years. Her business involves food catering and selling fruit (oranges, mangos, and more). She wants to boost her capital to make her business more profitable.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for his restaurant business and for selling fruit

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is 53 years old, married and has four children. Her youngest is in high school; the others have all graduated and are now independent. Emma lives with her husband and youngest child in Abeka, a suburb of Accra. She is a very resourceful woman whose hard work has helped her husband give their children a good education. 

Emma makes a living baking bread and selling provisions. She buys her raw materials – flour, margarine, sugar, etc -- from the big markets in Accra where they are readily available. She bakes and distributes her bread to beverage sellers and other bread merchants in her community at wholesale prices. She has been in business for 27 years. Emma has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying materials in bulk so that she can distribute to a larger number of customers. Emma is a member of a trust group called “Mawulawe,” which means that things are in God's hands. The group members guarantee each other's loans, and provide assistance in making timely repayments.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients -- such as flour, margarine, sugar, etc -- in bulk.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta Baldé, 35 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Binta achète des arachides pour les  transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Binta Baldé, 35, is married and raising 5 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 6 years. Binta buys peanuts and processes them to produce peanut butter, which she sells. She wants to bolster her little business so she can help her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. is 32 years old, married and has three children, all currently in school. He makes a living selling spare parts for cars, and is also an auto electrician. He buys spare parts in bulk, and retails them to his customers. As a result of his rich experience as an auto electrician, he has earned the trust and confidence of many clients, who come to service their vehicles in his shop.

John enjoys his trade very much, but does not have enough money to support his family as he would like, especially because many of the parts he buys have gone up in price lately. He has applied for a loan to buy a new stock of spare parts and scrap metal to sell to his customers. He believes that this loan will allow him to save more to finance his children's education and also build his own shop. John is a member of a loan group called Mawulawe (which means "things are in God's hands") Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and support one another when making loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and scrap metal in bulk to sell to his customers

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Shiela D. is 33 years old, married and an expert at hair cutting and styling who runs a salon in Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Sheila is second of six children. Because she came from a big family, education for all of her siblings was impossible, but this has not discouraged her from pursuing her studies. Her interest in opening a salon allowed her to support herself doing home services for relatives, neighbors and professionals in their town. She also has a small space to accommodate walk-in customers.

Sheila fell in love with the programs and services of Paglaum MPC. The training, insurance and loans made possible by the cooperative are what she likes most, and she is a member of the group in good standing.  She has applied for a loan to buy additional hair products, and hopes to have a bigger space soon for her loyal customers and many new ones.

loans.use: To expand her beauty parlor and buy more supplies.

loans.name: Tejada

texts.en: C. Tejada is a 19 years old, single, and makes a living buying and selling grooming items. She lives in Katipunan, Guipos, Zamboanga Del Sur. C.'s father helped her open and expand business. She is applying for her fourth loan from Paglaum, which she will pay back in six months and use to buy additional grooming items to buy and resell.  She does her selling on market day in her own village and in a nearby town. Her business helps her family pay its daily expenses. C.'s goal is to use the profits generated by her business to save for college.

loans.use: To buy slippers, hairclips, brushes and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Paglaum MPC serves in communities for the purpose of elevating or uplifting members from poverty. One of the great programs which really helps members is the PDP-LP Program, and one of the thousands of members is Mrs. Nora P.. She is a 37-year-old who is married and blessed with three children studying in elementary school. She libes in Barangay Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She started her membership three years ago, on January 31, 2006.

She is now in her seventh loan cycle to purchase sacks of fertilizers and pesticides and pay for the laborer who cultivates their rice field together with her husband. Finally, she is very happy managing their rice field which is one of their sources of income for their daily needs. She is very thankful that Paglaum MPC loaned her money that gives a big help for their daily life.

loans.use: Additonal capital

loans.name: Dexie

texts.en: Mrs. Dexie E. is a 48-year-old from Poblacion Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter/ farmer and blessed with two children. She started a business with a minimal amount of capital. Being a member of Paglaum MPC, she was able to acquire additional capital for her business. She sells snacks to neighbors, friends and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business. Now she wants a loan of PHP 7,000. Determination in life is what she has. Her heart’s desire is to have a small stall for a sari-sari (variety) store and to send their children to school and witness them be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas and ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Lerio

texts.en:
A hardworking and determined person, Mr. Lerio B. is 54 years old, married and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Lerio really works hard to earn. He has two children. His source of income derives from his piggery, where his wife is his partner. They have good chemistry with his wife. Because of the benefits of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, he decided to join and has already taken loans. He’s happy that with the cooperative's help, he was able to build a concrete pigpen with variety of pigs to raise. He started with a small beginning, with two piglets.

Seeing that his business grows is what he calls his greatest achievement with God’s help. He wants to buy feeds in bulk, that’s why he applies for a PHP 14,900 loan.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feeds

loans.name: Jashel

texts.en:
Mrs. Jashel A. is 29 years old, married and a resident of Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. Her husband is a private employee. Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling.

She started a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with a small amount of capital. Their primary customers are their neighbors. She was successfully able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She was able to take two loans at a time but has paid them all religiously. Now she applies for a loan of PHP 35,000 to finance the purchase of additional stock for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a general-merchandise store someday.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Mrs.Alejandra M., 36, is married and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She has two children and her husband is a “sikad” (bicycle with a cab) driver. Because she could not get a good job, she decided to open a food-vending business.

With the family's financial difficulties, Mrs. M. joined Paglaum MPC for financial assistance, but she was also happy knowing that she will also be able to save part of her income and obtain other benefits offered by the Cooperative. Now she requests PHP 10,000 for additional capital for her food-vending business. Her greatest desire is to see her children finish their studies and live a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: Addtional capital for food vending

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with four children. Her husband works as security guard.

She has been a member of Paglaum Co-op, a Kiva partner, since August 2006. She has already taken loans several times. Today she seeks a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional RTW (Ready-To-Wear) clothing items for sale. She wishes to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy addtional RTWs (clothing) for sale

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Mrs. Liza C. started her membership with Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, in September of 2003. She is 40 years old, married and blessed with three children. Two of her children are studying in elementary school and the other one is already married. She is a resident of Barangay Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental.

She is considered a member in a good standing. In fact, she seeks her 16th loan for a rice-field cultivation project to purchase sacks of fertilizer and a bottle of pesticide. These are very important in rice-field cultivation. Now she is glad and inspired, managing her project together with her husband. She's very thankful to Paglaum MPC for the financial assistance that gives them armor to fight poverty.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly S. is a farmer. She is 59 years old and the mother of two children. She is a rice grower. Every day, she goes out to the field, working under the heat of the sun and feeling the wet soil to ensure a good harvest. She and her husband, Nicolas S., are working so hard to provide a good future for their children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy two sacks of complete fertilizers. The loan will truly help her earn a better income for her family.

CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage to their clients.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of complete fertilizers

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia B. is married to a motorcycle driver. Sad to say, this couple has not been given a child yet. Ofelia got bored staying at home, busy doing nothing. And so, she asked her husband for permission to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, to take advantage of its programs and benefits. Ofelia became a member of Paglaum MPC just this March, 2009. She has applied for 5,000 PHP as capital for her sari-sari (general) store, particularly to buy soft drinks and other beverages.

This couple wishes to have their own child one day. Ofelia is very grateful that she is a member of PMPC and has the opportunity to use Kiva services as well.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and other beverages to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena M., a 62-year-old bag maker, is a widow with 2 children. She lives in Maular, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She started her bag making with a small amount of capital; now she plans to expand to cater to her growing customer base. She wants a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy materials for bag making. She wants her business to grow and prosper and thereby give her family a better life.

loans.use: To buy materials for bag making

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of four children and farms cassava, ginger and yams. Margaret’s farm is located in Bafut, an area in Bamenda, Cameroon. With this loan, she plans to buy labor to clear and weed her farm; firewood; ginger and yams for planting; as well as pay for transportation costs to get her produce to the market.

This is Margaret’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2008. Margaret believes her business is successful because, in her area, there is a high demand for cassava and ginger. Cassava is used to make local dishes such as garri (a fermented and fried cassava mash) and water fufu (fermented, boiled cassava). Ginger is popularly used to make soft drinks, like ginger ale, which are very strong.

Margaret has faced setbacks with her money, such as thievery in her home, stealing her money. She continues to push on with the help of her loans. As she sees profits, Margaret plans to add capital to her business, purchase text books for her children’s education and provide her family with their basic needs. She takes out GHAPE loans because of the preferable loan conditions and the valuable teachings on loan management.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy firewood and ginger and to hire labor for land clearing

loans.name: Neba Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a mother of two children. She runs a business buying and selling cocoyams in the Bamenda food market. Comfort will use this loan to buy 150,000 CFA worth of cocoyams (taro), which she will house in a market stall she rents. She will also use the loan to pay for transporting her cocoyams.

This is Comfort’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. She has been successful at selling her cocoyams because of her approach to attracting customers and her friendly demeanor. She also notes that keeping her stall clean, as well as providing quality cocoyams keeps her business running.

At age 25, Comfort has already experienced the loss of her father and has had to drop out of school and take care of her younger siblings and her children. She plans to use the profits of this loan to improve her standard of living, pay for her children’s school fees and help take care of her younger siblings. Comfort takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of the loan work well for her and her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, pay stall rent and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Mrs. Gemma J. is 37 years old, is married, and lives in Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 4 children. Her husband is a private employee. Some of her children are in college already. She says, "If we only depend on the salary of my husband, it is not enough to support our daily needs.” She feels the difficulty of sending their children to school. And so Gemma thought of an economic project that would generate additional income.

Cooking is her favorite household chore. That’s how she got the idea of selling cookies and bread. In October 2008, she joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a chance to take a loan. She’s happy that the cooperative has extended their services to the needy members. From then on, she gained more customers and generated daily income. Today, she is applying for PHP 20,000 for additional capital for her cookie- and bread-making business. Seeing all her children succeed in life is her greatest achievement.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cookie and bread making

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina was born in 1987 and comes from the big village of Petrovo. She lives with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is employed and he pays for their daily costs. Marina takes care of the household and their children. She keeps herself busy in the garden producing vegetables for her family. But now she decided to start raising vegetables for sale, and she requests the loan from WWI in the amount of 1200 KM. Marina will use this loan to buy potato and corn seeds. This will increase her household income and provide a higher living standard.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en: Mrs. Ethel D. has been selling snacks since her childhood. In addition, she also cultivates a little farmland, producing corn and bananas. Her husband is a farmer. She is 32 years old and resides in Guba, Clarin, Mis. Occ. Ethel has been a very active, hardworking member of Paglaum MPC since 2005. As a member of the PDP-LP program of Paglaum MPC, she also enjoys the benefits of savings and insurance. This loan will be used to purchase additional ingredients for her snacks and a small part of it is for fertilizer for their farm. She aspires to give her children a better future, make a mini cafeteria, and expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: Capital for a snack vending business and to buy fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Born in 1957, Anna is married to a very supportive husband. They are blessed with six children. They have some challenges because of the rural exodus for greener pastures in the urban city of Bamenda. Farmland is scare or far from their residence in Ntabesi, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. This made them have to trek a very long distance for farming.

Her desire to give her children love and the best education motivated her to become a GHAPE member in 2002. Her past loan investments are still yielding good dividends. She plans to invest this loan in the purchase of a motorbike, frying of gateaux (small cakes) and a piece of farmland. Anna plans to actively involve her entire family in the implementation phase of her business.

With the profit from this loan, Anna plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well and buy their medication. She knows very well that she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the lengthy repayment period. Moreover, last year Anna was able to have savings, through which she acquired a piece of farmland.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE, a Kiva partner, works toward the empowerment of the poor and toward poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle, flour, sugar, firewood and palm oil

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Mrs. Leonila L. lives in Dipolog City. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are still studying, and an active member of Paglaum MPC for the past three years.  She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business and helps her husband, who operates a vulcanizing shop, in generating income for the household. She has already taken loans several times for her business.  Now she seeks another loan to redeem their coconut land, which was previously pawned due to financial difficulties.

loans.use: Redemption of pawned coconut land

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married and has seven children, five of whom are still in school. She and her family live in a three-room house with a broken roof and they are in the middle of the rainy season. Martha did not have the opportunity to get a good education as her father died when she was only a kid. This forced her into an early marriage. Added to this, her husband has been having health problems for the past couple of years, leaving her to do all that it takes to keep the family going. She joined GHAPE, a Kiva partner, in 2004 and has since received and repaid loans amounting to 220,000 CFA ($440).

Given a loan of 150,000 CFA, she plans to buy three piglets, pig feed and palm oil for retail. Palm oil is a basic commodity as almost all households use it on a daily basis. This is an indication that there is a ready market. The profit she gets from the loan shall be used to see her children through their academic career and to repair the broken roof of their house which leaks every time it rains.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and toward poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Piglets, pig feed and palm oil

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Mrs. Angelita S. is struggling on her own to feed a sickly husband and two dependents of her seven children. Even though she is a woman, she performs like a man, climbing coconut trees to produce native wine for the benefit of the family. She is a hardworking, 55-year-old, married woman. Angelita has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for several years and has used previous loans to support her economic activity. She is now requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP for housing repairs and the purchase of electrical lights for her household. This is the current inspiration of her life.

loans.use: For housing repair and installation of electric light

loans.name: Hanifa
