texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1947 and she became a widow very young. She has fought through life alone and works hard to provide a good life for her daughter. Hanifa receives pension money in a small amount enough to pay the bills. She works hard in the field and garden producing vegetables. She has been producing and selling vegetables for a long time and has a solid customer base. Hanifa has been our client for a long time and she is now requesting a loan of 1200 BAM (WWI amounts) to invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and minerals

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY G. EST UNE FEMME MARIEE NEE EN 1971 A THIES.DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES ELLE FAIT DU COMMERCE DE MARCHANDISES DIVERSES NOTAMMENT DES HABITS ET DES USTENSILES DE CUISINE .AVEC CE PRET ELLE ENVISAGE ACHETER DES MARCHANDISESPOUR RENFORCER SON COMMERCE.
texts.en:
Khady G. is a married woman born in 1971 in Thies. For several years, she has been selling various items, notably clothing and kitchen utensils. With this loan, she hopes to buy merchandise to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for re-sale

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Mrs. Nilda C. is 43 years old and married with four children. She is supported by her husband, who is a hard-working operator of a lumber planer, and by her daughter, who is already working abroad. Mrs. C. is a vendor of food. She started with her own capital but now her business needs a bigger amount from PMPC so she can sell more items. She applied for a loan of PHP 25,000.00.

She want to have her own residential lot with the help and financing from Kiva through Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: This loan will be used for food vending

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta D. A. is a rice grower. She has been into this kind of business since she was single. She is 54 years old and has eight children. Her husband is the one managing the farm. Her children help them sustain their business. AsiD. from rice, they also raise chickens and pigs to supplement their income.

Now she is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides. The loan will really help Loreta increase her income.

CEVI is a nonprofit organization and a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Gorgui

texts.fr: MR G. EST ORIGINAIRE DE LA REGION DE LOUGA OU IL EST NE EN 1960.IL EST MARIE ET EST PERE DE QUATRE ENFANTS ET VIT AVEC SA FAMILLE AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY DE THIES.IL FAIT DU COMMERCE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES ET GERE UN MAGASIN DE DENREES ALIMENTAIRES CHEZ LUI.AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT RENFORCER SON STOCK DE MARCHANDISES.
texts.en:
Mr. G. comes from the Louga region, where he was born in 1960. He is married and the father of 4 children and lives with his family in the Cite Lamy neighborhood in Thies. He has been a merchant for several years, managing in his home a shop that sells foodstuffs. With this loan, he wants to bolster his stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of grocery items

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Mrs. Marta T. is a resident of Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with 10 kids. Out of the 10, only one is still studying. She is an active member of Paglaum Co-op, a Kiva partner. She engages in raising pigs to help her husband, who is a farmer. Now she seeks a loan in the co-op for 5,000 Ph intended to purchase feed for her pig with the hope that it will grow faster for the education of her child.

loans.use: Purchase feed

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma. Vilma A. has raised pigs for years to help her husband generate enough income to feed their eight children and educate them to ensure their good fortune. She is an active member (and the center chief) of Paglaum Coop. This will be her seventh loan in the Coop, which is intended for the purchase of construction materials to repair the cages of her swine and for their feed. Her husband drives their motor cab for a living.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for pig enclosures and hog feed

loans.name: Nfoh

texts.en:
Born on January 25, 1942, Pa Nfoh Michael is married to Ma Nfoneh Margaret and they have been blessed with three children, one of whom is still under 15 years of age. Pa M. and his family live in a seven-room apartment in Ntasem neighborhood in Nkwen.

Due to circumstances beyond his control, Pa Nfoh didn’t have the privilege of a basic education or an apprenticeship to learn a trade, because his parents were poor. Even worse, his parents both died when he was still very young as there was no money to pay for needed medication. Pa Nfoh joined GHAPE in 2005, facing the need to bring up a good family on his own. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid three loans and the profits from these loans has helped him to sustain his life and that of his family, as well as to cater for the school needs of his youngest child.

With this loan he plans to buy piglets, pig feed, wood, and chickens to resell in his home so as to reduce the distance that his neighbors must trek in order to obtain these items. He will use the profit generated by this business to continue to educate his children and part will be ploughed back into his business. He thinks his business will succeed because he has been doing this business for a long period of time. He is going to start repayments the fourth month after the loan has been disbursed.

Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account. Most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust with its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed, wood and chickens

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa F. is 27 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Bolibol, Oroquuieta City. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs. In order to increase her earnings, she decided to sell hogs at the market. 

Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she obtained the capital to purchase the original piglets and feed. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 ($100 US) to buy additional feed and to expand her hog-raising business. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pigpen to provide more sanitary conditions. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and will benefit her family, supplementing her husband's income. She dreams that someday she will be able to provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to buy feed for hog raising.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Contra La Pobreza Group

texts.en:
Lucia M. R. is a group coordinator for the group called “Mujeres Trabajando Contra La Pobreza,” which in English means Women Working Against Poverty. Lucia is the owner of a small convenience store, where she sells food items such as rice and oil to her community. This will be Lucia’s third loan with Kiva's partner Esperanza and she is hoping this one will improve her business as much as the first two did. Lucia has two grown children, one of whom lives with her and her husband, Gabriel M..

Lucia dreams of continual growth for her business and also continually learning skills through her business and her experience with Esperanza. She dreams that her grown children will have a good position in society and also be able to own their own businesses one day. Because of her faithfulness in repayment of her first two loans, Lucia has been able to receive more with this current loan. Lucia’s loan is for 15000 Dominican pesos (about $420).

On behalf of Lucia M. R., Mujeres Trabajando Contra La Pobreza and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Replenish supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca A. is married with three children who are currently in school. She is 34 years old. To raise money to support her children in school, she sells foods like fried yam, cooked beans and fried plantain. Fried yams are enjoyed with hot pepper with fish and a lot of Ghanaians enjoy it so much.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of beans, plantains, yam, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children’s education. She is a member of a community group called Mawulawe (meaning God is will do it) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To  buy more bags of beans, plantains, yam, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Takku Liggey Cite Senghor 1 Group

texts.fr: HAWA ,DIARA ET MARIAMA SONT TROIS FEMMES MARIEES QUI VIVENT A THIES AU QUARTIER CITE SENGHOR .ELLES FONT DU COMMERCE DE PRODUITS DIVERS DEPUIS PLUSIEURS.ELLES SE SONT REGROUPEES EN GROUPE ET ONT OUVERT UN COMPTE A LA MUTUELLE .AVEC CE PRET ELLES VEULENT RENFORCER LEURS ACTIVITES GENERATRICES DE REVENUS.
texts.en:
Hawa, Diara, and Mariama are three married women who live in Thies, in the Senghor district. They have been selling various items for several years. They have formed a group and opened an account in the Mutual. With this loan, they hope to reinforce the businesses with which they earn their living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of various items

loans.name: Lunida

texts.en:
Mrs. Lunida J. C., 37, is a resident of 50th Barangay, Ozamiz City. She is married and blessed with two children. She is a micro-entrepreneur who runs a carenderia (small eatery). Her husband is also a skilled worker. He manages their own vulcanizing shop and does vulcanizing jobs for motorcycle and car wheels. Aside from their businesses, she also earns extra income from tutorial services because she has a Bachelor of Science degree in Elementary Education even though she was already married and had two children during her studies in college. Her husband earns additional income from their church as the service driver who also maintains the church vehicle.

As an active member of PAGLAUM MPC, she already enjoys its privileges and benefits. In fact, she has received multiple loans with much bigger amounts. Now she is applying for the amount of PHP 25,000.00 for the purpose of purchasing a second-hand welding machine unit and for additional capital for her business. At this time, she is enjoying her time babysitting her first grandchild. Future dreams for their family are to have a better life and successful businesses.

loans.use: Purchase second-hand welding machine and additonal capital for eatery

loans.name: Korkor

texts.en:
Korkor O. is fifty years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children. She trades in salt in the neighborhood of Abeka, a suburb of Accra, where she lives with her family. Korkor obtains her supply of salt from the surrounding villages of Ada and retails them to her customers for income to support her family. Through this trade, she has supported two of children in completing senior high school.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of salt with which to serve her customers. She believes the loan would enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She is a member of a loan group called Mawulawe Trust Group, which means "God will do it." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk supply of salt.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson D. is a rice farmer. He is 55 years old and has 3 children. He wants to increase the size of his farm so that he will have a bigger harvest. Aside from rice, he also grows vegetables in his backyard. He raises native chickens and sells them for Php 120 each.

He wants a a loan for Php 8,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. He believes that by doing so, he can improve the yield of his farm. In that way, he believes that he could better support his family.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people to start and have their own business. They not only provide loans to their clients, they also offer training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
P. was born in 1984 and is married to Che Charles. She lives in Ndamukong Street, Bamenda, Cameroon. They are blessed with three kids below 15 years. Being a hard working lady, she has faced so many challenges in life such as early marriage so she had to discontinue schooling for child bearing, ill health and poor parental care.

Due to all of these challenges she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in the year 2007. In this same year, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000FRS, and her repayment was done promptly. She plans to invest her second loan in making of traditional dresses and buying and selling of foodstuffs. More specifically she will buy corn, beans and cocoyams.

The loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed. She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a long period of time, she has a good site for this particular business and she is having a lot of customers. Her neighbors are happy she is doing business near them because their distance to the market is reduced and they can buy from her late in the night.

P. plans to use the profits to plough back into the business, cater for her children, and give good medical attention to her family. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of the social services GHAPE offers and the method of repayment is comfortable.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: For making of traditional dresses and selling of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel L. is a 39 year old businessman. He is a husband and the father of four kids, who are all currently in school. He trades in goats, sheep, and cocoa pods. He buys the goats and sheep from the northern part of the country and supplies them to restaurant operators as meat. Goat and sheep meat is enjoyed by many Ghanaian homes because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable.

His business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy goats and sheep from the farmers. With this loan, he wants to buy more goats and sheep to serve his customers with good quality meat for their meals. He believes the loan will enable him meet the demands of his customers. He also hopes to save more to support his kids in school. He belongs to the community group called Heavens Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 36 years old and has three children, who are all in school. Elizabeth manages a small parcel of land on which she grows rice. Her harvest is intended for family consumption but some is sold to rice traders for income to feed and clothe her family.

She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizers and seeds. The loan will really help her achieve a bigger harvest and a bigger income for her family.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. It aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI offers not just loans to all their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin K. O. is 29 years old. He is married with three kids, who are all currently in school. Martin trades in mobile phones, their appliances, and other electronic parts, like radio sets, speakers, transistors, screw drivers, wires, television cords, and antennas. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

He requests a loan to buy increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings in order to expand his shop by including sound systems and televisions. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to a community group called Heavens Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia M. is a corn farmer. She is 45 years old and has three children. She wants to send all her kids to school and provide them with a bright future. However, schools are quite expensive nowadays so she needs to work harder to support their educational needs. Sylvia was formerly a cook. She now grows corn and sometimes sells food in the street.

She is asking for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI to purchase insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers. The loan will truly help her improve her yield. Sylvia is also interested in venturing into another business to better support her children's needs.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people, especially the poor, to have their own businesses. It aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac P. is a 29 year old trader. He is married with two children. He has been selling used shoes in the local market of Bawjiase for the past four years. With income from his business, Isaac supports his kids in school. His major business challenge over the years has been inadequate funds to scale up the business. He has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that a loan would enable him to achieve remarkable business progress.

He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used shoes to serve his customers. He is a member of a community group called Heavens Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is 52 years old. She is married and has four children. Her eldest son is married and working and has moved out of the family home, but the last three children are in school. She trades in maize in the local market of Bawjiase, a town in the central region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has been inadequate funds to support the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy maize in bulk to grow her business and scale up her sales. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children’s education and give them better career opportunities in the future. She belongs to the community group called Heavens Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is a petty trader who sells gari, tomatoes, peppers, cassava, groundnuts and maize, etc. in her neighborhood. Gari is produced from milled cassava which is dried and fried and it is one of the local foods that is enjoyed by many Ghanaians, served with cooked beans and palm oil. Elizabeth is 39 years old. She is married with eight children who are currently in school. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of gari, beans, groundnuts and maize to increase her stock of goods for sale. She hopes to raise sufficient income to pay her children’s school fees. Elizabeth is a member of the trust group, Heavens. In this group, members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral, permitting access to loans and providing peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of gari, beans, groundnuts and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of seafood

loans.name: Mudjidatu

texts.en:
Thirty-nine years old and divorced with one child currently in school, Mudjidatu sells locally-prepared ice cream and cocoa drinks made from powdered milk, chocolate powder and sugar in her community local market. Cocoa drinks are enjoyed with bread or meat pies, and many Ghanaians take them as snacks.

Mudjidatu is requesting a loan to buy more bags of chocolate powder, sugar and milk powder to increase her sales and earn more income. She is a member of the community group called Heaven Trust Group, whose members vouch for one another as social collateral to access loans and use peer encouragement in the repayment of loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chocolate powder, sugar and milk powder.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget A. is a very hardworking trader. She enjoys selling, and selling cosmetics has been her major livelihood for the past four years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she hawks from one neighborhood to the next. 
Bridget is a 33-year-old woman, married with two children who are currently in school. She believes that with this loan, she will be better resourced to increase her inventory and income. 
She is a member of Heavens Trust Group. Members of this group provide assistance to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La microempresaria Estela M. A. tiene 40 años es casada tiene 5 hijos, todos se encuentran estudiando en nivel primario y secundario. La señora M. se dedica a administrar una pulpería desde hace 4 años, ya que su marido es albañil y no todo el tiempo tiene trabajo por lo que aprovecho para tener un pequeño ahorro y de esta manera inicio su negocio para poder garantizar el sustento diario de su familia aportando a los ingresos que lleva a la casa su marido.

La señora M. considera que si en su negocio se atiende bien a sus clientes, estos siempre le van a comprar sus productos y de esta manera es que ella mantiene su clientela. La microempresaria M. ya ha sido beneficiada con un crédito con Kiva, dicha crédito le permitió aumentar su inventario y ahora su pulpería esta mas surtida. Sin embargo prefiere tener muchos productos en existencia por el aumento en los precios que se dan regularmente y poder tener mejores ganancias.

Esta solicitando para comprar lo siguiente: 3 quintales de Arroz americano a US 55 el quintal, 3 quintales de azúcar a US 35 el quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US 56 el quintal, 3 bidones de  aceite a US 15 el bidón, 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a US 12 el bolsón, 5 cajas de huevos a US 8 la caja, 3 cajas de leche la lechera a US 15 la caja, 85 libras de pollo a US 1.20 cada libra, y 5 cajas de sopas 3 minutos (maruchan) a US 10 cada caja.
texts.en:
The small-businesswoman Estela M. A., 40, is married with 5 children, all studying in primary and secondary schools. Señora M. has earned her living running a small grocery store for the last 4 years. Since her husband is a bricklayer and does not always have work, they used their small savings to start her business in order to take care of the daily expenses of the family, adding to the income that her husband brings home. Señora M. believes that if she takes good care of her clients, they will always buy her products, so this is the way she maintains her clientele. The small-businesswoman M. has taken one loan through Kiva that allowed her to increase her inventory, and now her shop is better supplied. Nevertheless she prefers to keep stock on hand against the price increases that come regularly, to be able to have better profits. She is requesting to buy the following: 300 Kg of American rice at US $55 per 100 Kg, 300 Kg of sugar at US $35 per 100 Kg, 200 Kg of beans at US $56 per 100 Kg, 3 cans of oil at US $15 per can, 3 cases of toilet tissue at US $12 per case, 5 boxes of eggs at US $8 per box, 3 cartons of La Lechera milk at US $15 the carton, 85 pounds of chicken at US $1.20 per pound, and 5 cases of Maruchan 3-minute soups at US $10 per case.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita M. grows hybrid corn in their village. She is 44 years old and has five children in school. She and her husband, Abudio M., work very hard to sustain their family and provide for their daily needs. They never mind the labor of going to the field, working under the heat of the sun, and touching the wet soil, just to ensure enough food for their children. Now, Emelita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (the first Filipino MFI that obtained active status on Kiva). Emelita will use the loan to purchase hybrid corn seeds. The loan will truly help her increase her income.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI provides their clients with more than just loans. It also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid corn seeds

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family at Bawjiase in the central region, Ghana.

Lydia runs a grocery shop to help her husband support the family. She has been in business for two years now. She sells items such as tins of Milo (malted milk powder), milk, sugar, bread, tinned fish, etc. Lydia procures her goods from wholesalers in the big cities such as Accra.

She wants a loan to expand the size of her shop and also buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially her kids' education. She belongs to a trust bank group called ‘shining star’. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 35-year-old businesswoman. She is a wife and mother of four kids who are currently in school. She trades in pork. She buys the pork from nearby villages and supplies it to restaurant operators as meat for their meals. Pork is enjoyed in many Ghanaian homes because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable.

Martha's business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the pork from the farmers. With the loan, she wants to buy more pork to serve her customers good quality meat for their meals. She believes the loan will enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She also hopes to save more to support her kids in school.

Martha belongs to the community group called Shining Star Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure more pigs to sell as meat

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is forty-four years old; she is married with three kids. Currently, the kids are in school. She lives with her family at Bawjiase in Ghana.

Lydia is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She sells "garden eggs" (small eggplants) and peppers at Bawjiase market. She treks to Kumasi and nearby villages to purchase bulk stock from farmers to retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk "garden eggs" and peppers to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to pay for her kids in school. She is a member of the group called Shining Star Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase in bulk "garden eggs" and peppers

loans.name: Anye

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Anye is a widow who was married to Tayim Samuel. She is a hard-working woman with two children to look after. She says being a mother of two is more difficult than being a spinster. The death of her supportive husband left her cold and she has had to start doing some of those things her husband always did with her for her children; she took those things for granted. Challenged by these realities she has doubled her effort towards meeting the needs of their children. This made her join GHAPE.

Given a loan, she plans to expand her business in pig farming. More specifically, she will buy pigs, corn, and dried fish, kernel and cotton cake to fabricate feed. She will fatten the pigs and resell them. The profit from this will be used to pay school fees for her children. Her community stands a chance of benefiting from her activities as she will provide them with necessary manure for farming.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Fattening and selling of pigs

loans.name: Zuera

texts.en:
Zuera A. is thirty years old, single and independent. She loves fashion very much and as a result, trades in jewelry like earrings, necklaces and ladies' bags. She has been selling jewelry for the past 8 years. 

Zuera buys her goods from Accra and Togo. She moves to the door step of her customers to sell, a marketing strategy that has worked for her over the years. She also treks to nearby markets to sell. Zuera wants to use the loan to buy jewelry in bulk on a trip to reduce the frequency of travels.  She hopes to build up savings to rent a store so she can take her business to another level.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Born in 1937, N. C. Emmanuel is married and has five children, two of whom are less than 15 years old. Due to health reasons, he was unable to meet the academic needs of all his children, and two of them had to drop out of school. Determined to see all his children become responsible citizens in the future, he joined GHAPE in 2005 and received his first loan of $40, which he invested in pig rearing. As of now, he has proven his credibility by receiving and repaying loans totaling $370. 

Given a loan of $225, he intends to buy three piglets, one goat and construct bee hives for the production and sale of honey. Pigs and goats have highly valued in his community as a source of food. The manure he gets from the pig farm shall be used to open a vegetable garden. Honey is equally highly demanded for medicinal purposes and so he stands a great chance to benefit a lot from this investment. The profit he gets from the loan shall be used to pay school fees for his children and provide food for the family.

He intends to repay the loan in eighteen months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Three piglets, a goat, and materials for the construction of bee hives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fish (sea bass, red snapper, and lagoon shrimp)

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S., is twenty-eight years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Mariama lives with her family at Bawjiase in Ghana. She runs a small provisions kiosk in her neighborhood. She also sells food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc. on a table top in front of her kiosk. She has been in business for seven years. Mariama buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and markets in nearby towns.  She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to minimize the problem of frequent trips. She is a member of a group called “Shining Star”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk for resale

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en: Ayishetu H. sells vegetables and spices in the local market of Bawjiase, Ghana. She is a sixty-year-old married woman, with two children who are working. Ayishetu does not have adequate working capital to support her business. She most of the time buys supplies on credit and makes payments after sales.  She wants to use the loan to buy more vegetables and spices to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education. She is a member of a community group called “Shining Star Trust Group”. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices for resale

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE PUQUIN”; son naturales de la ciudad del Cusco, son vecinos del barrio de santiago en la calle Lorena.

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar sus diferentes comercios; Entre las socias, tienen tienda abarrotes, restaurante en su barrio, venta de desayunos ambulantes (quinua con leche y un pedazo de torta), venta de vestidos para fiestas y ternos en la calle tecte, un socio es albañil, otro tiene su stand en el centro comercial el molino y vende licores y aperitivos, otra socia tiene un stand escolar dentro del colegio San Vicente. Todos nuestros socios desean el préstamo para poder invertir en sus diferentes negocios e implementarlos.

Los socios valoran el apoyo prestado mediante este medio y se comprometen en cumplir con sus pagos en los meses programados.
texts.en:
The partners of the “Virgen Natividad de Puquin” communal bank are natives of the city of Cuzco, on Lorena Street, near the Santiago neighborhood. The partners divide their time between their household activities and their various businesses, which include a grocery store, a neighborhood restaurant, the sale of breakfast to-go (quina [balsam seeds] with milk and a slice of cake), and the sale of festive suits and dresses. On Tecte Street, one partner is a bricklayer, while another owns a stand in the Molino commercial center, selling liquors and liqueurs. Another partner owns a stand inside San Vicente High School. All the partners would like loans to invest in their various entrepreneurial businesses. The partners appreciate the support lent to them through this system, and they agree to repay their loans according to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run their businesses.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. LUCILA, ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años, es casada  y tiene 3 hijos, la menor tiene 19 años, y juntas trabajan en su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en ella vende diferentes productos como los que son (arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas, leche, aceite, harinas, entre otros). L a socia requiere l préstamo para poder así implementar su pequeña tienda y tener mayor rentabilidad.

Nuestra socia se muestra sumamente contenta por el apoyo y préstamo otorgado, agradeciendo la oportunidad prestada se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos en los plazos dispuestos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila lives 30 minutes away from the city of Cuzco in the San Jeronimo district.

Mrs. Lucila is 55 years old and married. She has three children, the youngest of whom is 19, and together they work from home at the family business. She owns a grocery story, selling various products, including rice, sugar, pasta, cookies, milk, oil, and flour. Mrs. Lucila needs a loan to run her store and to improve her profitability.

Extremely grateful for this opportunity and pleased with the loan awarded to her, Mrs. Lucila agrees to repay her loan in the agreed-upon period.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. According to her, both of her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Florence works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver while she is a trader. She trades in printed textiles and jewels. She procures the goods from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. Florence also treks to sell in other towns as well. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hoping to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. VICENTINA; Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 50 años de edad y es casada, tiene 5 hijos el menor de sus hijos tiene 23 años de edad y estudia en la superior, la socia tiene un pequeño puesto o stand en el mercado vino canchon en San Jerónimo, en este mercado la socia vende verduras al por mayor y menos, ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar y así implementar su negocio en el mercado.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda total en  el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Vicentina lives in San Jerónimo, Peru, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is fifty years old, married and has five children. The youngest is 23 and in the final year of higher education.

Vicentina has a small stand in the Vino Chanchon market where she sells vegetables wholesale and to the public. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more vegetables and expand her business in the market. Vicentina sends her gratitude and values your willingness to make this loan. She is committed to fully repaying her debt according to the set term.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell vegetables wholesale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma N. manages a small sari-sari store. She is 36 years old and has 3 children. She wants to have bigger store some day. She works very hard to be able to sustain her business and provide for the needs of her family. Aside from having a store, her family grows rice which they use to buy their other needs.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. The loan will also help her get better income for her family.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. They provide not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa I. is forty-six years old. She is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. According to her, one of her children is currently in senior high school while the rest are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver. Hawa is a food vendor. She sells plantain chips. She fries them in her house and sells them by the roadside. She also hawks to sell. Hawa procures plantains and vegetable oil from the local market. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure plantains in bulk. Hawa is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy plantains

loans.name: Sadio Aissatou

texts.fr: Sadio Aissatou Baldé, 52 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des produits de consommation divers pour les revendre sur table. Elle veut renforcer son petit commerce.
texts.en:
Sadio Aissatou Baldé, 52, is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 4 years. Her business consists of buying various foodstuffs to re-sell on a table top. She wants to reinforce her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of various items on table top

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is sixty years old. She has been a widow for some years now. She has nine children, five sons and four daughters. According to her, all are out of school. Some are learning trades while others are married and working. Yaa lives with some of her grandchildren in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Yaa works very hard to provide for the grandchildren. She is a trader. She trades in all kinds of food items such as cooking oil, vegetables, fish, etc. Yaa sells on a table top in front of her house. She procures the goods from Accra. Yaa has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure the goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk for resale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra.TEODORA; vive en el barrio D. suncco, en el distrito D. San Jerónimo, está situado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años D. edad es casada y tiene 7 hijos, el menor tiene 17 años y aún vive con ella, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura y el comercio D. verduras y semillas, nuestra socia trabaja las tierras que por herencia sus padres le dejaron aún en vida, ella viene sembrando y cosechando cada año, y estás mismas las lleva a vender al mercado D. San Jerónimo, ella ahora solicita el préstamo para poder comprar e implementar un puesto en el mercado y comprar más semillas para trabajar sus tierras.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete
texts.en:
Teodora lives in the Suncco neighborhood of San Jerónimo, located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 49 years old and the mother of 7 children. The youngest is 17 and still lives with her at home.

In addition to maintaining her home, Teodora is involved in agriculture and the sale of vegetables and seeds. She works the land that her parents have given to her, planting and harvesting every year. She then goes on to sell them herself in the market of San Jerónimo.

Teodora is requesting this loan in order to run her stand in the market and to buy more seeds to plant. She sends her gratituD. and is committed to its repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run her stand and buy more seeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is forty – five years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. According to her, all are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Victoria works very hard to support her husband provide for the family. She is a trader. She fries donuts and supplies them to retailers. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra. Victoria has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy donut ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Monoka

texts.fr: Cette dame a quitté l’intérieur du pays pour venir s’installer à Lomé,  pour pouvoir  subvenir  à ses besoins elle a entamé le commerce de jus et d’eau en sachet appelé « Pure Water » depuis 2007. il y a une école primaire près du lieu d’exercice de son activité ce qui favorise son activité et augmente ses recettes car à la sortie les écoliers viennent acheter chez elle du jus. Elle veut agrandir son commerce. elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 01 sac de sucre, 20 sachets d’eau pure Water, 02 cuvettes de citron, 30 sachets de jus et divers.
texts.en:
This lady left the interior of the country to come set herself up in Lomé, so as to support herself. She began selling juice and bags of water called « Pure Water » in 2007. There is a primary school near her sales point which helps her business and increases her receipts since the school children come and buy juice from her when school gets out. She wants to expand her business. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 1 sack of sugar, 20 bags of "Pure Water", 2 basins of lemons, 30 bags of juice, and various other items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sugar, bags of water called "PURE WATER"

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. SOFIA; ella vive en miraflores la cantuta A-3, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 meses, ella alterna sus actividades y su labor de madre con la venta de productos por catálogo, ella trabaja con 3 líneas y una de ella vende ropa y carteras por catálogo, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder hacer un pedido mayor de sus productos y estos venderlos a sus clientas en las diferentes fechas que no llegan los pedidos.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a pagar toda su deuda en el tiempo estipulado, ella está muy feliz por este apoyo y valora y bendice a las personas que hacen posible todo esto.
texts.en:
This client is Sofia and she lives in Mirafloras, La Cantuta A-3, located about 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Sofia is 24 years old and lives with her 6-month-old baby and his father. She balances her activities and her work as a mother with the sale of products by catalogue. She works with three lines, one being a line of clothing and bags via catalogue. She is requesting a loan to make a large order of products, which she will sell to her customers on those occasions when orders do not arrive.

Sofia is thankful for this loan and is committed to paying it all back within the designated time. She is very happy for this assistance and appreciates and blesses the people who have made this all possible

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty and clothing products for sale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zaida Esperanza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. ZAIDA, ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años un hijo de 8 años de edad y ella es madre soltera, alternas sus actividades del hogar y de madre, con el comercio minorista en cuanto a la venta de productos de belleza a través de catálogos, ella solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en la compra de mas productos de belleza y así ubicarlos en la tienda de una amiga para la venta al público en general.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y de la misma manera se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zaida lives in the San Jerónimo District, thirty minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 32 years old and has an 8 year old son. She is a single mother and takes care of both the home and her responsibilities as a mother. She has a retail business selling cosmetics through catalog orders. She applied for this loan so she can purchase extra cosmetics to sell in her friend's shop. Mrs. Zaida is grateful for the loan, and she promises to pay it off according to the agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetics from catalogs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima M. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. She says all her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. Alima lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver while she is a food vendor. She sells fried yam and fish. Alima procures tubers of yam all the way from Atebubu in the northern sector. She sells by the road side from afternoon to evening. Alima has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy yam in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret B. is fifty-four years old. She is widowed and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She says one of her daughters has completed senior high school and is yet to continue. Her sons are currently in junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works very hard to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She sells kenkey. She prepares it in her house and hawks to sell. Margaret procures bags of maize and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Margaret is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Niara

texts.fr: Niara Cissé, 25 ans est célibataire avec 02 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité est la restauration  Elle compte acheter des provisions pour la préparation des repas. Niara veut renforcer  son activité et améliorer la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Niara Cissé, 25, is single and raising 2 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for five and a half years. Her business is selling cooked food. She wants to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Naira wants to reinforce her business so as to support her children better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for her little restaurant

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is a trader. She runs a cold store for her community, selling fresh fish and chicken. Her store is in her house. Grace supplies food vendors. She procures the goods from Accra. She works to help her husband provide financially for the family. Her husband works at the community hospital. 
Grace is 29 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children--all sons. All of her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central region of Ghana. 
Grace has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and chicken

loans.name: Nebasfeh

texts.en:
G. is a father of one child and makes a living by building beds and raising chickens. He lives in Bamenda, the same town that GHAPE is located in, and runs his business there. With this loan, G. plans to purchase wood or "plank", varnish, animal feed and two chickens.

This is G.'s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He has been doing well with his bed-making business, he says, because he uses good materials and has friends.

Having faced challenges with this business, being sick and even being poor, G. continues to keep his business afloat. He says, with the loan profits he will look to provide for his family and their needs, as well as take care of his house. G. takes out GHAPE loans because he knows by taking out a loan that he will have to work hard and he likes the encouragement.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy wood, varnish, chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El señor Paulino Leytón P. , tiene la edad de 41 años , habita en el barrio , Piedra quemada municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle estudio para que se preparen sus hijos y comprar un terreno propio , don Paulino desde hace veinte años trabaja como agricultor , el mayor problema es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio los trabajos agrícolas con sus propios esfuerzos , con el financiamiento va a comprar  fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para aplicarse a su cultivo y poder tener una producción. Con esto espera poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Paulino Leytón P. is 41 years old. He lives in the Piedra Municipio neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who helps him with household expenses. They have two children who are currently students. His desires for his family are to send his children to school, and to buy land. Paulino has worked as a farmer for twenty years. His biggest problem is lack of financing. He started his agricultural work with his own efforts. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and the necessary equipment to work on his land and to have a good harvest. With this, he hopes to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment and fertilizers to increase production

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité le commerce de gravier, il est marié et père de 02 enfants. C’est avec le surplus de revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges du foyer, il fait ce commerce depuis 2003. Il a reçu une commande d’un de ses clients qu’il ne peut satisfaire car ne disposant pas de moyens, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour convoyer 1 camion de 25 mètre cube de gravier.
texts.en:
This gentleman has a business selling gravel. He is married and the father of 2 children. The profit from his little business allows him to support his household. He has been in this business since 2003. He has received an order from one of his customers that he cannot fill because he lacks working capital, so he has asked WAGES for his first loan to be able to deliver 1 truckload of 25 cubic meters of gravel.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of gravel for re-sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is 47 years old and has been a widow for five years. She has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. According to her, one of her daughters is currently in primary school. The first son has completed university, while the rest are learning trades. Elizabeth lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works very hard to provide for the family. Elizabeth is a baker. She bakes bread. She hawks to sell the bread in her community. Elizabeth also distributes the greater part of the bread to retailers and beverage sellers. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in this business for over 30 years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T. is a trader, selling charcoal. She sells the charcoal on a tabletop in her community. She procures bags of charcoal from nearby communities.Victoria also sells onions. She distributes to retailers and food vendors. 
Victoria is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children have completed school and learned trades. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central region of Ghana. 
Victoria works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in this business for over 20 years and wants a loan to procure bags of charcoal in bulk. Victoria is hoping to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Patricia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Patricia del Socorro M., tiene la edad de 30 años, habita en el barrio San Francisco, ubicado en el municipio de Nidirí, junto a su esposo en el trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo un hijo de siete años, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y vivir dignamente, ella desde hace 20 años, se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, con sus propios esfuerzos y el de su papá ha logrado sacar producción , pero con resultados no factibles , ya que estos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos . Lo cual con el financiamiento obtenido van a comprar dicho fertilizantes, esperando con esto poder tener mejores resultado en la producción, da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Patricia del Socorro M. is 30 years old and lives in the San Francisco neighborhood in Nidirí. She and her husband work together to cover their living expenses. They have a seven-year-old son. She would like to improve their living conditions and live decently. She has been working as in agriculture for 20 years. She and her father have had some production success, but it is unsustainable without fertilizers and other supplies. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, with the hope of achieving better results. She is grateful to the organization for making this progress possible.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizer to improve production

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul A. is a welder by profession. He also deals in vehicle spare parts such as steering wheel covers, crankshafts, etc. He procures goods from Accra and sells them from a workshop in his community. He works very hard to provide for his family. His wife is also a trader. 
Paul is 42 years old. He is married and has five children: four sons and one daughter. All his children are currently in senior high and  primary schools. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in the busy fishing and commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central region of Ghana. 
Paul has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure more car spare parts and working materials such as filler, brake fluid, filters, etc. He is hoping to expand his business and give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Chester Misael

texts.es: El señor Chester Misael Ríos , tiene la edad de 31 años , habita en el barrio la porcina , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen su cargo dos hijos , uno de diez que actualmente estudia y una niña de tres años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , para poder darle un mejor bienestar , don Chester desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los cual le afectado enormemente ya que su cultivo carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesaR. lo cual provoca un cultivo con pocas fuerzas. Con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para poder obtener mejores resultados y vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Chester Misael Ríos is 31-years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Porcina (The Pig), located in Ticuantepe municipality, along with his wife, who works as a merchant to help him with household expenses. They are responsible for their two children, a 10-year old boy who is in school and a 3-year old little girl. His plan for his family is to improve the family's living conditions to provide better well-being. Chester has worked in agriculture for 10 years; his greatest difficulty is the lack of financing which affects him immensely. His farm already lacks fertilizer and other necessary supplies, causing weak yields. With this loan he will buy supplies and fertilizer to obtain better crops which he can sell for a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizer to improve his farm.

loans.name: Kadiatou Th

texts.fr: Kadiatou Th D., 43 ans est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans. Kadiatou achète des arachides pour les  transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Kadiatou Th D., age 43, is married and the mother of 6 children. She's been a member of the Sinthiang Coundara village bank for 4 years. Kadiatou buys peanuts and transform them into peanut butter that she sells. She wants to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell peanut butter

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Prolongación la Merced Nº 778, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Siendo la madera un insumo importante para la confección de muebles no vio mejor oportunidad que dedicarse a la compra venta de maderas al por mayor y menor, negocio que lo desarrolla en su mismo hogar con el apoyo de su esposo, atendiendo pedidos de las carpinterías y ebanisterías mas importante de la ciudad y la región. Entre sus clientes es muy reconocida por la calidad de las maderas que vende y por el buen trato que les brinda.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 06 meses, comprará cuartones de madera como tornillo, cedro, caoba, ishpingo entre variedades que son muy apreciadas para la confección de muebles de sala, comedor, cocina, oficinas.  Nancy es una mujer muy emprendedora y perseverante, cualidades que sirven de ejemplo para otras mujeres que como ella quiere salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Trabajadores" ("The Hard Workers"). She lives at Prolongación la Merced No 778, Juanui District, San Martín Department. She is married, 37 years old and mother of 2 children who still depend on her.

As wood is a very important material in the production of furniture, she saw a great opportunity in buying and selling wood, wholesale and retail. She has developed this business in her own home with the support of her husband. They fill orders from the most important carpenters and cabinet-makers in the region. She is renowned among her clients for the quality of wood that she sells and or the good service that she ofers.

With this loan of 3000 Peruvian nuevo soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy planks of wood of tornillo, cedar, mahogany, ishpingo, among other varieties that are highly demanded for making furniture for living rooms, dining rooms, kitchens and offices. Nancy is very enterprising and persevering, qualities which serve as a good example for other women like her who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different types of wood

loans.name: Denise

texts.es:
La señora Denise, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Mariscal Castilla  Cuadra 1, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, dos de cuales estudian en un colegio secundario. Motivada por su experiencia en la crianza de gallinas se amino a convertir esto en un negocio, se inició en muy pequeña escala, invirtió los  S/. 300.00 del crédito que recibió, obteniendo muy buenos resultados por lo que continúa con este negocio hasta la actualidad, en su propia casa.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 06 meses, comprará  80 gallinas ponedoras de huevos, vitaminas, alimento balanceados en sacos para mantener las aves sanas y gordas y puedan producir mejor. Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Denise belongs to the “Las Trabajadoras” community bank. She lives at Jr. Mariscal Castilla Cuadra 1, Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is 40, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Two of her children are in secondary school. Motivated by her experience raising chickens, she turned it into a business. She started on a very small scale. She invested 300 PEN from a loan she received. She got very good results, and the business is still doing well. The business is located at her house. She will repay this loan for 1,500 PEN in six months. She will buy eighty egg laying hens, vitamins, and balanced food in sacks to keep the birds healthy, fat, and able to produce more. She feels happy about the work and service offered by Manuela Ramos. She is grateful that they support people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes Manuela Ramos continues to do so for a very long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, vitamins, food for the birds

loans.name: Queli Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Queli Amelia A. G. tiene 25 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión y esfuerzo y vive en el caserío Túpac Amaru del distrito de Carabamba en la provincia de Julcán en el departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió por su propio esfuerzo hasta quinto año de secundaria, pero ya no continuó con la educación superior por falta de apoyo familiar.  Queli Amelia es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años.
Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su caserío.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles , lo invirtió en la compra de ropa.
Con este crédito de 700 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en azúcar, arroz, galletas  y cerveza.
Queli sueña con tener un negocio grande y apoyar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Queli Amelia A. G., 25, belongs to Banco Comunal Unión, and lives and works in the Túpac Amaru housing, Carabamba District, Julcán Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She worked hard up to the fifth year of secondary school, but then was not able to continue with higher education because she lacked family support. Queli Amelia is a single mother with a 6-year-old son. She has a small shop in her neighborhood. She invested her first loan of $100 in clothing. With this current loan of $250 that will be paid back in 4 installments, she will invest in sugar, rice, cookies and beer. Queli dreams of having a larger business and being able to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, cookies and beer

loans.name: Flor Gerardina

texts.es:
La señora Flor Gerardina B. V., tiene 44 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega y vive en el distrito de Carabamba provincia de Julcán departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó educación primaria a los 15 años y se casó de inmediato, por lo que no continuó estudiando.  Actualmente tiene 3 hijos, solamente uno depende de ella.
En su bodega vende pan, cerveza, galletas, mercería, jamones que ella misma elabora y champan.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles, el cual canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en harina para hacer pan.
Con este crédito de 1200 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en comprar insumos para su negocio (pan, embutidos y cerveza).
Flor desea ver a sus hijos siempre felices pero con una profesión para poder defenderse en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Flor Gerardina B. V., 44, belongs to Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega and lives in Carabamba District, Julcán Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She ended her primary education at 15 years old and immediately married, which is why she stopped her education. Currently she has 3 children, only one still dependent on her. In her shop she sells bread, beer, cookies, notions, hams that she makes herself, and champagne. Her first loan of $100, that she paid off in 4 installments, was invested in flour to make bread. This loan of $425, which will also be paid off in 4 installments, will be invested in supplies for her business (bread, cold meats, and beer). Flor wishes to see her children happy with a profession so they can get by in life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her business (bread, cold meats, and beer)

loans.name: Claber Jasinta

texts.es:
La señora Claber Jasinta C. D. R. tiene 57 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen vive en la calle Alfonso Ugarte del sector Cochaya caserío D. Salpo, D. la provincia D. Otuzco departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta cuarto grado D. educación primaria, pero no continuo estudiando porque no tenía apoyo D. sus padres.
Se caso a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales dependen D. ella 3.
Su actividad económica consiste en la cria D. animales, fabricación D. queso y quesillo.
El primer crédito recibido fue D. 300 soles los que canceló en 4 cuotas, recuerda con mucha alegría que con el primer préstamo compró queso, carne D. cerdo y carnero, los que volvió a vender a muy buen precio.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en medicina (fertilizantes) para la chacra.
Claber sueña con tener un buen capital para poder invertir en negocios diversos.
texts.en:
Señora Claber Jasinta C. D. R., 57, belongs to Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen and lives on Alfonso Ugarte Street, Cochaya area, Salpo district, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She studied to fourth graD. primary school, but did not continue studying because she did not have her parents' support. She married at 19 and has 5 children, 3 still dependent on her. Her business is raising animals and making cheeses. She remembers her first loan of $105, repaid in 4 installments, happily because she was able to buy cheese, pork, and mutton, which she brought back and sold at a very good profit. With this loan of $175, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in fertilizers for the land. Claber dreams of having capital to invest in various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for her fields

loans.name: Petronila I.

texts.es:
La señora Petronila tiene 52 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega, vive en el caserío D. Carabamba, provincia D. Julcán Departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa y se casó a los 15 años, aun siendo una niña, por lo que piensa que no tenia suficiente madurez para manejar su hogar, tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales solamente uno depenD. D. ella. Actualmente vive separada D. su esposo.
VenD. molidos distintos (especerías) y los días domingo venD. comida en forma ambulatoria.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles fue cancelado en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en su negocio, compró arroz, fideos y otros productos para sus comidas.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1000, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. insumos para preparar comida rápida.
texts.en:
Señora Petronila, 52, belongs to Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega, and lives in the Carabamba neighborhood, Julcán Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She completed her primary education and married at 15, although she was still a girl and feels that she was not mature enough to manage the household. She has 7 children, only one of whom is still dependent on her. She is currently living apart from her husband. She sells various ground spices, and on Sundays she sells meals as a street vendor. Her first loan of $105, paid back in 4 installments, was invested in her business, buying rice, noodles, and other products for her meals. With this loan of $350, which will also be paid back in 4 installments, she will invest in supplies to prepare her quick meals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to prepare her quick meals

loans.name: Kely Betty

texts.es:
La señora Kely Betty R. C. tiene 37 años pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen y vive en el sector de Cochaya en el caserío de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta sexto ciclo de educación superior pero no pudo concluir por falta de recursos económicos.
Se casó de 25 años y aun no tiene hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de abarrotes en una pequeña bodega.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en cuatro cuotas compró fertilizantes para agricultura.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará víveres para su bodega (arroz, azúcar, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas).
Kely desea comprarse una casa en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Señora Kely Betty R. C., 37, belongs to Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen and lives in the Cochaya area, Salpo district, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She studied up to her sixth year of secondary education, but was not able to finish because of lack of economic resources. She married at 25 and has no children yet. Her principal business is selling groceries in a small shop. Her first loan of $105, repaid in 4 installments, was for agricultural fertilizer. With this loan of $275, which will also be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy supplies for her shop (rice, sugar, candy, and soft drinks). Kely would like to buy herself a house in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her shop (rice, sugar, candy, and soft drinks)

loans.name: Kely Betty

texts.es:
La señora Kely Betty R. C.  tiene 37 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen y vive en el sector de Cochaya en el caserío de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta sexto ciclo de educación superior pero no pudo concluir por falta de recursos económicos.
Se casó a los 25 años y aun no tiene hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de insumos para la preparación de alimentos en una pequeña bodega.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en cuatro cuotas compró fertilizantes para agricultura.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará víveres para su bodega (arroz, azúcar, pan y bebidas gaseosas)
Kely desea comprarse una casa en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kely Betty R. C., 37, belongs to the Virgen del Carmen community bank. She lives in the Cochaya sector, Salpo village, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Perú. She attended school up until the sixth cycle of secondary education. She could not finish for lack of economic resources. She got married when she was 25; she does not yet have children. Her primary business is selling supplies for food preparation in a small mini market. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she repaid in four payments, she bought fertilizer for farming. With this loan for 800 PEN, which she will repay in six payments, she will buy supplies for her mini market (rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks). Kely wishes to buy a house in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her mini market (rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen , pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Mariscal Castilla  s/n, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 56 años, 06 hijos, dos aun dependen de ella y son quienes también le ayudan en el negocio. Se inicio en la venta de menestras cocinadas hace muchos años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un pequeño capital que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades, además le agrego a esto la venta de otros productos como esencias de frutas para refrescos, verduras cocinadas y picadas para ensaladas, negocio que le va muy bien.   Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 que cancelara en 06 cuotas, comprará menestras regionales y de la costa en sacos y en diferentes variedades, así mismo comprará verduras como zanahorias, papas, veterraga, vainitas, alverjas en kilos, y frutas como taperibas, maíz morado, piñas, guayabas brasileras en cajones  para elaborar sus esencias  y así satisfacer el exigente pedido de su clientela. Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the “Las Trabajadoras” community bank. She lives at Jr. Mariscal Castilla s/n, Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is 56, in a common law marriage, and has six children.
