Two of the children are still dependent upon her, and they help her with the business. With the intention of helping her family with expenses, she started selling cooked stews many years ago. She used a small amount of money that was well invested. She still has the same business, but she now deals with bigger quantities. Also, she has added the sale of other products like fruit flavors for drinks, and cooked and diced vegetables for salads. The business is going well for her. With this loan for 2,000 PEN, which she will repay in six payments, she will buy sacks of a variety of regional legumes from the coast. In order to make her flavorings and satisfy the discerning customer orders; she will also buy vegetables like carrots, potatoes, beets, green beans, kilos of beans, and fruits like golden apples, purple corn, and boxed Brazilian guavas. She has shown her pleasure in belonging, for so many years, to a group of women that has helped her overcome difficulties. Now she faces her difficulties with more strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy legumes, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La señora Laura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Mariscal Castilla  Nº 117, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos estudiantes que aun dependen de ella. Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su mamá emprendió un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicado en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 06 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Laura is a member of the communal bank "Las Trabajoras." She lives in San Martin, in the Juanjui district, at 117 Jr. Mariscal Castilla. Laura is 37 years old and the mother of 2 children, both of whom are students. Motivated by the need to make a living, and by her mother, Laura began a small business selling groceries with her first loan of 300 soles. Her business has been successful since the beginning due to the quality of her products, her good prices, and the way she attends her clients. Currently she is continuing with the same business of selling groceries to her neighbors from the store in her home. With this loan of 1,500 soles (that will be paid off in 6 months), Laura will buy more products to stock her store. She'll buy things like: rice, sugar, supplies for personal hygiene, cleaning supplies, soft drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her clients happy. She is very happy to be able to do this work and receive this sort of help. Laura is also grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes Manuela Ramos will keep doing what it's doing and help many families and female entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juanita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Grimaldo Reàtegui   Nº 249, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 2 niña y 1 niño, los cuales aun dependen de ella y los que la alientan a seguir superando las dificultades que se le presentan.  La fortaleza y la perseverancia que la caracteriza la motivó a crear su propio negocio de venta de flores y regalos (esto gracias al primer crédito de S/. 300.00 que recibió).  De ahí en adelante, día a día, fue ganando clientela dado al buen trato que les brinda y los precio bajos que oferta. Actualmente continua con este negocio pero ya ampliado con otros productos considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son sus amigos y vecinos del barrio donde vive. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio, como ropa para bebes, flores artificiales, artículos para regalos como accesorios para cocina, peluches, juguetes, cosméticos. Ella nos manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con prestamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Juanita is a member of the communal bank "Las Trabajadoras." She lives in San Martin, in the Juanjui district, at 249 Jr. Grimaldo Reategui. Juanita is married, 36 years old, and the mother of 3 children (2 girls and 1 boy). Her children are what motivate her to face the difficulties life presents her with. Because Juanita is a strong woman who works hard, she was able to start her own business, selling flowers and gifts, with her first loan of 300 soles. Day-by-day she worked to grow her client base by treating her clients well and offering good prices. Currently she is continuing with the same business, but she is expanding. She will sell more products because of the high demand from her neighbors and friends, who are her clients. With this loan of 1,500 soles (that will be paid off in 6 months) she will buy more products to stock her store. She will purchase items like: baby clothes, artificial flowers, and gift items like kitchen accessories, stuffed animals, toys, and make up. She tells us that she is very optimistic and grateful for the opportunity to get a loan which helps her develop as a woman and as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de ropa para bebes, flores artificiales, accesorios para cocina, peluches, juguetes, cosméticos

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
La señora Gudelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el J. Tomas Aguirre   Cuadra 04 –, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 46 años y es madre de 02 hijos varones y  01 mujer, que aun están en etapa escolar por lo tanto depende de ella, pero también son el motor que le impulsan a seguir adelante.  Deseosa de aportar económicamente al ingreso familiar, con un pequeño capital que tenia inicia su negocio de venta diaria de jugos de frutas, refrigerios a los que agregó la venta de discos musicales, instalándose en un puesto de venta en los interiores del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Juanjui  en la que atiende con mucho gusto a sus clientes que son los moradores que acuden a hacer sus compras en dicho mercado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelara en un plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá, ampliando e implementando su negocio con frutas que los compra en cajones como papayas, naranjas, manzanas, taperibas, guineos para la preparación de los jugos así como harina, azúcar, mantequilla, huevos y esencias para la preparación de kekes y empanadas  y así satisfacer el paladar de su clientela, también comprará discos compactos de música variada para vender a sus clientes continuos.
Su permanencia a este grupo le ha permitido desarrollar su seguridad e independencia.  Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como persona y como empresaria.
texts.en:
Gudelia belongs to the “Las Trabajadoras" community bank. She lives at J. Tomas Aguirre Cuadra 04 –,Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is 46, in a common law marriage, and has two sons and a daughter who are still school age. They depend upon her, but they are also the motor that pushes her to keep going. Wishing to add to the family income, she used a small amount of money that she had to start her business. Every day she sells fruit juice and snacks, and she has started selling musical records. She put up a stand in the food market in the city of Juanjui. She waits on her customers, local residents who shop at the market, with pleasure. With a loan of 1,500 PEN, which she will repay in six months, she will amplify her business with boxes of fruit like papayas, oranges, apples, golden apples, and green bananas to make juices. She will also buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs and extracts to prepare kekes (traditional Peruvian pastry) and empanadas. This will satisfy her customers’ palates. She will also buy various music compact discs to sell to her non stop customers. Her membership in this group has permitted her to develop her security and independence. She is greatly appreciative of Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a person and as a business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits (papayas, oranges, apples), flour, eggs, compact discs

loans.name: Adria Celmira

texts.es:
La señora Adria Celmira tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú. Ella estudio Primaria Completa.
Adria se dedica a la venta D. sandalias D. vestir (calzado).  Inició su negocio con la venta D. utensilios D. cocina, por motivos D. comodidad y economía, empezó a dedicarse a la fabricación D. sandalias, lo distribuye por diversos mercados D. la provincia D. Trujillo, la fabricación del calzado lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra D. utensilios D. cocina.
Con el crédito D. 800 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales para la fabricación D. sandalias (plantas, badana, cintos D. colores).
Adria tiene como sueño mejorar la calidad del calzado que fabrica con diseños exclusivos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adria Celmira, 56, lives in the Florencia D. Mora district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She completed elementary school. Adria sells sandals (footwear). She started her business by selling kitchen utensils. For comfort and economic reasons she started to make sandals. She delivers them to various markets in the Trujillo province. She makes the sandals in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from her community bank, Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, she bought kitchen utensils. With this loan for 800 PEN, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy materials for making sandals (soles, leather, and colored straps). Adriana’s dream is to improve the quality of footwear that she makes with exclusive designs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making sandals (soles, leather, and colored straps).

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juanita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Prolongación Alfonso Ugarte   Nº 114 –, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es viuda, tiene 73 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 02 D. los cuales aun dependen D. ella y son los que le ayudan en el negocio. Con la seguridad D. tener una buena sazón para la preparación D. diferentes tipos D. comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio D. venta D. comida diaria tipo menú, ubicando su negocio en los interiores del mercado D. Abastos D. la ciudad D. Juanjui. En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su puesto D. venta, donD. ella los atienD. con el carisma que le caracteriza. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00 que cancelara en un plazo D. 06 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como sacos D. arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Pese a la edad que tiene se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquita, Juanita, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Juanita belongs to the “Las Trabajadoras” community bank. She lives at Prolongación Alfonso Ugarte Nº 114 –, Juanjui district , San Martín department. She is a 73 year old widow with six children. Two of her children are still dependent upon her, and they help her with the business. With the security of having a special touch for preparing different types of foods, with her own initiative, and with her first loan for 300 PEN, she started her business. She sells menu item type foods daily. Her business is located insiD. the food market in the city of Juanjui. In spite of all the time passed, she continues with the same business. She can count on loyal customers who go to her stall daily where she waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 1,500 PEN, which she will repay in six months, she will buy ingredients for daily food preparation like sacks of rice, sugar, packages of oil, live chickens in crates, and some kitchen utensils to use in her business to give her customers better service. In spite of her age, she still feels she has lots of strength to keep working and get ahead to assure herself of a peaceful old age. Juanita is grateful to the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the completion of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy supplies like rice, sugar, packages of oil, chicken, utensils

loans.name: Segunda Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Segunda Esperanza tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Segunda se dedica a la venta de artículos al por menor (hilos, sombreros, lentes, lozas y artículos variados).
El crédito de Manuela Ramos le permitió incrementar su negocio, actualmente su mercadería lo distribuye por los mercados la Hermelinda, Policlino, Alto Trujillo (ubicados en la provincia de Trujillo).
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de sombreros.
Con el crédito de 400 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería (gorros). Viajará a Lima (ciudad) para realizar la compra.
Segunda tiene como sueño poner una bodega y comprar una moto para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Segunda Esperanza is 50 years old, and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, Trujillo province, Libertad department, Peru. She studied in highschool, and has two children who are economically dependent on her. Segunda sells retail items (yarn, hats, glasses, crockery and other items). Manuela Ramos' loan will help her business grow, she currently distributes merchandise to the markets in Hermelinda, Policlinico and Trujillo Alto (located in the Trujillo province). With the first credit of 300 soles she received from the Village Bank United for a Better Future II, she purchased hats. With the current loan of 400 soles that will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (hats). She will travel to Lima (the city) to make the purchase. Segunda has a dream to have a mini store and to buy a motorcycle, so as to increase their income and improve the quality of life of her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (hats)

loans.name: Sully Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora Sulli Vanesa es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñay del Distrito de Puno, Provincia y Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Barrio Victoria de la ciudad de Puno, y cuenta con estudios de superiores – contabilidad (no concluido).

La señora viene trabajando con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de articulas de primera necesidad.
Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, le permitirá incrementar y surtir su negocio, comprará jugos, galletas, fideos, embutidos, gaseosa y golosinas. Su mayor deseo es culminar su carrera y poder trabajar independientemente.
Lo que más le gusta de suBanco Comunal es el cumplimiento de las socias y la armonía que existe dentro su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sully Vanesa is a member of the Wiñay Communal Bank in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 22 years old, single, and has one son. She lives in the Victoria neighborhood in the city of Puno and is working on university studies in accounting. She has worked with Kiva partner The Manuela Ramos Movement for three years and began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business selling essential products. With this loan of 1,500 new soles, she will be able to expand and stock her business. She will buy juices, cookies, noodles, sausages, sodas, and sweets. Her greatest wish is to finish her studies and be able to work independently. The things she enjoys most about her communal bank are the successes of the members and the harmony that exists within the group.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy juices, cookies, noodles, sausages, sodas, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Loreto  Nº 111–, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 37 años, un hijito pequeño aun en etapa escolar.  Estudio enfermería técnica - conocimientos que los pone en practica cuando sus familiares y vecinos requieren de sus servicio. 
Motivada por su espíritu joven y su energía emprendedora con un capital de S/. 250.00 inició su  propio negocio de venta de mercería, juguetes y cosméticos, productos que los ofrece en su puesto de ventas en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Juanjui, habiéndose hecho de muy buena clientela a quienes los atiende con su carisma y buen trato. 
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio esta satisfecha con lo que hace.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo de 06 meses, comprará  mercadería muy variada como juguetes de plástico para niños, productos de mercería como elástico en rollos, blondas con diferentes diseños, hilos y botones en diferentes colores y tamaños, cosméticos como colonias, cremas, lápiz labiales, esmaltes de diferentes marcas, todo esto hará que su clientela aumente y este contenta y por lo tanto sus ganancias serán mayores.Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto asu familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos belongs to the Workers Communal Bank and lives at No. 111 Loreto Street, in the district of Juanjui, department of San Martín. She is a common-law wife, is 37 years old, and has a young son who is still in school. She studied technical nursing, training that she puts into practice when her family or neighbors need her services. Motivated by her youthful spirit and enterprising energy, she started her own business with 250 soles selling sewing supplies, toys, and cosmetics, products that she sells from her sales stall in the supply market in the city of Juanjui. She has great clientele to whom she attends with her charisma and good service. She currently has the same business and is happy with what she does. With this loan of 3,000 soles, which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy a variety of merchandise such as plastic children’s toys, sewing products such as rolls of elastic, lace in different designs, threads and buttons in different colors and sizes, and cosmetics such as colognes, creams, lip pencils, and nail polishes of various brands. This will allow her to expand her clientele and she is happy that her profits will increase. She feels very content because despite difficulties, she knew that she could get ahead alongside her family. She recognizes that she receives great support from Kiva partner The Manuela Ramos Movement, which has helped her and other women in the San Martín region.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic toys, sewing supplies, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ysolina Jackeline

texts.es:
La señora Ysolina Jackeline A. G. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella tiene estudios Superiores Completo (Enfermería Técnica), tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Ysolina se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, así como la elaboración de bocaditos; éste último lo realiza para eventos particulares; su negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de S/. 1000 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
Ysolina tiene como sueño crecer como empresaria y tener su propia tienda de perfumería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ysolina Jackeline A. G. is 35 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She has a college degree (technical nursing), and has a daughter that is financially dependent on her. Ysolina works selling beauty products and making snacks. She makes snacks in her own home for particular events. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from the United for a Better Future II Communal Bank, she invested in the purchase of beauty products. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which she will repay over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of a glass cabinet to display her products. Ysolina dreams of growing as a businesswoman and of having her own perfume shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a glass display case

loans.name: Tany Fiorella

texts.es:
La señora Tany Fiorella A. P. tiene 22 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella cursa estudios Superiores, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Tany se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cuando inicio ofrecía sus productos entre familiares y amigos que viven cerca de su casa, ahora también ofrece dichos productos en el centro de estudios, del cual ella forma parte.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de catálogos, productos de belleza y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos en su casa.
Tany tiene como sueño culminar sus estudios, realizarse como profesional y dar lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tany Fiorella A. P. is 22 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a college student and has a daughter who is financially dependent on her. Tany works selling beauty products and began by selling products to family members and friends who lived near her home. Now she also sells her products at the school where she is a student. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from the United for a Better Future II Communal Bank, she invested in the purchase of beauty products. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of catalogs, beauty products and a glass display case to display her products in her home. Tany dreams of finishing her studies, becoming a professional, and giving the best to her child.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy catalogs, beauty products and a glass display case

loans.name: Santos Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Santos Graciela tiene 54 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión y esfuerzo, vive en el caserío Túpac Amaru del distrito de Carabamba provincia de Julcán departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió solo hasta tercer grado de primaria por su propio esfuerzo debido a que estudiaba en la nocturna para poder mantenerse con su propio trabajo. Se casó a los 20 años y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente de ella.
Graciela tiene una bodega en su caserío, pero no es su única actividad económica también confecciona tejidos y elabora quesos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en insumos para la elaboración de pan, ya que en ese tiempo se dedicaba a ello.
Con este crédito de 2500 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra de cebada, animales e insumos para la preparación de alimentos para la bodega.
Santos sueña con salir de su tierra y comprar una casa en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Santos Graciela is 54 years old and belongs to the Unión y Esfuerzo (“Union and Effort”) cooperative bank. She lives in the town of Túpac Amaru, located in the Julcán province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied only until the third grade through her own effort, given she worked nights to be able to support herself through her work. She married at age 20, and has 4 children of whom only one still relies on her. Graciela has a general store in her town, but this is not her only economic means, as she also makes knitwear and cheeses. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, she invested in the purchase of bread-making ingredients, which is the activity she dedicated herself to at that time. With this loan of 2500 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will invest in the purchase of barley, animals, and supplies to make foods to carry in her store. Santos dreams of one day leaving her land and buying a house someplace else.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals and supplies to make foods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth tiene 22 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta el 4to de Educación Secundaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de tamales, inició su negocio vendiendo tamales en la esquina de su casa, ahora tiene su negocio frente al hospital EsSalud ubicado en su distrito, adicionando la preparación de tamales que realiza para eventos (trabaja con pedidos). 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de una canasta y maíz.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos (panca y maíz) para la preparación de tamales y en herramientas para la carpintería que administra en asociación con su esposo.
Elizabeth tiene como sueño brindarle la facilidad y mejores estudios para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 22 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora, province of Trujillo, located in La Libertad, Perú.  She studied until the 4th year of Secondary School, and has 4 children who depend on her economically. Elizabeth dedicates herself to the sale of tamales, having started by selling these on the street corner near her house. She now has her business in front of the hospital located in her district. She also makes special order tamales for events. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her cooperative bank Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II (“United for a Better Future II”), she invested in purchasing baskets and corn. With the loan of 1000 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in purchasing supplies (chili peppers and corn) to make tamales. She will also buy tools for the carpentry activities she carries out together with her husband. Elizabeth’s dream is to provide for her children, including giving them good educations.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies (chili peppers and corn) to make tamales.

loans.name: Lesly Judiht

texts.es:
La señora Lesly Judiht R. E. tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal  Alfa y Omega y vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria  pero ya no pudo continuar estudiando por falta de apoyo de sus padres. Se unió a su pareja a los 16 años y actualmente tiene 3 hijos los que dependen de ella económicamente.
Su actividad económica consiste en la venta de víveres y fruta en su bodega.  Paralelamente se dedica a la cría y engorde de animales menores.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró insumos para su bodega y alimentos para sus animales.
Con este crédito de 1500 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de queso.
texts.en:
Lesly Judiht R. E. is 27 years old and belongs to the Alpha and Omega cooperative bank. She lives in the Carabamba district, located in the Julcán province of La Libertad. She studied until the third year of secondary school, but her parents weren’t able to support her enough to continue her education. She married at 16 years of age, and currently has 3 children who depend on her financially. Her economic activity consists of selling provisions and fruits in her store. Concurrently, she raises and fattens small animals. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, she bought supplies for her store and feed for her animals. With this loan of 1500 soles, to be canceled in 4 installments, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for making cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making cheese.

loans.name: Ela Irma

texts.es:
La señora Ela Irma tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú. Ella estudio Secundaria Completa.
Tiene una bodega en donD. venD. bebidas gaseosas, galletas, golosinas y detergente; el crédito D. Manuela Ramos le ha permitido surtir su bodega, su negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
La empresaria recién ha iniciado con Manuela Ramos.
Con el crédito D. 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, recibido D. su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invertirá en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Ela tiene como sueño... continuar surtiendo su bodega, así como continuar con la construcción D. los dormitorios D. su domicilio.
texts.en:
Ela Irma is 52 years old and lives in the Florencia D. Mora province of Trujillo, located in La Libertad, Perú. She completed her Secondary School studies. She has a general store where she sells soft drinks, cookies, snacks and detergent. The loan from Manuela Ramos has allowed her to supply her store, and she carries out her business activities from her home. This entrepreneur has recently started to work with Manuela Ramos. With the loan of 300 soles she received from her cooperative bank “United for a Better Future II”, due to be canceled in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and cooking oil. Her dream….to continue supplying her store, as well as to complete construction of the rooms in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marcela Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Marcela Yolanda P.
texts.en: Marcela Yolanda P.

loans.use: To purchase speakers, and for maintenance of her sound equipment.

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Esther tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hija que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Gladys se dedica a la venta D. marcianos D. fruta (helados D. hielo) y postres (mazamorra y arroz con leche), inició su negocio vendiendo marcianos, con las ganancias generadas empezó con la preparación D. postres (pequeñas porciones), su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra D. fruta  (piña, guanábana, tamarindo) para la preparación D. los marcianos.
Con el crédito D. 2000 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. mazamorra y la compra D. una mesa para vender sus productos.
Gladys tiene como sueño comprar una computadora que facilite los estudios universitarios a su hija.
texts.en:
Gladys Esther is 46 years old and lives in the Florencia D. Mora district of the Trujillo province, located in Libertad, Perú.  She completed her Secondary School studies, and has 1 daughter who is financially dependent on her. Gladys dedicates herself to the sale of marcianos D. fruta (fruit ice cream treats) and desserts such as mazamorra (a maize-based jelly-like dessert) and arroz con leche (rice pudding). She started her business selling marcianos, and with the earnings she generated she started preparing and selling desserts (small portions). Her business activities take place in her house. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her cooperative bank “United for a Better Future II”, she invested in the purchase of fruit (pineapple, soursop, tamarind) to prepare her marcianos. With the loan of 2000 soles, to be canceled in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her mazamorra and a table to use for selling her products. Gladys dreams of one day buying a computer that can help her daughter with her university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making her mazamorra dessert, and a table.

loans.name: Cenaida

texts.es:
Cenaida es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Cenaida es conviviente tiene 39 años  cuatro hijos de 20, 16 9 y 1 año, los tres últimos están estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Cenaida empezó vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo, y a la vez trabaja limpiando  casa, también   vende ropa por pedido. 
Cenaida necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de una maquina de coser. 
Desde que esta  en Finca aprendió como administra el negocio y ser solidaria con los demás.
El sueño de Cenaida es tener un taller de costura  y tener un carro.
texts.en:
Cenaida is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras community bank. Cenaida, 39, is in a common law marriage. She has four children ages 20, 16, 9, and 1. The last three attend the state school. Cenaida started selling beauty products by catalog. She also works cleaning houses and selling clothes by request. Cenaida needs a loan for 1,600 PEN to buy a sewing machine. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to run her business and be supportive of others. Cenaida’s dream is to have a sewing shop and a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María Jesús R. C. tiene 34 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión y Esfuerzo y vive en el caserío Túpac Amaru del distrito de Carabamba en la provincia de Julcán en  el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primer grado de primaria pero ya no continuó debido a la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres.  Se casó a los 24 años y actualmente tiene dos hijos, los cuales dependen de ella económicamente.
María Jesús compra y vende cuajada para hacer queso (insumo para la elaboración de queso).
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, el cual fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, dicho dinero fue invirtido en compra de cuajada.
Con este crédito de 600 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de más cuajada y otros insumos para la elaboración de queso.
María sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y felices.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Jesús R. C., 34, belongs to the Unión y Esfuerzo community bank. She lives in the Túpac Amaru village, Carabamba district, Julcán province, La Libertad department, Perú. She went to first grade, but her parents did not have the economic resources for her to continue. She married at 24, and she has two children who are economically dependent upon her. María Jesús buys and sells curd, an ingredient in making cheese. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which was repaid in four payments, she bought curd. With this loan for 600 PEN, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy more curd and other ingredients for making cheese. María’s dream is to see her children happy and that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy curd and other ingredients for making cheese.

loans.name: Francisca Salome

texts.es: La señora Francisca Salome P.
texts.en: Mrs. Francisca Salome P.

loans.use: Buy beauty products, cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Adela es separada, tiene 53 años, dos hijos de 26 y 23 años, que estudian y trabajan.
Adela trabajo como secretaria en una empresa hasta que esta quebró, y se  puso a estudiar corte y confección, empezó a coser en su casa pero lo dejo por que no era tan rentable, empezó a compra ropa hecha, actualmente vende ropa por pedidos también vende perfumes.  
Adela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de perfumes, de diferentes marcas.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a valorizar el negocio, a ahorrar, a no gastar un sol de mas.   
El sueño de Adela es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women Communal Bank). Adela is separated, 53 years old, and has two children ages 26 and 23 who study and work.

Adela worked as a secretary in a business until it went bankrupt, and she put herself to studying dressmaking. She started to sew in her house but she quit because it was not so profitable, and she started to purchase clothes. She now sells clothes on order as well as perfumes.

Adela needs a loan of 1000 PEN to purchase perfumes of different brands. Since she has been in the program she has learned how to increase the value of her business, to save, and to not spend a sol (PEN) more than necessary. Adela’s dream is to own a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes of different brands

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Miriam es  de Huanuco, casada tiene 65 años, cuatro hijos que son mayores.
Miriam comenzó vendiendo pasamanería  en el mercado, pero falleció su papa y cerro, con los ahorros que tenia decidió poner un negocio de Internet con la ayuda de su hijo, hace un año. Su esposo administra su negocio. 
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de teclados, tinta originales e insumos para el Internet.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a conocer a las personas, a saber como tratar con ellas, agradece a Finca por los préstamos otorgados puede invertir en su negocio.
El sueño de Miriam, es tener poner otro Internet.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women Communal Bank). Miriam is from Huanuco, is married, is 65 years old, and has four grown children.

Miriam started selling decorative trim (passementerie) in the market, but her father passed away and she closed. With the savings that she had she decided one year ago to open an internet café with the help of her son. Her husband administers the business.

Miriam needs a loan of 1600 PEN to purchase keyboards, printers, and products for the internet.

Since she has been in the program she has learned how to get to know people, how to deal with them, and she is grateful to the program for the loans granted to her that she can invest in her business. Miriam’s dream is to be able to open another internet café.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of keyboards, printers, and products for the interent

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Maxima es soltera, tiene 68 años, es de cuzco, vive en lima desde su juventud, su cuñada le enseño a trabajar en la venta de queso, ella aprendió y se independizo  hace diez años,  ahora ella vende  queso, mantequilla, majar-blanco de Cajamarca, semanalmente vende 30 kilos de queso, reparte a domicilio. 
Maxima necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de productos lácteos, quesos, mantequillas, majar blanco.
Desde que esta en Finca aumento su capital y puede comprar mas mercadería
El sueño de Maxima es tener suficiente  capital para tener un puesto propio, y vivir de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maxima is a member of Bancomunal Mujeres Emprededoras (Enterprising Women Communal Bank). Maxima is single, 68 years old, is from Cuzco, and has lived in Lima since her youth. Her sister-in-law taught her the trade of the sale of cheese. She learned and has been independent for ten years. Now she sells cheese, butter, and sweetened condensed milk from Cajamarca. She sells 30kg of cheese per week from her home.

Since she has been in the program she has increased her capital and can purchase more merchandise. Maxima’s dream is to have sufficient capital to be able to have her own stand and to live from her income.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of dairy products, cheeses, butters, and condensed milk

loans.name: Lumateh Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the heart of metropolitan town of Bamenda, Cameroon. She is married to Che Gideon N. and they have four children. She plans to invest this loan in dressmaking. Specifically she will purchase cloth (textile) for dressmaking, a zigzag machine, zip and thread. Her dressmaking workshop is in the town.

This is Lilian's second loan; she has been a GHAPE member since 2007. She is a long-time fashion designer and has many customers.

With the profit from this loan, Lilian plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well and buy their medication. She knows she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the small repayment installments.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cloth, zigzag machine, zip and thread.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Gladys es casada tiene 62 años, cuatro hijos todos mayores.
Gladys se dedicaba a su casa pero quería hacer algo productivo  y una amiga la animo a vender ropa usada y ropa  nueva, consiguieron un sitio en Pista Nueva  y vende hace seis años le va muy bien. 
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de ropa por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mas amigas, son solidarias y amigas, le gusta las reuniones se distrae.
El sueño de Gladys es seguir trabajando, hasta que sus fuerzas lo permitan.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the community bank, Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras. Gladys is married, 62 years old and has four children, all adults. Gladys was a housewife but wanted to do something productive. A friend suggested that she sell used and new clothing. She obtained a place in Pista Nueva and has sold there for six years with success. Gladys needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy clothing for mother's day. SInce she has been with Finca, she has more friends. They are each other's support and friends. She likes the meetings for diversion. Gladys has a dream to continue working as long as her strength allows it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for Mother's Day

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Lizbeth es soltera tiene 21 años, termino el colegio y estudio diseño de modas, llevo curso de costura en una institución pro joven donde aprendió el manejo de maquina   y se puso a confeccionar sabanas y edredones,. 
Lizbeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para compra de maquinas industrial para confeccionar. Ahora ella quiere confeccionar polos
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ser responsable con los préstamos y responsadle en su trabajo, también aprendió ahorrar
El sueño de Lizbeth es tener un talle de confecciones.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a member of the community bank, Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Lizbeth is single, 21 years old, and has finished her studies in fashion design. She took sewing courses in a pro-youth institution where she learned to use a machine and began sewing sheets and comforters.

Lizbeth needs a loan of 1000 soles ($350 USD) to buy industrial sewing machines. Currently, she sews polos.

Since she has been with the Finca, she has learned to be responsible with the loan and responsible with her work. She also has learned to save.

Lizbeth’s dream is to have a sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy industrial sewing machines

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Irma es conviviente, tiene 38 años, tres hijos de 14, 12 años y el último de 4 meses, los hijos mayores están en la escuela estatal.
Empezó vendiendo tamales para pagar la mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos, reparte tamales a todo los mercados de Manchay – Pachacamac, semanal reparte 100 tamales con la ayuda de sus hijos. 
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra poner un locutorio publico en la puerta de su casa, y compra de celulares.
Desde que esta en Finca  aprendió ahorrar a ser responsable y ser  puntual.  
El sueño de Irma es que sus hijos sean profesionales, actualmente tiene los primeros puestos en el colegio ella quiere verlos  estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the community bank, Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Irma lives with her partner, is 38 years old, and has three children aged 14, 12 and 4 months. The older children study in the state school.

She began selling tamales to pay the costs of her children’s schooling. She delivers tamales to all the markets in Manchay, Pachacamac. She delivers 100 tamales weekly with the help of her children.

Irma needs a loan of 1200 soles ($425 USD) to put a public phone booth in the door of her house and buy cellular phones.

Since she has been with the Finca, she has learned to save, be responsible and be punctual.

Irma’s dream is that her children become professionals. Currently, they are first in their classes in school. She wants to see them study in a university.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra poner un locutorio publico en la puerta de su casa, y compra de celulares.

loans.name: Maria Juris

texts.en:
Maria Juris G. owns a small sari-sari store business. She started her business using her small savings of Php 2,000. She is 28 years old and is married with one child. Her husband, Fernando G., is a construction worker. They work extremely hard to provide for all their needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store. The loan will help Maria Juris attract more customers. In this way, she will be able to increase their income.

CEVI is not limited to offering loans to its clients. It also offers training sessions and insurance coverage to help clients grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is a father of two children who runs a cosmetic shop, raises pigs and farms ginger. Ferdinand has his cosmetic shop in Hawker, an area within Bamenda. With this loan, Ferdinand plans to purchase a gamut of cosmetics (from hair to skin products), ginger to plant in his farm, and some supplies he needs to raise his pigs.

This is Ferdinand’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He believes he runs a successful cosmetic shop because he notes, "there is constant buying of my products." He has been doing his business for long enough to know what works. He helps the community by "reducing unemployment and helping to oil people’s body." In Bamenda, a lot people use oil (lotion).

Ferdinand plans to use his loan to create profits. With this loan, he wishes to save some of the profits and use the others to help educate his children, as well as pay his bills. He chooses GHAPE loans because the loan conditions are preferable to him.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, ginger and pig raising supplies.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is a resident of San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as carpenter and earns only a meager income. She registered as a regular member of Paglaum MPC in June 2006, and she is very responsible about meeting her weekly obligations, such as savings, share capital, and insurance.

She is starting a hog raising business. In need of capital to begin this venture, she has reached out to Paglaum for funding for her project, applying for a loan of PHP 10,000. She particularly needs to buy sacks of feed as well as vaccines for her pigs.

She is very thankful to Paglaum as her financing partner. She looks forward to seeing her piggery become successful.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Mrs. Chona B., 40 years old, is married and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. She is blessed with three children. The family's primary source of income comes from “sundang” making ("sundang" is the Visayan term for a kind of knife). She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since December 2005. With the efforts of her husband combining with the help of the cooperative, Chona has found that it is much easier for her business to flourish. The finished products are sold at public markets and other sales are made through orders. Because of her good credit record, she has taken on five loans already.

Chona says she is thankful for the cooperative because of the financial assistance given to her family. Today, she is applying for PHP 20,000 to buy additional materials for her “sundang” making business.

She hopes for a bountiful life ahead.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for "sundang" making.

loans.name: Ezel

texts.en:
Mrs. J. is a member of PMPC Microfinance PDP-LP. She is a dressmaker and tailor, and also operates a NFA rice dealing business ("bigasan ng bayan"). She is married to Gilbert J., a van driver. They are blessed with two children, who are in day care.

She is 28 years old and has been a member of the PDP-LP program for more than a year. This is her fourth cycle of loan. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000.00, which is intended for additional NFA capital. Her loan history shows no default and she is a member in good standing.

In addition to her dress tailoring and rice dealing work, she has taken on a sideline business in ice candy and ice selling. She hopes that, by God's grace, her business will thoroughly bloom. She wants to provide whatever is best for their children, as one of her children is a gifted little boy undergoing therapy and taking special classes. She hopes that her children will become professionals and achieve whatever they dream of.

loans.use: To raise additional capital for her businesses.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Mrs. Isidra S. is 50 years of age and widowed with two kids. She has a sari-sari store to support the needs of her children, especially their educational expenses. She is hoping that, even though she is now a single mom, she will be able to raise her children through personal sacrifice.

loans.use: To restock a grocery store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie L. is 33 years old and married; she lives with her husband and two children. She works hard on improving her family's housing conditions, using the capital she makes from her sari-sari store, which she started through the financial assistance of Paglaum MPC. She has repeatedly shown us her strength and leadership in her lending group and in her role as a center officer. Now she is applying for her fourth loan cycle in the amount of P14,000.00 to supplement her housing loan.

She hopes that someday she can own a thriving sari-sari store, through her own efforts and through financing from Kiva.

loans.use: To improve her family's housing conditions.

loans.name: 20-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Xuân H. Thị is a 30 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Xuân is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 20-Quảng Hưng.

Xuân is married and has 1 school-aged child. To earn a living, Xuân owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Xuân has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Xuân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2442600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 3079800 VND which will be used to purchase additional baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Hồ Thị Dậu is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

2. N. Thị Luyến is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

3. N. Thị Hương is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. H. Thị Hoà is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: 6-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Minh N. Thị (age 52) is a married mother of three adult children living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  To make a living, Minh prepares and sells food in the local community, mainly seafood products such as fish and shrimp.  Minh has been in this business for more than 5 years and earns about 1.000.000 VND each month.  Minh joined the Thanh Hoá Fund for Poor Women in 2004 to borrow funds.  She successfully repaid the 3.079.800 VND loan, which she used to expand her business and improve her living situation.

As the leader of the 7-member group 6-Quảng Hưng, Minh is now requesting her 9th loan by Thanh Hoá Fund for Poor Women so she can continue expanding her business and supplement the family's income.  Each group member will receive a 6.000.000 VND individual loan, but they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  Other group members want to expand their businesses.  Lý N. Thị (age 31), will use the funds for her food stall.  Phường N. Thị (age 45), Thường N. Thị (age 35), and Vân N. Thị (age 55), will use their loans to support their businesses raising livestock.  Thu N. Thị (age 35) will fund her business raising crops, and Bắc N. Thị (age 45) hopes to grow her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoá Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of the Thanh Hoá Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoá province.  Many FPW borrowers have recently expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses. In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6.000.000 VND with a 20-month term to its Thanh Hoá City branch portfolio.

loans.use: To grow her seafood selling business.

loans.name: Venelanda

texts.en:
Venelanda has been a local seller in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa for 7 years. She belongs to Kinegamgosi B group loan (Group code 2001). Venelanda currently earns an average monthly profit of $80 and works 12 hours a day 7 days a week.

Venelanda is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Venelanda is 38 years old, married, and has four children: ages 19, 16, 11 and 9.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
For many years, Merina has owned a small store for selling local alcohol in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa. She is married and belongs to the Ipogolo D group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for local alcohol prepation. She is hoping to increase her profits and grow her business through this loan.

loans.use: To buy more items for local alcohol preparation.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is the mother of three children. Abandoned by her husband five years ago and unable to meet the everyday needs of her children, she joined GHAPE in 2007 and received her first loan of 40,000CFA (about $80). This was used as start-up capital for her business, which consist of buying and selling palm oil, onion, garlic, plantains, and garri, which is a starchy food obtained from fermented cassava tubers. The profit she got from the loan was used to provide food and medication for her children and herself.

Given the high demand for the articles she sells, there is need for expansion. She has requested a loan of 150,000CFA (about $300), with which she plans to increase her stock by buying more plantains, palm oil, garlic, onions, and garri for retail sale. The profit she gets from the loan shall be used to pay for her children’s education as well as to buy a piglet to rear.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, plantains, garlic, onions, and garri for sale.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza has owned a small food vendor store in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa for three years. She belongs to the Ipogolo E group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximetly $145. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes, carrots, coconuts, and onions to add her current stock. She needs these for the improvement of her business. She is hoping to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Eliza is 26 years old and is married with a one-year-old baby and a seven-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, carrots, coconuts, and onions to add her current stock.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema has owned a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 10 years. She belongs to the Mkimbizi C group loan and currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $175. She works at her business eight hours daily.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can improve her business by buying more food items to add her current stock. She hopes to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Neema is 24 years old and married with two a two-year-old toddler and a five-year-old child. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items to add her current stock.

loans.name: Edrelina

texts.en:
Edrelina I. is a store owner living in Tuburan village, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married to Benjamin I., who works as mechanic in a shop. They have three children: all are studying in school.

She has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000.00, which she will use as additional capital to purchase additional merchandise. Her sari-sari store provides income to help them in their daily needs. She plans to expand the space of her store and have it painted to make her store neat and attractive.

loans.use: To improve her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda Remolan has a sari-sari store for generating her daily income. She is 56 and a widow living in Buenavista, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. All of her children are already married. She has applied for a loan of 14,000 PHP. The money will be used as additional capital for her store. She hopes to replace her sari-sari store with a concrete one and she also plans to save for her retirement.

loans.use: To restock a sari-sari store

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita R. is 34 years of age, married with two children, and presently residing at Sto. Niño, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She generates her income through her sari-sari store.

She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000.00. She will use this amount to purchase stock for her sari-sari store. She also plans to add a connecting door to her store for easy passage to her house. In addition, she plans to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand and improve her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L., 41, has five children. She lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She raises pigs and her husband works as a carpenter.

She has applied for her second cycle in Paglaum Coop, requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000.00. She will use these funds for her hog-raising venture. This business helps her pay the tuition fees for her three children as well as paying the family's electric and water bills.

She plans to purchase another two piglets for her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana C. lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has two children. Mrs. C. generates her daily income and meets her family's needs with the proceeds from her sari-sari store.

She has applied for a PHP 7,000.00 loan so that she can purchase additional inventory for her store. She eventually plans to erect a new store and set up business there.

loans.use: To buy stocks for her existing sari-sari store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia T., 43 years old, lives in Dao Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with six children. Her husband works as a motor cab driver, but his income is not enough to meet their daily needs. Therefore, she has started a pig-raising venture.

She has applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000.00, which she will use for purchasing pig feed. Her pig-raising venture will help them to support the family and pay for the education expenses of the children.

She plans to purchase more pigs for her business, hoping to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie Carbajos tends a vegetable garden. She is 28 years old and is married with three children. She has applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.00, which will be used to purchase fertilizer.

Ana Marie and her husband farm their garden as their main source of income. They plan to begin buying and selling vegetables at the market so as to increase their income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Princevelle

texts.en:
Princevelle P. is a very young married woman. She is pregnant with her first child. She and her husband are finding it hard to survive with no fixed income. The couple lives in P5 Gango, Ozamiz City. Princeville has a Bachelor of Science degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Her husband works to support her, but his income is not enough, so she decided to engage in a sari-sari store business. Initially, she borrowed money from her mother to start up her business. Now, she wants to expand her business and build a bigger stall in order to earn more.

With the encouragement of her mother, one of our members, she joined Paglaum MPC. She has applied for an amount of PHP 7,000.00 for her business expansion and to prepare for the upcoming baby.

loans.use: To expand her sari-sari store business.

location.town: P5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Mrs. Melchora Y. is 61 years old and a member in good standing of Paglaum Coop. A married woman, she is blessed with six children, one of whom is still in school. She has already accessed loans through Paglaum a number of times, and one of the loans was supported by Kiva.

Now she is applying for another loan to help finance the purchase of grocery items for sale at her sari-sari store, which she operates together with her husband. They run their store in order to have enough income to feed their family and to save for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
In this picture, the one with a great big smile is Mrs. Gemma O., 43 years of age, who is married to Ernesto O. (right) and a resident of P4 Bañadero, Ozamiz City. The couple runs a restaurant business. They are blessed with twin daughters who are currently studying at public school.

The couple decided to engage in the eatery business a period of years ago because they were living near a college in the area. They also accept boarders and cater events to earn an additional income. Other income comes from their corn garden and vegetable garden in their little farmland. Through these endeavors, the couple has been able to purchase personal properties, like a motorcycle and appliances for the home.

As an active member in good standing of Paglaum, Gemma enjoys the benefits of savings and insurance, and she has been able to receive many loans. Now she is applying for P20,000.00 as additional capital for her eatery business. She is hoping that she and her husband can give their children a better education, as well as to become a successful entrepreneur herself.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital for her eatery business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth B., 44 years of age, is married and the mother of five children in her hometown in Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her primary activity is backyard gardening, in a garden plot planted with corn. As a side business, she also engages in selling fish.

An active member in Paglaum for two years, Elizabeth requested her fourth loan in order to purchase construction materials so as to build more comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her family's home.

loans.name: Galileonides

texts.en:
Galileonides G. is 46 years old and is married with three kids. Her husband is a fisherman. They have come to face the fact that depending solely on her husband’s income is very difficult. Paying for the education of the children is also an expense that they struggle to meet.

When her husband got a big catch last year, the couple decided to buy a motorcycle for hire in order for them to have an additional source of income. It's a matter of "diskarte" (strategies) on how to live life. One has to work hard and make sacrifices.

Galileonides has been a member of Paglaum MPC since March 2007. She and her husband hope that Paglaum MPC will always be there for them in times of need. Today, she is applying for Php 14,900 in order to buy a fishing net, as well as to buy spare parts and tires for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

The Gonzalez family's dream is to build a decent home and to see their children established with their own professions.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and to finance the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Mrs. Marietta N. is a 36-year-old resident of Dipolog City.  She is married and blessed with three children.  One of them is still in school.  She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for three years and has already received six loans.  The major source of income for her family comes from her husband's motorcycle taxi business (this motorcycle is known as a "habal-habal").  Marietta earns additional income for the family with her backyard garden planted with root crops, vegetables, and bananas.  She plans to use this loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for their motorcycle so it will run better and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en: Mrs. Aquilina G., 29, married and living in Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, patiently looked for an institution that could help her in pursuing her dream business. When she learned about Paglaum MPC, she wasted no time and she became a member in  April, 2009. Aquilina started her business by buying only one piglet, and she is grateful to God that her hog-raising business has done very well. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and purchase some cement for home repair. She hopes to make a concrete piggery for her pigs and a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To buy feed and construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a mother of five children who runs a restaurant in Bamenda, Cameroon. Restaurants in Cameroon can be as small as a menu with three items and a couple of benches under an overhang. Veronica’s restaurant is just that way. With this loan, she plans to buy food to serve: cocoyams, corn, rice, beans, palm oil, groundnut (peanut) oil, flashes (matches), groundnut, meat, fish and spices. She will also use the loan to pay for transportation costs associated with her business.

This is Veronica’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. Her first loan from GHAPE was used much in the same way, investing in her business. She has seen success from her past experiences, and knows how to alter her business practices when there is a failure, she says.

Veronica has struggled with living in poor conditions and not always having enough money for things like her children's school fees or house rent. With the profits from this loan, she plans to pay for food for the family and her children's school fees, as well as save money for medical fees. Veronica chooses GHAPE loans because unlike her other options, like loan sharks or private groups, she pays her loan back little by little without fear of being chased down.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, corn, rice, palm oil, groundnuts and other supplied for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ngwafu Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a father of five children who raises pigs, or as it is called in Bamenda, has a piggery. Currently, there are three pigs in his piggery, and with this loan, Lucas plans to purchase one more piglet, buy three bags of feed for them and cover his transportation costs to pick them up.

This is Lucas’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. Having raised pigs in the past, Lucas says that his success is due to the large demand for pig manure for the many farms in his area and for pork. Raising pigs is a great investment, arguably the best, for a GHAPE member. When done well, a pig can earn an investor a great return.

With the profits from this loan, Lucas plans to first pay for his children's educational needs. He also will provide nutritional food for the family. Lucas takes out GHAPE loans because the loan conditions are favourable to him, or as he puts it "the method of repayment is easy."

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy a piglet and pig feed and to pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
Godlove is a single father of one child who runs a provisional store, farms ginger and raises pigs, running the business out of Fonta and raising his pigs at his home. With this loan, Godlove plans to purchase many small provisions for his general store, labor to work his ginger farm and piglets.

This is Godlove’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He has been doing well with his business because he thinks he has a good store location and his past experience has been successful. He knows that with even a small amount of capital he can make his business work.

Having fallen on hard times, including being sick and being charged a tax by the local council that was higher than his amount of capital, Godlove continues to keep his business going. He says, with the loan profits he will look to increase his business and perhaps help others who are in need by allowing them to use credit. Godlove chooses GHAPE loans because he can pay back over time, not all at once.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy provisions, pig feed and labor.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila G. is a 25-year-old woman living with her live-in partner, Cyril Alvarez, a hired laborer. They are both locals of Pandan, Antique. Pandan is a coastal town where the country's cleanest river can be found. They have a 1-year-old daughter named Alfea.

Sheila sells bariw (a plant with leaves that are used in making sleeping mats). She sells the raw leaves in markets and sometimes delivers them to the local makers of sleeping mats. Life was not easy to Sheila. The meager income was used to buy milk for her child and could not sustain their daily needs, until she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.). Her first loan in the amount of 5,000 pesos will be used to purchase a piglet and its feeds and vitamins. Sheila is confident her business will grow, which will be a big help for them, since the demand for pigs in the market is high. Her greatest dream is to give adequate education to her child and also to build a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy a pig and to pay for feed and vitamins

loans.name: Ma. Azucena

texts.en:
From the start of their married life, Ma. Azucena P. and her husband have been partners in raising hogs. Ma. Azucena is a 59-year-old woman and a resident of Pandan, Antique. Her husband, Feliculo, is a hired laborer. They are blessed with two children. Their older son is a 24-year-old college graduate and the younger is a 3rd-year Criminology student. Proceeds from the business have been used to meet their daily needs and pay school fees for their children.

The need for capital is always an issue for them; however, and this has impelled her to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.). Now on her third loan cycle, she is requesting 15,000 pesos for the purchase of feed and vitamins for the hogs.

Ma. Azucena is looking forward to the growth of this business which is helping bring them out of poverty. Building a more durable house is her greatest dream.

loans.use: To pay for feed and vitamins for hogs

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly B. has been a member of ASHI (Ahon Sa hirap, Inc.) for almost two years. She is a resident of Bagumbayan, Pandan, Antique.
