She is married to Anselmo B., a farmer and her partner in cultivating their farm. Nelly is mother to three children, two daughters and one son. The eldest daughter Leannie is 18-years-old and a college student, while the youngest, Liane Gace, is 4-years-old.

When her parents died, Nelly was given parcel of farmland. This was the reason she and her husband began cultivating and becoming engaged in farming. Since rice is the staple food for Filipinos, the demand for its supply is getting higher. Farming supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds are expensive and Nelly finds it difficult to afford these necessities. She decided to apply for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to be used to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for the farm. She is hopeful that it will be of great help for their farming needs and to raise production levels.

Nelly’s greatest dream is to send their children to school until they have completed and for the children to find jobs so that they will not have to experience the same life that she has had.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.en:
Santiaga A. is a resident of Santo Rosario, Pandan, Antique. She is 55 years old, married and mother to an 11-year-old daughter named RJ. Her husband, Ceazar, is a hired laborer. Locals consider Santo Rosario the ‘bag capital’ of Pandan because almost all of the residents’ sources of income is from making native bags. Santiaga is also engaged in the native bag making business. The bags are in demand in other towns and cities. Local tourists even visit the place just to buy native bags and other native products. But, as the materials used in making these bags are so expensive, Santiaga needed capital to purchase these supplies. With her loan, she proposes to buy, in bulk, the bariw (plant that leaves are used in making bags) that she requires to be able to produce more products.

Stantiaga is hopeful that someday her business will grow to the point that she could earn enough sustain the needs of her family. Sending her child to college and to build a house of her own are her greatest dreams.

loans.use: To purchase bulk materials for native bag making.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores C. has been a member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) for almost two years. She is a 50-year-old woman and hails from the town of Pandan, in the province of Antique. She is married to Manuclito C., a farmer and also a jeepney driver. She is mother to two daughters. Her eldest daughter is 24 years old and a college graduate. The youngest is 20 years old and also a college graduate.
Selling cooked foods around the village was Dolores’ previous source of income. When she decided to join ASHI, her first loan was used as starting capital for her variety store. Now, on her second loan, she proposes the amount of PHP10,000 as additional capital for her general store business. 
Her greatest aspiration is to make the business grow and so that her children will have stable jobs and be out of poverty.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store.

loans.name: Merzu Group

texts.en: Merzu is the group leader of Merzu group. There are three members in this group. They want to expand their businesses. They have requested a group of loan 42000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. Merzu wants to take a loan for her brother who has a small restaurant. Merzu’s brother wants to expand and progress his business by buying new tables and chairs for this restaurant to attract more customers and to become a good business dealer in the future. Ameda wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Khadega wants to take a loan for her brother who has a fruit and vegetable shop. They all want to thank all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add capital for progress of business.

loans.name: Allua Group

texts.en: Allua is the group leader of the three members of Allua group. Each member wants a loan to progress his/her business. Allua wants  to assist her brother in his dish selling shop.He sells plates,different desings of tea cups and other utensils in his shop. Selltan M. requests a loan for his lock and key selling shop. M. Server wants a loan for the business of chicken soup selling cart. They have requested a group loan of 42,000 Afghani.They all thank AFS and Kiva lenders who support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding there business

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra D. is new to ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.). She joined the organization just recently. She is a 33 year-old woman and hails from the town of Pandan, Antique. She is married to Avaristo, a hired laborer. She is blessed with a daughter named Junelie, a 15 year-old high school student. The town of Pandan is located in the north-western most part of Antique Province, where mountain and beach resorts can be found.

Before, Petra was selling bariw (a plant that its leaves are used in making sleeping mat) around the village. That was a tiring and time consuming business. She started the general store with small capital and the stocks are located inside their house.

When she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc.), she proposed an amount of 5,000 pesos as her first loan cycle to pay for the bulk of stocks for her general store. She is looking forward to the day she will have enough capital for the construction of a stall for her general store.

Her greatest hope is she would be able to support the education of her child up to college.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for her general store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice B. is a resident of Candari, Pandan, Antique and a mother to three daughters. She is 31 years old and married to Johnny B., a jeepney conductor. Her eldest daughter is a high school student while the youngest is a kindergarten pupil. She is a new ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) member.

She has a general store and the goods are put inside their house since she doesn't have a stall for it. Now that she joined ASHI, she proposes an amount of 5,000 pesos as her first loan cycle as additional capital for her general store and for the construction of a stall near their house so that customers will not find it hard going in-and-out of her house.

As her children grow, she is preparing for their needs in school. She wants her children to finish schooling and find jobs.

loans.use: Aditional capital to pay for stock for general store business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is a resident of Candari, Pandan, Antique. She is a 53 year old woman and a mother to four sons. She is an education-oriented mother making her four children attends school regularly. Her eldest son is 24 years old and a college graduate and the youngest son is 16 years old and a grade six pupil. She is married to Rodolfo A., the Barangay Captain (head of the village) of Candari.

Anita is busy in the retail of bariw (a plant that its leaves are used in making sleeping mat) from the local folks. She then sells bariw to the neighboring towns and markets. She finds it very productive. She learned the business from her parents. The proceeds of the business were a big help to the family especially in the educational needs of her children. With her 5,000 pesos loan from ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) she can now buy bulk stocks of bariw for her retail.

Her greatest aspiration is that her children will be able to finish schooling and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy bulk stocks of bariw (a plant used to make sleeping mats) for retail.

loans.name: Monchita

texts.en:
Monchita A. is a consistent, very good member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a Kiva partner. She is a 60-year-old woman who is married to Salvador A., a jeepney driver. She has four children: two sons and two daughters. The eldest daughter, Iramae, is a 31-year-old high school graduate. The youngest son, Nermie, is a 21-year-old high school graduate. All four of her children are dependent and still at her side as they don’t have families of their own yet.

Before, Monchita raised hogs as her primary source of income. But because the price of feed pumped up, she opted to shift the direction of her business. Now on her fourth loan cycle, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos as capital to her planned business. The amount will be spent to pay for 67 sacks of rice for retail sale. She is positive that the business will grow fast since right after the harvest, farmers automatically sell rice. With that, the in-and–out of the money would be fast and it could bring them good proceeds to sustain their family needs.

Her greatest dream is to support the schooling needs of her grandchildren someday, since she was not able to send her children to college. And someday, will have her own space in the market.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice for retail

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married with two grown-up children. She sells women's clothing – underwear, T-shirts, slippers, etc. Her kiosk is located very close to the food market, bringing many customers her way. Katerina has been in this business for 8 years. She used to work in construction, but as the salary was small, she decided to start her own business. Today it is the only source of income for her family.


Katerina would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She believes that a larger assortment would allow her to increase her sales and make a greater profit.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is married with one child. She sells shoes at the department store in the city of Ordzhonikidze. Her profit is 2,200 UAH per month.


Alena has been in this business for 6 years. During this time she has developed her business and gained repeat customers. Alena's husband has been very supportive of his wife, which helps Alena in her business a lot. She is a hard-working and determined person. She would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase her inventory of shoes. Alena sees that there is a high demand for shoes and wants to develop her business further.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of shoes sold

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. She sells clothing at a department store in Ordzhonikidze city. She has been in this business for one year and her profit is 2,000 UAH per month.

Her goal is to develop her business and make it a stable source of income. Olga would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to buy a greater assortment of clothing. She hopes to increase her sales and develop her business further.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Gulchahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон получает займ в МикроИнвест уже второй раз. Она работает в колхозе, муж находиться на заработках в России. Гулчахон 37 лет, имеет 4 детей. Дополнительно к своему заработку в колхозе и денежным переводам от мужа с России Гулчахон дома откармливает скот. Условия для откорма имеются и поэтому у нее несколько голов скота дома. Раз в месяц или два она выводит на базар готовый к убою скот и продает. А на прибыль расходует на питание семьи. Новый займ собирается приобрести маленького бычка.
texts.en:
Gulchahon is getting a loan from MicroInvest for the second time. She works on a collective farm; her husband is in Russia earning money. Gulchahon is 37 years old and has 4 children. In addition to her earnings at the collective farm and money transfers from her husband in Russia Gulchahon fattens cattle at home. She has the right conditions to fatten livestock and this is why she has several heads of livestock at home. Once a month or twice she takes livestock that is ready to be butchered to the market and sells it. She uses the profits to feed her family. She is taking out a new loan to purchase a small bull.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат исполнилось 27 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Работает совсем недавно и еще не имеет стабильного заработка. Муж в России и присылает денежные переводы. Кроме основного заработка также откармливает скот дома. В этом ей помогает мать ее мужа, которую вы видите на фотографии. Продает готовый к убою скоту младший братишка мужа. Полученная прибыль частью идет на расходы семьи, а другая на покупку нового бычка. Саодат собирается получить новый займ и потратить его на покупку бычка и корма для него.
texts.en:
Saodat turned 27 years old; she is married and has 2 children. She started working very recently and does not have a stable income yet. Her husband is in Russia and sends her money transfers. In addition to her main income she also fattens livestock at home. Her mother-in-law helps her with this and you can see her in the photograph. Her husband’s younger brother sells the livestock that is ready to be butchered. The revenues from this are partially used for family expenditures and partially for the purchase of a new bull. Saodat plans to get a new loan and to spend it on purchasing a bull and on its feed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull and feed

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин и его жена занимается откормом скота в домашних условиях. Ему 53 года. Имеет 3 детей. Мухиддин работает в колхозе, но заработная плата небольшая и поэтому занятие животноводством дает хорошую прибавку к семейному бюджету. Мухиддин собирается немного расширить свой маленький бизнес, и поэтому подал заявку на займ на КИВА. На этот займ он собирается приобрести бычка и немного отремонтировать сарай для содержания скота. На фото вы видите жену Мухиддина.
texts.en:
Muhiddin and his wife fatten livestock at their home. He is 53 years old and has 3 children. Muhiddin works at a collective farm, but his salary is not big and this is why raising livestock adds a nice addition to the family budget. Muhiddin plans to grow his small business a little bit and this is why he has applied for a loan on Kiva. He plans to use this loan to purchase a bull and to repair the cowshed a little bit. In the photo you can see Muhiddin’s wife.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bull and repair cowshed

loans.name: Soimahon

texts.ru: Соимахон 40 лет, замужем. Имеет 3 детей. Несколько последних лет занимается продажей детской одежды на центральном рынке Исфары. Арендует часть магазина. Свой товар привозит из города Истаравшана с оптового рынка. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает 4 года и получаемые займы использует целенаправленно на развитие бизнеса. Сейчас она планирует прикупить ассортимент новых весенних товаров и поэтому подает заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Soimahon is 40 years old; she is married and has 3 children. She has been selling children’s clothing for the past several years at the Isfara market. She rents part of a store. Soimahon brings her products from the city of Istaravshan, from the wholesale market. She has been working with MicroInvest for 4 years and uses the loans with a focus on growing her business. Now she plans to purchase an assortment of new spring products and this is why she is applying for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow product assortment

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B. is the mother of Brent, a 2-year-old boy. She is 27 and married to Rodmark B., a laborer. She lives in Pandan, Antique. Pandan is an eco-friendly town where most of the wildlife lives in its mountains. It has beaches and mountain resorts.

Before, Teresa was busy selling vegetables around the village. But later, she discovered the demand for bariw (a plant with leaves that are used in making sleeping mats) as there are a lot of locals making sleeping mats and native bags. Then she ventured into the retail selling of bariw. But they were running out of capital until they decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), where they were given access to capital. For her loan, she seeks the amount of 5,000 pesos to make a down payment on a motorcycle since they find it hard to transport bariw to customers when there are orders. She is positive that when they have a motorcycle, they can deliver more bariw in less time.

She dreams of having a space someday in the market and of supporting her children to school up to college.

loans.use: 1 motorcycle

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
N. N. is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. N. has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. The previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. N. is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by her from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

No. 30399005

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
A trailer-motor is used by Mr. T., age 47, for driving passengers and merchandise in order to generate income. In addition, he uses his trailer to transport rice and charcoal for his wife to sell from their home. Their combined income is $7.50 per day. The couple has three children and two of them are employed at different jobs. Mr. T. has been running the business very well but unfortunately his trailer is often broken so his income is decreased. In view of this problem, T. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner, HKL, in order to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one.
The two people in the picture are Mr. T. and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer to replace an old one

loans.name: Peena

texts.en:
Peena baji handles a milk-selling business. Her husband, L. A., has a livestock business. He buys buffaloes and takes care of them and sells them to customers and they sometimes sell their milk to the milk shops.

Peena baji is a 38-years-old married lady and a citizen of the mid-size city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan city is famous for its sweetmeats and its festivals. Peena baji has been a citizen of this city for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses and Peena baji was deprived of the blessing of knowledge. She is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are enrolled in the local school of the neighborhood.

Peena baji and her husband have a dream to give their children a good future. So they both work hard to fulfill their dream. Peena baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: My name is Naseem and I am 27 years old, residing in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan--a city famous for its sweetmeats and festivals. I have been in this city for the past six years. My husband's name is M. P.. He has a livestock business. He buys different kinds of animals (buffaloes and goats) and sells to clients who are in the market for the animals. He has been in this business for the past three years. I’m applying for a loan to buy another buffalo so that my husband is able to complete his orders and earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
"My name is Irshad and I have been a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan for the last 20 years. My husband's name is R. A. and he owns a livestock business. He buys buffalos on order and sells to the required customers. He has 5 years of experience in this business."

Irshad baji helps her husband in taking care of his buffalos. They both are very happy with each other. Irshad baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to complete the order of her husband's customer.

loans.use: To buy buffalo for livestock business

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is a very modest lady. She believes in hard work. Her husband handles a livestock business. He sells buffaloes to customers. Hamidan baji helps him by taking care of the buffaloes.

Hamidan baji is a 53-years-old married lady and a citizen of the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its sweetmeats and for its festivals. Hamidan baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to complete customer's orders and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
My name is Zahida A. and my husband's name is Munir. We live in Kot Radha Kishan, a city famous for its sweetmeats and its festivals. My husband has a livestock business; he buys buffalos on order to sell to customers. People come to him to buy buffalos because he deals so well with his customers. 

Sometimes I get milk from the buffalo and sell the milk to the milk shops for a profit. I successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I'm applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand my husband's livestock business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for livestock business.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
My name is Kosar and my husband's name is K. A.. We have resided in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the last 12 years. K. has 5 years experience in the livestock business. I help him by taking care of his buffalos. He buys buffalos from the animal market and sells to his customers to earn a good profit. 

I successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I'm applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo for my husband's livestock business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for livestock business.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyen is 33 years old and lives in Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a recycling services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services and to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund, which she used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND to expand her business. The loan will be her 7th loan from the TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in her recycling business.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Bartini

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Bartini is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Ni Ketut Bartini owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Bartini has been in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Ketut Bartini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Bartini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Ni Ketut Bartini is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth loan from DINARI. Ni Ketut Bartini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
(DNR.M-0654)

About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Bartini - (DNR.M-0654) merupakan 58 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Bartini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Bartini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Bartini menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut Bartini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Bartini meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Bartini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.

Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
S. Nguyen is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, S. owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising cattle for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. S. is now requesting a loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be her eighth loan from TYM Fund. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. No. 9280108885.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
L. Ngo Thi is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising cattle for sale. L. has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. L. is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock. This loan will be her ninth loan from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. No. 9280108882

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.en:
T. Luong Thi (919010602) lives in the town of Vinh Phuc and is a married mother of 5 school-aged children. To making a living, T. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid her previous loan from TYM Fund that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops for raising. T. requests a new loan of 10,000,000 VND to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be T.’s 9th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Rani Maqsood Masih Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is married to M. M. and they live in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and Punjabi food. Rani baji is a hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and relatives. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. Her husband is a blacksmith who buys iron and makes iron rods to sell to customers. He has been in this business for the past six years. Rani baji is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of four other women in her locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Nazneen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron to make iron rods

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.en:
X. Duong Thi (9080003111) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, X. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan taken from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. X. now requests a new loan of 20,000,000 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be X. 10th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Bilquis Rahmat Masih Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Bilquis baji husband's name is R. M.. He has a dairy business. He sells milk to the milk shops to earn income. Bilquis baji helps him by milking the buffalo. Presently, they have one buffalo at their home. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand their milk-selling business.

Bilquis baji is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Riaz baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy materials, such as beads, cloth, and colored thread, for her decorative embroidery business. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy jewelry boxes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Margarette Younas Masih Group

texts.en:
My name is Margarette and I've been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore is famous for its Punjabi foods and for its historical places. My husband's name is Y. M.. He works in a factory on a monthly wage. My husband’s income is insufficient to meet our expenses which allows me to operate my beauty salon. I have been running my salon for the past three years. I have a good number of customers. I am applying for a loan to buy supplies, such as cosmetics and a dryer machine, for my beauty salon.

I am the leader of a group of three other women from my locality. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a beauty salon

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 48 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of two children. Both children are single and attend school. Her husband works with her in planting rice.

The family works hard at their business activities every day and never wastes time. Rice growing is the family's main source of income to pay their living expenses and maintain stability and sustenance. Mrs. C. will use the loan to purchase a plot of land to grow crops.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow crops.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with two children. He sells men's clothing at the central market in Melitopol city. Ivan has been in this business for six years. His parents helped him to start this business and find the right kind of goods to sell. Ivan was able to develop the business well and get many customers. His kiosk is located in a good location in the market, which helps him attract more and more new customers.

Ivan would like to borrow 11,000 UAH to purchase new inventories for the coming summer season. He hopes to earn more profit and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory of men's clothing.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Mrs. Bou L. is 52 years old and married. The older couple has five children. Four of their children are married and living separately and one is single and sells fish paste in the market.

Bou L. and her husband currently grow a rice crop. Bou L. also sells sugar cane juice in front of her house for additional income. She has applied for this loan to expand her sugar cane juice business. The family will earn more income because of this loan.

loans.use: To expand her sugar cane juice business.

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna is married with one child. She sells tights and socks at the central market in Melitopol city and has been in this business for 12 years. Inna is a very entrepreneurial and open person. She knows her business well enough and what kind of inventories to purchase. Moreover, the good location of her kiosk also helps the business.

Inna would like a loan of 7,200 UAH to purchase more tights and socks for the coming season. She hopes to receive more income and replace old home equipment in her house.

loans.use: To purchase more tights and socks for sale.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun K. is married with two teenage children who are students still living at home. Her husband is a local rice farmer.

Mrs. K. has been raising pigs since 1999. She uses a small pigpen and sells her pigs for slaughter after three months when they are matured. She is applying for a loan to buy additional food to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: To buy additional food to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Shazia Rafiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of R. M. who has a clothes-selling business. They live in Lahore, Pakistan, a city famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband buys clothes from different cities (Multan, Peshawar), cities that are famous for their variety of clothes, and sells them in the city of Lahore. Shazia baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes for her husband’s clothes-selling business. Shazia baji is the group leader of two other women from her locality: Sugran baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell; Nargis baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Bushra Asif Group

texts.en: Bushra baji is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her children are getting an education from a school located near to the house. Bushra baji is a very hardworking lady. She sews clothes to pay the school fees of her children. Her husband’s name is A. and he sells goats which he buys from the animal market. His customers belong to the butcher profession and they buy his goats to increase the profit of their meat businesses. Bushra baji is applying for a loan to buy goats to expand her husband’s goat-selling business. Bushra baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality: Rahmat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business; Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business; Sugran baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business; Naziran baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei sells various car parts and lights for Ukrainian and Russian cars at the market in Berdyansk city. He has been in this business for 5 years. His pricing policy and high demand have attracted many customers to his business. Andrei is a very talented entrepreneur and wants to develop his business even further. Andrei is not married; he is taking care of his elderly father.

Andrei would like to receive a loan of 12,100 UAH to increase his assortment of parts to sell. He hopes to increase his sales and make more income. He is going to spend the additional income to purchase medicine that his father needs.

loans.use: To buy additional car parts and lights

loans.name: Sakina Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a wife of B. A. and has lived in Riwind, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Riwind is a mid-size city famous for its sweetmeats and shrines. Her husband deals in utensils, which he buys from the famous bazaars (Shahalmi and Ichra) of the city Lahore and sells to the utensil shops. He has 5 years of experience in this business.

Sakina baji is the mother of five kids: four sons and one daughter. Her first two sons work in a factory for a monthly wage. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting education. Sakina baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy utensils to expand her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for a milk business. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy scrap for a scrap business. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy snacks (chips, biscuits) to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils to sell

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Sear Samboeun is 39 years old and lives in the Battambang province with her husband and three of her children. All of their children are in school.

To earn a living, she has been working as a professional tailor and selling sugar cane juice from her home. On average, she is able to make around US$5 per day from both businesses combined. Her husband stays at home and helps her sell sugar cane juice. Sear Samboeun is asking for a loan to purchase sugar cane to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane to sell.

loans.name: Razia M. Saeed Group

texts.en: Razia baji is a citizen of a mid-sized city named Raiwind, Pakistan. Raiwind is famous for its sweetmeats and for its shrines. Her husband’s name is M. S. and he has dealt in seasonal fruit for the past three years. He sells his products in different communities by making a loud voice from his cart. Razia baji helps him by arranging the fruit on his cart. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business. Razia baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality: Sardaran baji wants a loan to buy garments to sell; Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business; Kosar baji and Asia baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles). This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for her husband to sell

loans.name: Muhammad Hakim

texts.en:
M. Hakim M. A. has a lock and key making and repairing shop. He is married with two children. He is an educated man and a very hard worker. He has a building that is located in a good area near the street.

He tried many times to build shops and rent them out but he could not. When he found AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and asked about this loan process he was really very happy.

Now he wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to start building the shops and get them ready to rent in order to make a good profit, repay the loan, and support his family to provide a better future.

He is happy with all members of his family and he would like to thank Kiva and AFS for a successful loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to say a special thank you to lenders who are supporters of this process and wants to continue his partnership in the future.

loans.use: To build shops and get them ready to rent

loans.name: Bashiran M. Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji has been a citizen of a mid-size city named Raiwind, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Her husband M. M. A. runs a dairy business. He gets milk from his buffalo and sells to the milk shops. Bashiran baji also helps him by getting milk from the buffalo. Her husband has three years of experience in this business. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a new loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk-selling business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy candies to sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Seak H., 44, is married with four children and resides in the Battambang province. She sells cakes and ice-cream to earn a living and is able to make US$4 per day. Her husband is a chicken seller in the market and makes US$4 a day as well. The family is also supported by two children who are local teachers. Seak H. would like to take out a loan to purchase ingredients and rice so that she can make more cakes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and rice to make cakes

loans.name: Suriaya M. Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Suriaya baji is married to M. I. and they have been living in a mid-size city named Raiwind, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Suraiya baji is an uneducated lady but she knows the value of education. She is the mother of two sons. Both her sons are enrolled in a local school. Suraiya baji wants to give her sons good education, so that they can become independent and have a bright future. She sews clothes to pay off her kids’ school fees. Her husband trades in fruits. He sells his products in different communities by making a loud voice from his cart. Suraiya baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a new loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand the husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Bushra baji and Nusrat baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling business. Kosar baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Haleema baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Naziran Malik Niamat Ali Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji has resided in a mid-size city named Riwind in Pakistan for the last 14 years. Her husband's name is M. N. A. who operates a cooking oil selling business. He has 5 years of experience in this business. Naziran baji is applying for a loan to buy more cooking oil to expand her husband’s cooking oil selling business.

She is the leader of a group with one another lady and her name is Bashiran. Bashiran baji is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en: Bunny K. is 23 years old and resides in the Battambang province. She has been operating a grocery store to earn a living and is able to make US$5 of profit every day. Her husband is a local teacher at the primary school and he can make US$5 in a day. This couple has one young child. Bunny would like to take out a loan to purchase groceries in bulk so that she can have a special discount and also to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir S. is an educated young man with full experience. He has a spare-parts shop where he works. He has been working in this business for a long time and has a good number of customers. He has a small business but when he got his first loan he completed his stock and then continued his business with more success and he is still working.

Now he has requested a second loan to enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in the business. Therefore, he wants to work hard to make a better future for all his family, especially for the son who works with him. He is sure that he can further his business with more success and he was really happy about this process of small loans in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in the business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Phượng Nguyễn Thị (311950277) is a 34 year-old female living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Phượng owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Phượng has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1995, Phượng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phượng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Phượng is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 11th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Phượng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long N., 42, lives in Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She is married and has two children; one child is single and the other is married. One of her children is working in the Phnom Penh City as a garment worker. Her husband, Nhgoeun, 41, works with her in the farming business and this is their main source of income. Because the rainy season is coming, Mrs. N. needs a loan of US$500 to buy additional farmland to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy additional farmland to grow crops

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun S., 30, has been selling types of desserts in the village for years. In this business, she generates an income of $5 per day and uses her income to manage the family’s daily expenses. As another source of the family's income, her husband drives a trailer-motor (tuk tuk). The family now lives with their two single children, who are students.

Recently, Mrs. S.’s husband has been feeling bored with his tuk-tuk as it is too old and is frequently broken, so his clients are decreasing. To solve the problem, Mrs. S. would like a loan in order to buy a new one to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to replace a broken one

loans.name: Vukosava

texts.en:
Vukosava lives in a very developed village in Bosnia. She was born in 1985, is married and has one child. Vukosava’s child is still little and Vuskosava stays at home to take care of her house and her child. Her husband is employed and pays most of their household costs.

Vukosava also earns some income by working on her computer. She makes promotional material, does diploma work, price-lists for restaurants and similar material. She is very creative and wants to develop her business. She is  requesting her first loan from WWI (Women for Women International) in the amount of 1200 KM to purchase needed materials and equipment.

loans.use: To buy needed materials and computer equipment

loans.name: Vu Thi
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali M. is a 53 year old farmer who breeds sheep in the small village of Saatli located in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ali is married and lives with his parents in one house. Ali started his business in 1985. He chose this type of business because it is very beneficial and brings permanent income to his family.

Ali applied for a 1500 USD loan to purchase 15 sheep at the price of 100 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep to expand his business

loans.name: Vilayat

texts.en:
Vilayat A. is a 20 year old farmer who, for the last two years, has bred calves for meat production. Vilayat is not married yet and provides an income to his parents who he is living with. Being from a low-income family, Vilayat could not finish high school and had to join his father farming.

Vilayat has now got enough experience to separate from his father and he would like to buy two calves. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of $1200. Lets do our best to support this young hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase two calves for his business

loans.name: Chakhalov

texts.en:
Chakhalov H. is a 53-year-old man who breeds calves in the small village of Saatli. H. is married and has three children. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

H. has more than 20 years of experience in breeding calves. H. buys baby calves, raises them, and then sells them to the local traders for meat. Humbar has applied for $1500 to purchase three calves to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves to expand his business

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
T. Vũ Thị (321960570) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 1996, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase chicks to raise and sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en:
T. Phan Thị (324980674) lives in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. T. owns and operates a business selling rice products in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud M., 29 years old and married with two children, has operated an Internet computer cafe in the center of Hebron, Palestine for the past two years. The business is quite interesting but demands investment from time to time in order to retain a good customer base.  Mahmud is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to renovate his cafe.  These renovations will allow him to earn a higher income, thereby enabling him to provide his children with a better life.

loans.use: To renovate his Internet cafe

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
Dương Thị Thư (347991377) a resident of Vinh Phuc, is married and has two adult-aged children. For over seven years, she has owned and operated a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling animal feed and farm-related products to the local community. Mrs. Thu earns approximately 6000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, Mrs. Thư joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to expand the business, Mrs Thư is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Hương Tran Thi (329020886) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Hương owns and operates a business running a general store in the local community, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Hương has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, Hương joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hương has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Hương is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz H. Shah F. is married and the father of three children. He lives in Jalalabad, Nangrahar province. He is a farmer with lots of experience and he has been involved in this business for more then ten years. He is also a hard worker.

But now he wants to buy some animals for his farm. For that, he needs an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to buy animals and necessary things for his land.

Therefore he asked AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan for an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to complete his stock and to buy animals for his land. Now he is really very happy about this process of small loans in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He sends thanks to all lenders, Kiva and AFS in Jalalabad, Afghanistan for supporting him in this financial difficulty with his business.

loans.use: To buy animals for his farming land

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech C., 33, lives with his wife and two young children in the Battambang province. He is a professional carpenter, typically making around US$5 every day. His wife works at the farm for less than US$1 per day. Pech would like to take out a loan to purchase carpentry materials.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: A resident of Ramallah, Palestine, Mohamed R., 59, has raised seven children with his wife.  An experienced bread baker, for more than 10 years Mohamed has owned a small bakery that attracts many clients from the region.  He is now requesting a loan of $3,000 to fund the purchase of ingredients required for the business. He is grateful to all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with diligence.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients required for his business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
S. Nguyen Thi (727020912) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, S. owns and operates a business selling herbs and spices in the local community. S. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

S. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for five borrowers who live in the province of Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. Mr. Kong S., age 47, has been selected to be group leader by the other members.

Mr. S. currently earns a living by making furniture. He sells his products to buyers who come to order at his house. He makes products like nets, traps, baskets and those made from bamboo. His wife, who is a good housewife, cares for three teenage children and sometime works with him in making tools. Two of their children are working in Thailand as construction workers.

Mr. S. plans to use half the loan to buy bamboo to make furniture and half of the loan to buy a piglet to raise.

The other four borrowers are:
Mrs. K. is a furniture maker, who is looking for a loan to purchase zinc to cover the roof of her house.
Mrs. L. is requesting a loan to buy raw material to support her business making baskets.
Mrs. L. makes fishing tools for sale and she needs for a loan to purchase farmland to grow a rice crop.
Mrs. P. is a local furniture maker who requests a loan to purchase bamboo.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make furniture with

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak T. is 38 years old and lives with her husband in Battambang Province. Since 2000, she has been making and selling brooms in the local market to earn a living and is able to make $5 per day. Her husband, a construction worker building houses, also earns $5 per day.  Brak is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike and a trailer so that she can transport her brooms to sell at the market and other locales.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 42-year-old married woman with four children living in Aley, Mount Lebanon, where she has been a home-based hairdresser for 20 years. Today, Amal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase newer equipment to attract a larger number of clients.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for her business.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek Y., 60, is a widow who lives with one child in Battambang Province. She has been selling groceries and fruit since 2001 and is able to make $5 per day. She is also supported by her son, who works as a blacksmith typically earning $2 each day. Ek is asking for a loan to purchase more groceries to meet client demand.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Dani

texts.en: Dani, a 33-year-old married man with one child living in Saida, southern Lebanon, has been working as a chef for eight years and has owned his own kitchen since 2003. Today, Dani is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase new tools for his kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase new tools.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 29, pictured here with her husband, is a weaver and a grocery vendor, typically making $2 every day. Her husband sells wine and works on the farm, on average also earning $2 per day. This couple lives in Takeo Province. Neang would like to take out a loan to purchase groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 27-year-old single man living in Shwaifat, Mount Lebanon. For eight years he has owned a metA. shop which services the surrounding villages. Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new toolkit for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new toolkit for his business.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang L., 49, is a true entrepreneur living in Takeo Province. A grocery seller in the local market, she is able to make $3 each day while her husband, a farmer earns $2 per day. Chheang would like to take out a loan to purchase groceries to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her business.

loans.name: Kosar M. Rasheed Group
loans.use: To buy medicines for medical store.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke S., 51, is married and lives with six of her children in Takeo province. Working a farm with her husband, Ke S. typically makes US$2 each day. Her family is also supported by three of the children who work as blacksmiths.

Ke S. is asking for a loan to purchase blacksmith materials for her children.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials for her children

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas A. is 26, single and lives in his parents' home with his siblings. He is working as a teacher of English in a small educational center he owns in Ramallah city, Palestine. This work fills him with satisfaction that he has lent his services to the children of this area.

Firas would like to request a loan of $2000 to purchase more chairs, computers and other center requirements. He says that this loan will help him so much to grow.

loans.use: Chairs, computers, and other items

loans.name: Rehana M.akbar Group

texts.en:
Rehana baji has lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M.; he runs a garment business. He sells both ladies & gentlemen's garments. He has 5 years of experience in this business. Rehana baji is the mother of three daughters. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school. She prepares embroidered dresses on order and from this income she pays the school fees of her daughters. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy garments to increase the profit of her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Amna baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Khadija baji wants a loan to buy jewelry to sell. Riffat baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zakia baji wants a loan to buy paint brushes for her paint business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments for resale

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Koeun P., 29, pictured with her husband and two of her children, lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are vegetables sellers who typically make about US $50 in revenue each day. Koeun P. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase vegetables to sell at the market. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and better support her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rasheeda M. Sharif Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda baji is a wife of M. S. and has lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the last 8 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband operates a fruit selling business. He has 4 years of experience in this business. He buys fruits from the famous market named (Sunday bazaar) and sells to the fruit shops and earns a profit. Rasheeda baji helps him by packing the fruits in boxes. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to increase the profit of her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Razia bjai wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Tahira baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Parveen Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji has been a resident of the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Parveen baji couldn’t get education due to limited financial resources, but she made a commitment to herself that she will give her son a good education and a bright future.

Parveen baji sews clothes day and night and pays off the school fees of her son from the income. Her husband's name is N. A.; he operates a wood selling business. Parveen baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy wood to increase the profit of her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Mussarat baji and Raja kosar baji each want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy ice to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim N., 45, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children. Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes US $1.60 every day and is aided by her daughter who sells beverages. As a farmer, Tim N. is taking the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Tim N. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and raise pigs, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

loans.use: For fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida N. was born in 1965 and is single; she sells woman's clothes in the city of Ramallah, Palestine. Nahida has been in the clothing sales business for 5 years. Now, she wants a loan of US $3000 to buy more clothing to expand and improve her business.

Nahida is confident that her good taste in clothing and wide selection of products will allow her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: To increase clothing store inventory

loans.name: Ramzana M. Saleem Group

texts.en:
Ramzana baji is a wife of M. S. who lives in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband operates a fruit selling business. He buys fruits from the famous market (Sunday Bazaar) at low rates and sells to the fruit shops to earn a profit. He has 3 years of experience in this business. Ramzana baji is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to increase the profits of her husband.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy material (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her Punjabi food selling business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Cam's Group

texts.en:
Cẩm Thị Trương was born in 1956 (no: 010102050015). She has a shoe shop in the market. She lives with her husband and 2 grandsons. Her husband is a farmer. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $197). She has been considerably enlarging her business but doesn’t have enough money. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong (about US $233) to buy more shoes to sell.

There are 4 other fund participants in her group: - Thảo Thị Nguyễn was born in 1961 (no: 010102050018). She wants to borrow 1,962,000 dong (about US $110) to buy scrap iron to resell.
- Từ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1979 (no: 010102050016) She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 dong (about US $257) to buy more vegetables and other goods to sell.
- Hà T. Nguyễn was born in 1980 (no: 010102050017). She is a weaver. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 dong (about US $257) to buy wool.
- Trước Thị Trương was born in 1970 (no: 010102050014). She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong (about US $233) to buy more vegetables and goods to sell.

loans.use: To expand shoe store inventory

loans.name: Hoi's Group

texts.en:
Hợi Thị Nguyễn was born in 1959 (no: 010107010111). Her main job is farming. Her husband is a builder. There are 5 members in her family. Her son is a worker. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 dong (about US $330) to breed pigs and poultry. She is the group leader. There are 7 other fund participants in her group :
  • Nga Thị Trần was born in 1956 (no: 010107010112). She sells fish in the market. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 dong (about US $310) to buy more fish.
  • Miền Thị Nguyễn was born in 1980 (no: 010107010113). She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 (about US $235) to enlarge her business.
  • Việt Thị Nguyễn was born in 1962 (no: 010107010114). She sells chicken in the market. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 (about US $310) to buy more chicken to resell.
  • Mỳ Thị Ngô was born in 1968 (no:010107010115). She wants to borrow 5,450,000 dong (about US $310) to breed pigs and poultry.
  • Khoa Thị Nguyễn was born in 1962 (no:010107010116). She makes soft noodles to sell. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong (about US $235) to buy rice to make soft noodles.
  • Hạnh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1966 (no: 010107010117). She has a confectionery at home and she sells shoes and sandals in the market. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 dong (about US $310) to enlarge her business.
  • Rộng Thị Vũ was born in 1968 (no:010107010118). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong (about US $235) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en:
Thạch Thị Hoàng (No: 010117060018) was born in 1958. Her husband is a farmer. They have a son who is married and now they are living with him. Her family has a gas shop. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND.

This is her first microfinance loan. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND (approximately $115) to buy gas to sell.

There are two other fund participants in her group:

Suốt Thị Đỗ (No: 010117060016) was born in 1951. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND (approximately $115) to buy goods to sell.

Bích Thị Tạ (No: 010117060017) was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 2,436,000 VND (approximately $145) to invest in her confectionery business.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to sell

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mrs. Ung S. is a 46-year-old grocer living with her four children in Sthany Village, Pursat Province. She earns around $4 per day. All of her children are students in the local public school. Her husband, Mr. Nou Bunthoeun, is a 46-year-old policeman and earns up to $3 per day. This is the second cycle of Mrs. S.'s loan with Kiva and she plans to use the loan in order to expand her business selling grocery items.

loans.use: To expand her business selling grocery items

loans.name: 42 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thị Hoa Ngô is a 55 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Thị Hoa is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 42 - Nam Ngạn.

Thị Hoa is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Thị Hoa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs and spices to the local community. Thị Hoa has been engaged in this business for more than eight years and earns approximately 1.050.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Thị Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 1.626.500 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thị Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. L. Thị Hoa is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

2. N. Thị Chính is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

3. H. Thị Cúc is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

4. H. Thị Liên is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

5. Ngô Thị Lan is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business of a specialized retail store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Thị Hoa Ngô (286) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Thị Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.
