Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả L. khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 42 - Nam Ngạn (17.11.42).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thị Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thị Hoa kiếm được khoảng 1.050.000 VND. Vào 2009, Thị Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thị Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.626.500 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. L. Thị Hoa (287) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.

2. N. Thị Chính (288) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3. H. Thị Cúc (289) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4. H. Thị Liên (290) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

5. Ngô Thị Lan (291) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Liên Thị Đỗ was born in 1953. She sells vegetables in the market. Her husband is a farmer. They have a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or about $295) to buy more vegetables to sell.

Đa Thị Đỗ was born in 1956. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 1.962.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia E. currently sells secondhand shoes and is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. She is 39 years old and is married to a teacher who has taught at the Gabat primary school for 9 years. Cicilia has four children, two girls and two boys; they all go to school at the Hai gabat primary school where their father teaches. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: B. Salamatou  est une femme mariée qui a 02 enfants, son mari est un enseignant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle fait cette activité depuis 2001. Le stock dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de répondre aux charges de sa famille. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES son premier crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite son second  cycle de prêt pour acheter 30 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
B. Salamatou is a married woman who has two children. Her husband is a teacher. She earns an income from commerce in grains. She has been in this business since 2001. The inventory she presently has is preventing her from meeting family expenses. She has had her first WAGES loan, which she has repaid. She's requesting her second loan cycle to buy 30 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Hoem

texts.en:
Hoem T. is 39 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, where she owns a plot of land that she inherited from her grandparents. She grows rice and vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is divorced and the mother of two children, both of whom are still single and attend school.

Hoem T. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Growing rice is Hoem T.'s main source of income to sustain her family and especially to make sure both her children receive a higher education. To help do the hard physical labor of her farming work, Hoem T. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to use for plowing the fields.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use for plowing the fields

loans.name: 005-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
"Chúc D. Thị (43) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Chúc is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 05-Đông Sơn (10.05.005).

Chúc is married and has 1 school-aged child. To making a living, Chúc owns & operates a business making & selling food.  She sells a variety of food products in the local community.  Chúc has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 Viet Nam Dong (~$56 US) a month from these activities.

In 2004, Chúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to engage in business activities.  Chúc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND (~$209 US) from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Her previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.  She is now requesting another loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in further expanding her business.  This will be the 7th loan taken out by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Chúc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Đỗ thị Thái (50) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

2.  T. thị Oanh (58) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a service-based business.

3.  Lê Thị Thanh (60) is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

4.  Lê Thị Mậu (37) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

5.  H. thị Hoà (42) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

6.  N. Thị Hoà (65) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

7.  N. thị Nga (10) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 3,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

* Mrs. Nga is absent in the picture because she came 5 minutes late and other people in the group had gone back to their business

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: Many FPW borrowers have expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses. In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6,000,000 VND with a 20-month term to its Thanh Hoa City branch portfolio.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Chúc D. Thị  (43) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Chúc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05-Đông Sơn (10.05.005).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Chúc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Chúc kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Chúc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Chúc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Đỗ thị Thái (50) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2.  T. thị Oanh (58) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3.  Lê Thị Thanh (60) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4.  Lê Thị Mậu (37) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

5.  H. thị Hoà (42) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

6.  N. Thị Hoà (65) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

7.  N. thị Nga (10) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée à un maçon carreleur et a 02 enfants pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer elle a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois, elle fait cette activité depuis 2003, son stock de charbons de bois est épuisé, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettrait de rehausser son stock.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married to a tile mason. She has two children. To help her husband with day-to-day household expenses, she began doing commerce in charcoal, a business has been in since 2003. Her stock of charcoal is exhausted. To resupply herself, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES that would enable her to replenish her stock.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en:
Hassana Y. is married with 2 children and has received no formal education. For 6 years, Hassana has worked as a petty trader, selling cooked food such as rice balls, banku and fufu, at Siwdo in Cape Coast. While Hassana works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a phone seller.

Hassana uses her income to pay for her children’s food and books. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for preparation of the food to sell and with the new profits from her expanded business, Hassana plans to buy land.

loans.use: purchase additional ingredients for preparation of cooked food

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. is married with 2 children and has received no formal education. Mariama is a petty trader selling rice, corn and gari (cassava grits) at Siwdo in Cape Coast. While Mariama works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a dentist.

Mariama uses her income to pay for her family’s food and also their water and light bills. Mariama will use the loan to support her business in the buying and selling of food supplies. With her newly gained capital, she plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to expand her business in the buying and selling of food supplies

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna M. is married with one, child and has received an education through Senior High School. For one year Memuna has worked as a petty trader selling rice, sugar, oil, and onions at Siwdo in Cape Coast. While Memuna works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver.

Memuna uses her income to help pay the family’s bills. She will use the loan to purchase more food items to sell and with the new profits from her expanded business, Memuna plans to reinvest.

loans.use: purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Kossi  Agbenyenu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus le commerce de papiers pour emballages et couverture, ses clients emballent chez lui des cadeaux de mariage et d’anniversaire. Son stock actuel de papier d'emballage ne peut lui permettre de satisfaire ses clients, il demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 35 lots de papiers d’emballages et divers. Il est célibataire et travaille dur pour subvenir à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This gentleman earns an income from commerce in paper products for wrapping and covering. His customers come to him to wrap their marriage gifts and birthday presents. His current stock of wrapping paper prevents him from satisfying his customers. He's asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 25 lots of wrapping paper and various items. He is unmarried and works hard to support himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper for wrapping and covering

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 50 years old, is married with four children. They are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in garlic and ginger. Apart from being used to spice up food, garlic and ginger have medicinal properties. They are used in preparation of local herbal mixtures in the treatment of malaria and other common ailments.

Beatrice has been a retailer of ginger and garlic for the past two years and has since been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of garlic and ginger to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country. This she believes will decrease her cost very significantly to enable her to raise good income to support her children at school.

Beatrice is a member of the trust group called Olivet. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase garlic and ginger in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira comes from a suburb of Sarajevo. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of one child. Her husband is self-employed, running an auto repair service. Samira is supportive and works with him when he needs help. They sell vehicle spare parts, too.

The income from the auto repair service is the only revenue they have so they do their best to improve business. Samira is requesting her first loan from WWI in the amount of 1200 KM to invest in their service. They have plans to buy auto parts to re-sell and provide better earnings.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Effuah

texts.en:
Effuah K. is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter. According to her, one is in the senior high school and the other in junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Effuah works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She sells rice and stew. She prepares the stew in her house and sells by the roadside. Effuah procures bags of rice and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice in bulk. Effuah is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 45-year-old woman. She is married with three children. Currently all of them are in school. She prepares and sells pastries to the working community and at bus stops at Kasoa. She wants to use the loan to buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock and to avoid price hikes.  This she believes, will minimize her cost very significantly to enable her to raise good income to support her children in school. She is a member of the trust group called ‘Olivet’ In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is fifty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three sons and one daughter. According to her, one is in senior high school while the others are in junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Mary works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. Mary is a food vendor. She sells kenkey (a fermented maize dish) and fried fish. She prepares it in her house and sells by the roadside in the daytime. Mary procures bags of maize and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M. is 32 years old. She is married with two children who are currently schooling. She is a supplier and a petty trader who trades in bulk foodstuffs like bags of millet and soya beans, and supplies them to her customers at the busy market of Kasoa, a local market where she lives.

Amina treks to the northern part of the country to purchase her goods. She needs the loan to buy more stock to scale up the business. She wants to buy more bags of beans, millet, groundnuts, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to double up on savings to take care of her kids in school. She belongs to the community group called Olivet Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans, millet, and groundnuts

loans.name: Tchotcho Anastasie

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est mécanicien auto. Le revenu de son mari est insuffisant pour couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Pour aider donc son mari dans ces charges elle fait le commerce des articles de mercerie, la plupart de ses clients sont des couturières et des tailleurs. Elle est en rupture de stock et veut se réapprovisionner, pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 16 rouleaux de popeline, 10 rouleaux de grippure, 20 cartons de fil, 15 cartons de boutons.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of four. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Her husband's income is insufficient to cover household expenses. Thus, to help her husband with these responsibilities, she does commerce in sewing supplies. Most of her customers are seamstresses and tailors. She has an inventory shortage and wants to resupply herself. To do so, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 16 rolls of poplin, 10 rolls of guipure (heavy lace), 20 boxes of thread, and 15 boxes of buttons.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Ljubinka

texts.en:
Ljubinka comes from a suburb of Sarajevo. She is divorced and has one daughter who lives with her. Ljubinka has been re-selling clothing at the market in Sarajevo for a long time and her offering gets better from year to year. When she is not at the market, she sells out of her home. She is a young single mother who works hard to provide an easy and comfortable life for her daughter.

Ljubinka decided to take her first loan from WWI in the amount of 1200 KM to purchase summer clothes to re-sell.

loans.use: To buy clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar O. is married with three children and is educated to university level. Since 1999 he has worked as a trader selling DVD players, DVDs and phones at Siwdo in Cape Coast. His wife also works as a trader in the area.  Abubakar uses the income from his business to pay for his family’s various expenses, such as food and utility bills. He will use the loan to expand his trade in DVD players, DVDs and phones, and plans to use his newly acquired profits as further capital for his enterprise.

loans.use: To expand his trade in DVD players, DVDs and phones

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana E. is a 50-year-old mother of three children – two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is at nurse training college while her sons are in senior high and junior high schools. Juana lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the central region of Ghana.

Juana's husband is an auto mechanic, and Juana works as a trader to support him in providing for the family. Juana deals in second-hand clothes, which she procures from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns as well. Juana has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Kwame A. is 36 years old, and is married with three children who are currently in school. He is a retailer of car spare parts, which he buys from his suppliers and retails to his customers. Kwame does not have adequate funds to support his business, especially in the phase of recent price hikes. He therefore needs a loan to remain in business. With the loan, he wants to purchase new stock of spare parts and scraps to serve his customers. Kwame believes the loan will enable him to save more for his children education and also build his own shop.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of spare parts and scraps.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two sons and three daughters. According to her, one of her daughters is currently in junior high school, while the rest attend senior high school. Cecilia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. She works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Cecilia is a baker. She sells most of her bread to retailers and beverage sellers, but she also hawks the bread in her community. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from the local market. Cecilia has run this business for over fifteen years and she wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort R. is fifty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two sons and one daughter. According to her, all three of her children are in either junior high or senior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central Region of Ghana. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Comfort is a seamstress. She makes women's wear and treks to markets to sell them. Comfort is also a trader. She procures bags of charcoal from nearby communities and sells them to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has operated this business for fourteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of charcoal in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina was born in 1983. She is married and the mother of one child. She is a very interesting person who is always in contact with people. That comes from her positive spirit and her occupation. Sabina was in secondary music school and she sings at weddings. She also works as a make-up artist at home. She want to improve the services in her "salon" and is requesting a loan of 1200 Bosnian convertible marks (or about $850 US) from WWI. She will use this loan to buy a machine for wax smelting and some other materials and equipment.

loans.use: To buy a wax smelting machine

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en: Ayishetu I. is married and has 3 children. She has received an education through junior high school. Since 2005 she has worked as a trader selling clothing and drinks at Siwdo in Cape Coast. Her husband also works as a trader in the same area. Ayishetu uses her income to pay for utility bills and her children’s school fees. She will use the loan to expand her business and she plans to use her newly gained profits to further support her enterprise.

loans.use: She will use the loan to expand her business selling clothing and drinks

loans.name: Tchatchibara

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et  père de 01 enfants, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’Agoè danliko. Le commerce qu’il fait et qui lui permet d’assumer les dépenses du foyer est le commerce de friperie, cette activité marche bien a Lomé, il réalise » d’importantes recettes. Son stock de friperie a diminué, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner par l’achat de 03 balots de friperie.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is married and the father of a child. He lives with his family in the Agoè Danliko district. He does commerce in second-hand clothing, and it is doing well in Lomé. This business enables him to assume coverage of household expenses, and he earns significant revenues. Because his inventory of used clothing has shrunk, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to be able to resupply himself by buying three bales of used clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella Y. is forty-four years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all of whom are daughters. One of her children is currently in senior high school while the rest attend junior high or primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central Region of Ghana. She works very hard to provide for the family. 

Stella is a food vendor. She fries plantain chips in her house and sells them by the roadside. Stella procures plantains and vegetable oil from the local market. She has operated business for three years and wants a loan to purchase plantains in bulk. Stella hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase plantains

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 29 years old, and married to a nurse who has worked at Juba teaching hospital for five years. They have three children – a daughter and two sons – who all attend Walang-walang primary school. Rose sells maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to open a shop as a point of sale for the flour. In the future, Rose hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop for selling maize flour

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is 35 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. According to her, the children are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Regina works very hard to support her husband in providing for the children. She is a trader of pastries. She fries doughnuts, meat pies, etc., and supplies them to retailers. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra. Regina has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 46 years old and comes from Zenica, one of the bigger towns in Bosnia. She lives with her mother and they support each other.

Sabina sells clothes at the big market in Zenica on most days, and when she is not there she sells them at home. She earns about 500 KM monthly, depending on the season and the weather, and it is almost enough for her.

Sabina decided to take her first loan from WWI (Women for Women International) in the amount of 1200 KM. She will use it to purchase clothes for the coming summer season.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité le commerce de perles et de bijoux, pour pouvoir gagner plus de bénéfices sur son activité elle s’approvisionne à Accra au Ghana et dans le marché de Cotonou au Bénin. Les autres femmes revendeuses de bijoux viennent acheter chez elle parce qu’elle leur fait un bon prix. Une partie de son stock est épuisée, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 sachets de perles, 20 sachets de bijoux. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman earns an income from commerce in pearls and gems. To be able to earn more profit from her business, she acquires supplies in Accra, in Ghana, and from the Cotonou marketplace in Benin. The other women jewelry retailers come buy their goods from her because she offers them good prices. Part of her inventory is exhausted. To resupply herself, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 30 bags of pearls and 20 bags of gems. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pearls and gems

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to six children including two sons and three daughters. According to her, some of her children have dropped out of school and the rest are in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. Her husband is a corn-mill operator while she is a trader.

Adwoa works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She deals in secondhand clothes. Adwoa procures bales of textiles from Accra and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns as well. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bales of textiles in bulk. Adwoa is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Zina

texts.en: Zina is a wife and mother of six children who are currently in school. She is a forty-four year old trader who trades in charcoal, maize & corn dough. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Zina obtains her supply of charcoal from Afram plains and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal and maize to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings and allow her to provide her children with their educational needs. She belongs to the community group called Olivet Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou D. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle tient un étal de légume à domicile. Elle voudrait renforcer son activité afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Oumou D., 45, is married and the mother of 4 children. She sells vegetables out of her home. She would like to reinforce her business so as to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: small-scale buying and selling of vegetables

loans.name: Cythia

texts.en: Cynthia is a businesswoman at Kasoa. She trades in lace, materials and cloths. She is married and blessed with one child, who is currently in school. Cynthia is very supportive to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past three years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive her business and to make it more viable. She wants to purchase lace, in bulk, and materials and clothes to increase her inventory. She believes she would be able to save more to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the group called victory Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support to one another in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To purchase bulk lace and materials and clothes.

loans.name: Assumane Chicale

texts.pt:
Assumane nasceu em Nampula, tem 41 anos de idade estudou ate a 8ª classe vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos com idades comprieendidas entre os 2 aos 13 anos de idade. Somente os dois mais velhos e que vão a escola.

Assumana mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Swazilandia a procura de emprego, trabalhou alguns anos numa residência como guarda e conseguiu abrir uma barraca no mercado central da Namaacha. Assim Assumane decide largar o emprego e dedicar se ao seu negócio, hoje ocupa 3 bancas e conta com ajuda dos seus sobrinhos que vivem com ele e da lhes um subcidio de 800.00mt mensalmente pois com o primeiro emprestimo que teve na hluvuku e Kiva seu negocio melhorou muito, Assumane conseguiu construir  um barraca na sua residência para melhor satisfazer a necessidade dos seus vizinhos  e clientes. Trabalha das 7h as 22h tem como melhor produto(cigarros, lampadas, colas, fios electricos e cosmeticos)tem um rendimento mensal de 8.000.00mt, consegue por mês poupar 1.000.00mt porque esta prestes a dar continuidade da sua obra criando assim mais espaso de lazer para sua familia.para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Nampula enviando lhe em cada 6 mêses uma valor de 1.000.00mt.


Este é o segundo empréstimo de Assumane na Hluvuku e Kiva. Os primeiros 11.000.00mt foram usados para comprar produtos de revenda e construir uma barraca na sua residevcia  e pagou cem nenhum problema. E estes 20.000.00mt seram usados para comprar produtos da sua barraca que se encontra na residência, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir um novo emprestimo para completar o seu grande sonho o de comprar um carro que lhe permitira nos seus trabalhos diarios.
texts.en:
Assumane was born in Nampula. He is 41 years old and went to school until the 8th grade. He is married and the father of 3 children with ages between 2 and 13 years old. Only the two oldest are in school. Assumane moved to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, in search of work. He worked a few years in a residence as a security guard, and he was able to open a stand in the central market of Namaacha. As such Assumane decided to leave his job and dedicate his efforts on his business. Today he occupies 3 spaces and has help from his nephews who live with him. He pays them an amount of 800MT per month. With the first loan that he received from Hluvuku and Kiva his business improved a lot. Assumane was able to construct a stand at his house to better satisfy the needs of his neighbors and customers. He works from 7:00am until 10:00pm. His best products are cigarettes, lamps, glues, electric filaments, and cosmetics. He earns 8,000MT monthly and is able to save 1,000MT. He is ready to continue his work thus creating more leisure time for his family. Besides his children he is also supporting his mother who lives in Nampula, and he sends her 1,000MT every 6 months. This is Assumane's second loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The first 11,000MT were used to purchase products to resell and to build a stand at his house. He paid it off without problems. This loan of 20,000MT will be used to purchase products for his stand that one normally finds at home. He is confident that he can pay off the loan before maturity so he can request another loan to complete his dream of purchasing a car, which will assist him with his daily work.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is thirty-eight years old. He is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. His children are currently in junior high and primary schools. Sammy lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. He works very hard to provide for the family. His wife is a fish-monger. He is a trader. He trades in firewood. He collects firewood from the surrounding villages. Sammy supplies the firewood to food vendors in his community and also treks to nearby towns to distribute the firewood as well. He has been in business for two years and wants a loan to purchase firewood in bulk. He is hopeful to expand his business and to give his children the best of education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Joska

texts.en:
Joska A. sells groundnut paste and bread at the market. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more groundnuts that she will use for making the paste to sell. She has two children, both boys, who attend Usarat primary school. Joska, 25 years old, is married to a peasant who grows cabbages at Walang-walang river bank. Joska hopes to open up a bookshop in the future if she can make extra profits in her business, following the receipt of this loan.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchse more groundnuts in order to make paste to sell.

loans.name: Khekh Niakk 23 Group

texts.fr: CE GROUPEMENT EST COMPOSE DE DEUX HOMMES ET TROIS FEMMES QUI SONT DES VOISINS AU QUARTIER DIAMAGUENE DE THIES.ILs font du petit commerce et vendent en général des denrées alimentaires, des habits et des téléphones portables.avec ce groupe de solidarité ,ILs envisagent de contracter un pret pour renforcer leurs fonds de roulement et améliorer leurs revenus .
texts.en:
This group is composed of 2 men and 3 women who are neighbors in the Diamaguene district of Thies. They are petty traders and in general, they sell groceries, clothing, and cell phones. As members of this solidarity group, they hope to take out a loan to increase their working capital and their income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: retail businesses

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
Mateus nasceu em inhambane tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente estudou ate a 7 classe e teve que interroper devido a guerra. E pai de 5 filhos com idades cooprieendidas entre os 5 aos 15 anos de idade os quatro mais velhos e que vao a escola somente o mais novo e que vai ao centro infantil.
 
Mateus sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila a fronteira de swazilandia aprocura de emprego, apois sua chegada começa a trabalhar na vizinha swazilandia como empregado domestico durante 2 anos e teve que abandonar porque a sua residencia distava kilometros do seu serviço. De seguida consegue aranjar um emprego no hotel libombos como guarda onde trabalha a mais de 12 anos  auferindo um valor de 2.000.00mt por mes, porque o seu trabalho e nucturno de dia ele resolve praticar negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade tem como melhor produto refrigerantes, bebidas ,bolos , arroz e peixe. Hoje e proprietario de tres bancas das quais  uma citada em casa, outra na shoprite e na fronteira conta com 2 trabalhadores e com ajuda da sua esposa tem tido um lucro mensal de 5.000.00mt por mês não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque o seu objectivo e expandir mais ainda o seu negocio e pra isso e necessario que ele ponha todo valor a movimentar o seu negocio. Conhece a hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas e aproxima se solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 8.000.00mt para progredir mais ainda com o negocio.

Este e o primeiro emprestimo de maa~tei~us na hluvuku e kiva estes 8.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume do stock dos seus produtoas esta confiante que bai pagar sem nenhum problema e solicitar um outro para iniciar com a construçao da sua obra.
texts.en:
Mateus was born in Inhambane. He is 33 years old, married, and went to school until the 7th grade. He had to stop due to the war. He is the father of 5 children with ages between 5 and 15 years old. The 4 oldest are in school, and the youngest is in day care. Mateus left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, in search of work. After his arrival he began working in neighboring Swaziland as a domestic servant for 2 years. He had to quit his job because his home was kilometers from work. After that he was able to arrange a job in the Hotel Libombos as a security guard where he has worked for over 12 years earning a monthly sum of 2,000MT. Since his job is during the night during the day he resolved to do business selling staple products. His best products are sodas, beer, desserts, rice, and fish. Today he is the owner of 3 stands of which one is at home, another in the Shoprite, and one on the border. He has 2 employees, and with his wife's help he has earned a monthly sum of 5,000MT. He is not able to save any money because his objective is to further expand his business, and to do this it is necessary that he put all of his earnings toward stimulating his business. He came to know Hluvuku through one of his colleagues, and he requested a loan for 8,000MT to progress his business. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva, and the 8,000MT will be used to increase the stock of his products. He is confident that he will pay off the loan without any problems so he can solicit another loan to begin working on his construction.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of staple products

loans.name: Nfaly

texts.fr: Nfaly G. tient une alimentation au centre ville de Ziguinchor prés du rond point Jean Paul II. Ce sociétaire de IMCEC Caisse de Ziguinchor a mis en place un petit réseau de redistribution avec des chariots exploités par des ambulants pour toucher le maximum de clients. Ce jeune opérateur et pére de famille de 02 enfants sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités commerciales.
texts.en:
Nfaly G. has a grocery shop in downtown Ziguinchor near the Jean Paul II roundabout. A member of IMCEC, Ziguinchor Office, he has set up a little distribution network with carts used by ambulant salespeople to reach the maximum number of customers. This young entrepreneur, father of two children, is requesting this loan so as to reinforce his commercial activities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling groceries

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is thirty-five years old. She is unmarried and has no children. She lives independently in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. She works very hard to make ends meet.

Comfort is a food vendor. She sells kenkey (a fermented maize dish) and fried fish. She prepares it in her house and sells by the roadside in the daytime. Comfort procures bags of maize and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for over six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and improve her business.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize to make cooked food to sell

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna S. est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant avec un petit fils dont elle a la charge. Elle vent sur étal des légume à son domicile. Elle souhaiterait promouvoir cette activité pour mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Maïmouna S., 53, is married and the mother of one child with a grandchild for whom she is responsible. She sells vegetables on a small scale out of her home. She would like to expand this business so as to help her husband better in supporting their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables and various condiments out of her home

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: BABACAR S. EST NE EN 1964 A DIAMAKA COUNDA .IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE TROIS ENFANTS.IL EST MAITRE CORANIQUE ET POUR AMELIORER SES REVENUS ,il fait du petit commerce.SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES MARCHANDISES VERS ROSSO ET LES REVEND A SES CLIENTS CONSTITUES DE SES VOISINS.
texts.en:
Boubacar S. was born in 1964 in Diamaka Counda. He is married and the father of 3 children. He teaches the Koran and also does some petty trading to increase his income. His business is buying merchandise in Rosso and re-selling it to his customers, made up of neighbors.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of various items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-one years old. She is married with three kids who are currently in school. Mary sells electrical appliances like rice cookers, fans, televisions, irons, etc. She buys her supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. She is requesting this loan to enable her to procure increased stocks of electrical appliances.

Mary hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to expand her shop to include refrigerators and parts. She belongs to the community group called "Joyful Family" Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical appliances

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty-four years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a son. According to her, her son has completed senior high school and has yet to continue. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Mary works very hard to provide for her son. She is a petty trader. She fries doughnuts and supplies them to retailers. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra. She also runs a provisions store and sells charcoal on a table top in front of the store. Mary has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her son the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to make cooked food

loans.name: Abla Holali

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006. Le commerce de pagnes est en général très développé et très rentable à lomé. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes appelées NANA BENZ à Lomé. Voulant augmenter son stock de marchandises elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes de qualité « hi-target et hollandais ».
texts.en:
This lady sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) to earn a living; she has been in this business since 2006. Selling "pagnes" is very well developed and very lucrative in Lomé. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers called NANA BENZ in Lomé. Wishing to add to her inventory, she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 30 lengths of "pagne" of "hi-target" and "hollandais" brands.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of  "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
Jaime nasceu em namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia, tem 32 anos de idade  vive maritalmente e  pai de 4 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 4 aos 12 anos de idade, os tres mais velhos vao a escola  a mais nova e que vai ao centro infatil.

Devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras jaime so consegue concluir a 7 classe pois seus pais já não conseguiam mais pagar o ensino secundario. Anos depois ele começa a fazer mukero venda de produtos contra bandiada na fronteira de swazilandia e aos poucos foi colectando um fundo para iniciar um negocio mas condigno. inicia com o cambio de divisas actividade esta que teve um impacto positivo. Com  ajuda do seu pai este que reside em chokwe começa a trabalhar com terra enviando lhe todos insumos e instrumentos agricolas, tem plantado tomate, pipino e batata doce nomeadamentee conta com 4 trabalhadores que auferem por mês 1000.00mt por individuo investindo no maximo um valor de 30.000.00mt e temdo um rendimento de 20.000.00mt mas devido a falta de mercado ele tem de alugar um carro que transporte os seus produtos de chokwe a zimpeto pagando em cada viagem um valor de 3.000.00mt. jaimito não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mae que vive em sua casa e encontra se a contruir.

Este e o terceiro emprestimo de jaimito na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Os dois primeiros foram usados para conprar material de construçao e estes 15.000.00mt seram usados para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para reforçar mas o sue negocio.
texts.en:
Jaime was born in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of 4 children with ages between 4 and 12 years old. The three oldest are in school, and the youngest goes to day care. Due to poor financial conditions Jaime was only able to finish the 7th grade, and his parents were not able to pay for high school. Years later he began crossing the Swaziland border to sell contra band products, and little by little he collected enough funds to begin a more legitimate business. He started exchanging currencies, which was an activity that had a positive impact. With the help of his father who lives in Chokwe, he began working in agriculture and was sent all of the supplies and agricultural instruments. He has planted mainly tomatoes, cucumbers, and sweet potatoes. He has 4 employees who each earn 1,000MT per month, and by investing a maximum of 30,000MT he receives an income of 20,000MT. Due to the lack of a market he has to rent a car to transport his products from Chokwe to Zimpeto, and he pays 3,000MT each trip. Jaime is not able to save any money because besides his children he is also responsible for his mother who lives in his house he is constructing. This is Jaime's third loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The first two were used to purchase construction materials, and this loan of 15,000MT will be used for the same reason. He is confident that he will be able to pay off the loan before maturity and request another loan so he can strengthen his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma C. est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Diouma achète des arachides pour les  transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Diouma C. is married and raising 5 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 6 years. Diouma buys peanuts to make into peanut butter for sale. She wants to expand her business so as to help her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina currently sells "simsim" (sesame seeds) and groundnuts and is requesting a loan to stock more simsim and groundnuts to sell. She is 25 years old, married to a driver, and has one child who doesn't attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, Selina hopes to be able to buy a motor bike for the transportation of groundnuts and simsim to the store where she sells from.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more simsim and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Adja Coumba

texts.fr: ADJA COUMBA M. EST UNE JEUNE FEMME NEE EN 1980 A THIES .ELLE EST MARIEE ET MERE D'UNE FILLE.ELLE A COMMENCE A FAIRE DU COMMERCE TRES JEUNE AVEC SA MERE. ACTUELLEMELLEMENT ELLE TRAVAILLE SEULE.ELLE SE REND A KAYAR POUR ACHETER DES LEGUMES POUR LES REVENDRE AU MARCHE MOUSSANTE DE THIES.AVEC CE PRET, ELLE VEUT AUGMENTER SON CHIFFRE D'AFFAIRE ET SES BENEFICES.
texts.en:
Adja Coumba M. is a young woman who was born in 1980 in Thies. She is married and the mother of one daughter. At a young age, she began to work at petty trading, together with her mother. Presently she works independently. She goes to Kayar to buy vegetables which she sells at Moussante market in Thies. With this loan, she wants to expand her turnover and her profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying spare parts and other materials for his repair shop

loans.name: Asma Group

texts.en:
The group name is Asma; it is made of four women who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. 

Fatoum is a 52-year-old married woman with nine children. She owns livestock that produce milk. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock and her milk production. This is the first time that Fatoum has requested a loan.

Fatoum is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she learned it when she was young. She decided on doing her business because there is demand for it in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock. 

Asma is a 38-year-old married woman with a child. Asma has been working as a farmer and owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Asma has requested a loan.

Asma is speciA. in her work because she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her stock. 

Fatima is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. Fatima has been working as a farmer and owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan.

Fatima is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. Fatima decided on doing her business because she likes animals. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

Amoun is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. Amoun has been working as a farmer and owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Amoun has requested a loan.

Amoun is speciA. in her work because of her experience since she started when she was young. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

loans.use: To increase livestock and milk production

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., forty-nine, is a married woman with three children. Comfort lives with her family at Kasoa in Ghana. She runs a grocery kiosk in her neighborhood. She has been in business for two years. Comfort buys her goods from wholesalers for retailing to her customers in the community where she lives.

Comfort wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to save her the problem of frequent trips. She is a member of a group called “Enye Ho” trust group. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama Mané, 42 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Adama Mané, 42, is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 4 years. Her business consists of buying peanuts to transform into peanut butter for sale. She wants this loan to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Rute

texts.pt:
Rute nasceu em Namaacha tem 35 anos de idade e solteira e  estudou ate a 10ª classe, e mãe de um filho de 14 anos de idade que se encontra a frequentar a 7ª classe.


Rute natural de Namacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia,ela teve que interroper os seus estudos quando começa a trabalhar no Hotel Xissaka como secretária do Director durante 5 anos mas devido a mudança do patronato ela foi uma das excluidas e assim perdeu o emprego. Anos depois os seus sogros mandam a embora do lar alegando que  a sua lingua bamto não era a mesma que a do seu marido e ela perde o lar de tanto la estar a sofrer, no mesmo ano ela e chamada para receber uma indiminizaçao no Hotel Xissaka no valor de 15.000.00mt. entao ela opta em iniciar o seu próprio negócio de venda de roupas diversas adqurida na Africa do Sul e revendidas na  capital. Tem viajado 3 vezes por mês pois tem muitos clientes e conta com muitas encomendas tais com lençois, mantas, duvetes, vasos, cortinas, tapetes etc. tem gasto em cada viagem um valor de 35.000.00mt apois a revenda tem tido de lucro 9.000.00mt, aproxima se a hluvuku quando perde a sua casa num insêndio provocado por um corte circuito na electricidade de moçambique estes que não se responsabilizaram pelo sucedido,Rute pede um emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt a hluvuku  para a manutençao da sua casa. Para alem do seu filho responsabiliza se pela sua mãe  esta que vive em sua casa emviando lhe em cada 3 meses um valor de 1.000.00mt.

Este e o primeiro empréstimo de Rute na Hluvuku e Kiva. Estes 15.000.00mt seram usados para comprar material de construção para fazer manutenção da sua casa que foi consumida pelo fogo. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir com o seu salão de cabelereiro.
texts.en:
Rute was born in Namaacha. She is 35 years old, single, and went to school through the 10th grade. She is the mother of a 14 year old son who is in the 7th grade. Rute is a native of Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. She had to interrupt her schooling when she began working in the Hotel Xissaka as the secretary of the Director. She worked there 5 years but due to a change in supervision she was one of the ones excluded, and she lost her job. Years later her in-laws kicked her out of the house alleging that her Bantu language was not the same as that of her husband. She lost her home and was suffering. In the same year she was selected to receive a recompensation from the Hotel Xissaka in the amount of 15,000MT. She decided to begin her own business of selling bedding that she acquired in South Aftica and resold in the Capital. She has travels 3 times each month and has many customers and orders for products like sheets, blankets, duvets, vases, curtains, carpets...etc. She spends 35,000MT with each trip, and after resales she earns 9,000MT. She approached Hluvuku when she lost her home in a fire caused by a short circuit in the wires of Mozambique Electricity, and they would not take responsibility for the accident. Rute is requesting a loan for 15,000MT from Hluvuku to make repairs on her home. Besides her son she is also supporting her mother who lives in her house, and she gives her 1,000MT every three months. This is Rute's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 15,000MT will be used to purchase construction materials to make repairs on her home that was consumed by the fire. She is confident that she will be able to pay off the loan before maturity and request another loan to finish her hair salon.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise sheep

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Y., 39, bakes and sells bread and is requesting a loan to buy materiel for baking bread. She is married to a man who works as a clerk in the United Nation Developement Programme (UNDP), in Southern Sudan. Eshter has four children; one girl, three boys. They attend John Garang Memorial primary school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy materials for baking.

loans.name: Yosra Group

texts.en:
The group, named Yosra, consists of four ladies who live in the region of Bekaa, Lebanon. Foziah, a 34-year-old married woman with six children, raises livestock and produces milk, both very much in demand by the people in her region. She is requesting a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua to expand her livestock and her milk production. This is the first time that Foziah has requested a loan, and in the future she plans on further expansion of her livestock.

Shama, a 42-year-old married woman with nine children, has been raising livestock for about 20 years, with many clients in her region. She is requesting a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to expand her livestock. This is the first time that Shama has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

Fadah, a 41-year-old married woman with five children, has raised livestock for several years and has many clients in her region. She is requesting a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to expand her livestock. This is the first time that Fadah has requested a loan, and in the future she plans on improving her business.

Zahra, 18, owns a livestock and is requesting a loan of $00 from Al Majmoua in order to expand her livestock. This is the first time that Zahra has requested a loan, and in the future she plans on improving her work by additional expansion.

About Group Loans In a group loan, each member receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Yosra group will use the loan to increase their livestock.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: MR M. EST UN JEUNE TAILLEUR DE PROFESSION NE EN 1978 A THIES.IL A COMMENCE A EXERCER CE METIER DEPUIS 1998 ET A OUVERT SON PROPRE ATELIER EN 2008.IL A L'HABITUDE DE TRAVAILLER SUR COMMANDE ET A UNE CLIENTELE IMPORTANTE.AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT ACHETER UNE MACHINE A COUDRE POUR RENFORCER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is a young tailor by profession. He was born in 1978 in THIES. He began working at his trade in 1998 and opened his own shop in 2008. He usually works by special orders and has many customers. With this loan, he wants to buy a sewing machine for bolstering his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Adama Hawa

texts.fr: Adama Hawa S., 37ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans et demi. Son activité est la restauration  Elle compte acheter des provisions pour la préparation des repas qu’elle vend au marché hebdomadaire de Manda. Adama veut renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Adama Hawa S., age 37, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group Sinthiang Coundara for four and a half years. Her business involves food catering. She intends to buy provisions for making meals, which she sells at the weekly marketplace of Manda. Adama wants to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions for making and selling meals

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J., 28, sells maize flour, bread and requests a loan to open a shop. She married a peasant who owns a small farm that grows green vegetables. Susan has two children who attend primary school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a plot for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a shop.

loans.name: Katia Group

texts.en:
The group name is Katia; it is made of five women who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. 

Ayda is a 41-year-old married woman with two children. She has owned livestock for twenty years. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.
Ayda is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on her business because it is in demand in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock. 

Katia is a 56-year-old woman. She has been working in agriculture for fifteen years and owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.
Katia is special in her work because she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

Faryha is a 31-year-old married woman with five children. She has been working in agriculture for fifteen years and owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.
Faryha is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. Faryha decided on her business because she likes animals. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

Almaza is a 28-year-old woman. She has been working in agriculture for six years and owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.
Almaza is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock. 

Khayriya is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children. She has been working in agriculture for six years and owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.
Khayriya is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. She decided on her business because she learned it since she was young. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

loans.use: To increase their livestock

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr: OULIMATA N. EST UNE VIELLE FEMME QUI HABITE AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY DE THIES.ELLE FAIT DU COMMERCE DE PRODUITS DIVERS (bols,tasses et fruits ) devant l'hopital régional de thies;avec ce pret ,elle compte renforcer ses stocks de marchandises.
texts.en:
OULIMATA N. is an elderly woman who lives in the CITE LAMY district of THIES. She does commerce in various goods (bowls, tubs, and fruit) in front of the regional hospital of THIES. With this loan, she intends to boost her stock of merchandise

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning Wagué, 37 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Téning veut acheter divers produits (thé, sucre, cigarettes, oignons et autres) pour les  revendre sur table. Elle veut renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Téning Wagué, age 37, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group of Sinthiang Coundara for six years. Téning wants to buy various goods (tea, sugar, cigarettes, onions, and more) to resell on her table. She wants to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell various goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The Sabah group will use this loan to increase their livestock.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Monsieur A. a abandonné les études en 2004, n’ayant pas trouvé de travail il s’est alors lancé dans la restauration. Il a ouvert un cafétéria qu’il a appelé « CAFETARIA LA GRACE » en 2007. Les produits de première nécessité qu’il utilise dans son activité sont épuisés, il sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un second crédit de WAGES. Il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un premier crédit qu’il a parfaitement bien remboursé. Il est célibataire, c’est avec le revenu  de son activité de cafétéria qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. A. abandoned his studies in 2004. Not having found a job, he then started working in the catering business. He opened a cafeteria which he named "CAFETERIA LA GRACE" in 2007. Since the basic need goods that he uses in his business are depleted, he is seeking his second loan through WAGES to resupply himself. He has already obtained one loan through WAGES, which he repaid without problems. He is unmarried, and it is with the income from his cafeteria business that he meets his family's expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic need goods for use in his cafeteria

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: MOUSTAPHA F. EST NE EN 1975 A THIES.IL EST MARIE ET HABITE AVEC SA FEMME A LA CITE OUVRIERE DE THIES.IL FAIT DE l'aviculture depuis 2006 ET VENDS DES ALIMENTS POUR LA VOLAILLE .IL SOLLICITE CE PRET POUR RENFORCER SON ACTIVITE .
texts.en:
Moustapha F. was born in 1975 in Thiès. He is married and lives with his wife in the working class area of Thiès. He has been farming poultry since 2006 and sells poultry feed. He is seeking this loan to strengthen his business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming and selling feed

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 45-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has owned a bakery for four years. He makes "saj" bread and "mankoucheh." Saj bread is named after the saj, the metal oven where you make this traditional style of bread, and the "mankoucheh" is a bready snack made in a traditional Lebanese cooking dome, also used to make "markouk" ("thinned") bread and doughy confections. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and its most common toppings are "zaatar" (thyme), "jebneh" (cheese), and "lahm bi ajin" (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Ibrahim has requested a loan of 1,500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials for his bakery. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan. 

Ibrahim considers himself special in his work because he is known for his good mankoucheh. His clients are people from his region. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation, and he also wanted to have an independent career. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Bamba

texts.fr: BAMBA D. EST NE A TUIES LE 15 AOUT 1975.IL EST TOLIER DE PROFESSION ET SON ATELIER SE TROUVE PRES DE LA GARE ROUTIERE.IL TRAVAILLE AVEC SES AMIS MECANICIENS. AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT ACHETER DU MATERIEL POUR RELANCER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
Bamba D. was born in Thiès on 15 August 1975. He is a tinsmith by profession, and his workshop is located near the bus station. He works with his mechanic friends. With this loan, he would like to buy equipment to boost his business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen his tinsmith business

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet N. is the leader of the Kavule Effort women’s group, in Mukono. She is 39 years old and married with six children ages two to nineteen. She also cares for four orphans who attend school.

Juliet has a clinic that she has run for 14 years with her husband. They have a dream of building a hospital plus a residential house away from the clinic. Now they stay under the same roof as the clinic. For all the times she has taken loans, she has expanded her clinic. Juliet needs another loan to buy more medicines and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Buy more medicines for her clinic.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 52-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abbass has been working as a car repairer for twelve years. He also sells tires and car spare parts.

Abbass requested a loan of 2,000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tires for his business. This is the first time that Abbass has requested a loan.
