Abbass is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any competition. He decided on his business because he took after his father’s business, as well as learning it since he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his business

loans.name: Haki Sawa Group

texts.en:
Rehema J., 34, is a divorcee with three children, ages 18, 15 and five. She sells fried cassava, ice cream and juice. For over a year she has worked daily from 6am until 3pm. Rehema earns a monthly profit of around $30.

This will be Rehema’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use this loan to buy more cassava and cooking oil, to make more ice cream and to buy more fruit to make juice.

Rehema will share this loan with her group, Haki Sawa which totals 21 members. Members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the entire loan. (Rehema is the first person on the left, in a red top.)

loans.use: Buy more cassava, cooking oil and fruit to make juice and icre cream.

loans.name: Cheikh Oumar

texts.fr: MR D. EST UN JEUNE INFORMATICIEN NE A THIES LE 12 MAI 1980.EN PLUS DES COURS QU'il donne dans une école il fait du commerce d'ordinateurs et de la maintenance .IL GERE PARALLELEMENT UN CYBER.AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT AMELIORER SES ACTIVITES .
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a young computer specialist who was born in Thiès on 12 May 1980. In addition to the courses he teaches at a school, he also sells and maintains computers. At the same time, he runs a cyber cafe. With this loan, he would like to improve his business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell computer equipment

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin has been selling car accessories since 1995. He also sells car cleaning products. Yasin is known for the quality of his merchandise. His clients are his friends and neighbors. His business has been successful from the start. Yasin is 25 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his parents. 

Yasin has requested a loan of $1500 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories and cleaning products

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef has been working as a blacksmith since 2001. He is trusted in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networks. He is 38 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children.

Yousef has requested a loan of $2000 US  from Al Majmoua in order to purchase iron for his work. This is the first time that Yousef has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase iron

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. He has been working as an electrician since 2007.

Ali requested a loan of 1,500 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he is trustworthy. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hasna is a 49-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa area with her husband and their four children. Hasna has owned a grocery store since 2007. She has requested a loan of 1,500 LBP from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Hasna has requested a loan. 

Hasna feels special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tissue and wood for his furniture building and repair work.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane M., 49, is the leader of Kavule group in Mukono. She is married and the mother of four children, ages 25 – 7 years.

She is grateful that loans have enabled her and her husband to pay school fees for her children plus two dependents that she helps to care for.

Jane has a boutique that sells ladies clothes. To increase profits, Jane hopes to buy a car in the future to market her products, have her own business premises and to stop renting. She needs a loan to buy more clothes like skirts, blouses, and trousers for sale.

loans.use: Buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Hatice

texts.es:
La señora Hatice vive en casa propia en la calle  Cesar Franco de la zona de tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja como enfermera en un hospital del gobierno con ingresos  mínimos por lo que ella sigue estudiando para poder aspirar un cargo mejor, el crédito que solicita es para pagar un diplomado en enfermería.

Es cliente de Impro y por el antecedente que tiene  puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hatice lives in her own home on Cesar Franco St. in the city of La Paz. She works as a nurse in a government hospital with minimal income, which is why she's studying to be able to aspire to a better position. The loan she's requesting is to pay for a nursing certification. She is a client of Impro and with her background she can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of a nursing certification, giving her the opportunity to improve her salary

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 38-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa area. Husein sells paint accessories. He sells paint, tools, and lots more. Husein requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work, which he started during a time of financial difficulty. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan. 

His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for paint accessory sales business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesús vive en la calle Rigoberto Paredes de la zona de san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; vive en casa de sus padres y estudia en la escuela Hotelera la carrera de Chef Internacional. Jesús  trabaja en una panadería elaborando pasteles; el crédito que solicita es para pagar las pensiones y matricula y seguir estudiando hasta terminar la carrera.

No es cliente de Impro pero por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito. El análisis de su lujo de caja permite apreciar que no tendrá problemas en pagar las cuotas mensuales del préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús lives on Rigoberto Paredes Street in the neighborhood of San Pedro in La Paz. He lives at home with his parents and studies in the Hotelera School to be an International Chef. Jesús works at a bakery making cakes. The loan he's requesting is to pay tuition and pension and to continue studying to finish his degree. He is not a client of Impro but with his social character he can access a loan. The analysis of his cashflow indicates that he will have no problems in paying the monthly payments on his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of tuition and pension at the Hotelera School to finish his studies to become an International Chef

loans.name: Wajih

texts.en:
Wajih has been working as a farmer for 32 years. He plants tomatoes, cabbage, cauliflower, and marrow. His clients are fruit and vegetable shops. Wajih is good at farming and he has been successful at this work from the start. Wajih decided on farming because he learned it when he was young and he likes the world of agriculture. He is 59 years old and lives in the Bekaa. 
Wajih has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase seeds. This is the first time that Wajih has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and minerals

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working as a blacksmith for nine years. Ali requested a loan of $800 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase a car for his work.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El señor Andrés vive en casa propia en la calle Francisco Suárez de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un micro bus con el cual trabaja como transporte publico de pasajeros, este es su único medio para generar ingresos y con lo que gana el mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir sus necesidades; el crédito que solicita es para comprar batería y poder mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo.

Es cliente antiguo y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Andrés lives in his own home on Francisco Suárez Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. He has a bus which he uses for public transportation. This is the only means to earn income and iwth which he can support his family and cover his needs. The loan he's requesting is to buy a battery and to be able to improve the conditions of his tool for work. He is an old client and pays well; for that reason, he will be able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a battery for his bus

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is a 25-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Housam has been working as a tailor for eight years. He sews curtains, clothes and even wedding dresses. Housam requested a loan of $1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for his sewing. This is the first time that Housam has requested a loan.

Housam is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Housam will use the loan to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for his sewing.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina vive en casa alquilada en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 67 años de edad y desde muy joven trabaja vendiendo carne en el mercado, actividad que sigue manteniendo en la actualidad ya que es su único medio de subsistencia. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más carne y mantener su negocio estable.

Su antecedente histórico la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catalina lives in a rented home on Buenos Aires Ave. in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz. She's 67, and since she was very young she's been selling meat in the market, an activity she still does since its her only means of subsistence. The loan she's requesting is the increaser her capital, purchase more meat, and keep her business stable. Her background qualifies her as a good client and can access a new loan. She's been a client of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’adidoadin, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine et d’eau minérale « FIFA ». Elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et 10 cartons d’eau minérale FIFA.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Adidoadin area. She is married and has 5 children. As a revenue-generating activity, she runs a business selling kitchenware and "FIFA" mineral water. She hopes to resupply herself and is seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to buy kitchenware and 10 boxes of FIFA mineral water.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell kitchenware and "FIFA" mineral water

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 41-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Fadi has been working as a mason for 10 years. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Fadi has requested a loan.

Fadi is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Fadi decided on doing his business because of his experience working as a mason since he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Fadi will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Khadigeh

texts.en:
Khadigeh is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their six children. Khadijeh has owned a clothing shop for 11 years. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase the new summer collection. This is the first time that Khadijeh has requested a loan.

Khadijeh is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and she is the only seamstress in her region. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started, she had financial issues. Khadijeh decided on doing her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Khadigeh will use the loan to purchase the new summer collection.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El señor Abrahan  vive en casa de su madre en la avenida principal de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte publico, pero a su vez alquiló una tienda donde venden pasteles que elabora la esposa durante la mañana, con esta actividad ellos mantienen a su familia.
El crédito que solicitan es para comprar un horno industrial, ya que tienen muchos clientes y no abastecen con su producción a todos 

Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Abraham lives with his mother on the main avenue of Llojeta in La Paz. He has a car which he uses for public transportation, but he also rented a store where they sell cakes that his wife makes in the mornings. With this they maintain their family. The loan they're requesting is to buy an industrial oven, since they have a lot of customers and they cannot supply everyone. His background qualifies him as a good client, and he can thus access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an industrial oven to produce more cakes

loans.name: Abed El Karim

texts.en:
Abed El Karim is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abed El Karim has been selling clothing for a year and a half. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, to pay for some décor for his shop (because he just bought his shop) and to purchase clothing stands. This is the first time that Abed El Karim has requested a loan.

Abed El Karim is special in his work because he sells good quality clothes. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. Abed El Karim decided on doing his business because of his experience in selling clothes. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Abed El Karim will use the loan to pay for some décor in his shop and to purchase clothing stands.

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
El señor Edson vive en casa propia en la calle Antofagasta de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como jefe de producción en una empresa grafica, el crédito que solicita es para comprar material de estudio en su rama gráfica y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de educación para poder percibir un sueldo mejor.

No es cliente de Impro, éste es su primer crédito, pero por el carácter social puede acceder al mismo.
texts.en:
Mr. Edson lives in his own home on Antofagasta Street in the Pasankeri neighborhood in La Paz. He works as a production manager in a graphics firm. The loan he's requesting is to purchase study materials in his graphics branch and to thus improve his level of education to obtain a better salary. He's not an IMPRO client. This is his first loan, but through his social character he can access one.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of study books in his field in order to improve his salary

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine T. is the leader of the Victoria group in Katosi. She is 36 years old and a friendly lady. For 13 years she has sold fish, especially the small silver fish known as "Mukene."

Christine is a widow and responsible for caring for five children, ages 10-20. All are in school. She also helps to care for one child who is in primary school.

Christine has been successful in her business because of her experience, cleanliness, good pricing plus good customer care. Before her fish selling business started, Christine was a farmer who sold bananas. She dreams to expand her business and build a house that can accommodate her family. Christine needs a loan to buy more Mukene for sale.

loans.use: Buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
For eight years Eden K. has worked as a palm oil manufacturer and trader of firewood in Siwdo, near Cape Coast. She is married with two children and has received a junior high school education. Her husband is a carpenter. She is responsible for paying school fees and for feeding her family.

Her loan will be used to purchase more palm kennels, to prepare oil to sell. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchase palm kennels, prepare oil to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K. is a store operator who sells provisions like milk, Milo and soap, at Siwdo near Cape Coast.  She is married with two children and has received an education through senior high school.  Comfort has been selling provisions for four years and her husband is an upholstery worker.  She is responsible for paying her family’s bills and for providing their food.  Her loan will be used to purchase more provisions to sell.  Comfort hopes to use the profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Resty's Group

texts.en:
Resty N. is 38 years old and the mother of four children, ages 18 years – 18 months. She is a friendly and hard working lady with a 10 year old restaurant business. She also sells raw bananas.

Most of the food Resty prepares is grown from her farm with only a few items bought from neighbors. She works hard to insure that she saves enough for her children’s education, since two are in candidate classes.

With her good customer care, Resty hopes to open up other outlets so she can maximize her profits, build a big family house and pay school fees for her children, with the balance injected in her restaurant to buy sauce. She is a member of Victoria lending group in Lugazi.

loans.use: Buy sauce and food stuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ikpindi

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier de Sanguéra qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle a appris le métier de la coiffure et a ouvert depuis 1992, son propre atelier de coiffure qu’elle a appelé « NINA COIFFURE », elle y a associé le commerce de mèches. Elle veut acheter des accessoires pour son activité de couture et augmenter son stock de mèches. Pour pouvoir réaliser cela elle sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Sanguéra district, which is an outlying part of the city of Lomé. She learned to be a hairstylist and, in 1992, opened her own hair salon, which she named "NINA COIFFURE." At the salon, she also sells weaves. She would like to buy accessories for her salon and to increase her stock of hair weaves. To be able to realize this, she is seeking (through WAGES) her second loan. She is married and has 2 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair weaves

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
Caroline N., 32, is the leader of group Victoria. She is a married mother with six children aged 16 – 2 years. She also cares for four orphans.

She has a saloon business that she's owned for seven year and before that she was a farmer. She started her saloon with a loan from Pearl Microfinance. At first, she thought things would be very hard, but due to her friendly nature and good customer care, in addition to good quality items, she has been able to succeed.

Per week, she makes a profit of 20,000 shillings. Caroline dreams to increase her profit, build a commercial house for rent and to expand her business to supply weaves, wholesale. Caroline needs a loan to buy weaves and hair extensions for her saloon.

loans.use: Buying weaves and hair extensions for her saloon.

loans.name: Moussiliatou

texts.fr:
D. G.  Moussiliatou est née le 04/08/1971 à Parakou, la plus grande ville du Nord du Bénin, dans le département du Borgou. Moussiliatou est mariée à AGOUNDO Abel chauffeur de profession. Moussiliatou est mère d’un seul garçon du nom de Orace qui est en quatrième année du cours primaire. Moussiliatou est maîtresse couturière et a ouvert depuis cinq (5) ans son atelier de couture au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Moussiliatou a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé pour vendre des articles de mercerie. Moussiliatou a très bien remboursé ces trois crédits et a également réussi à développer son commerce de vente d’articles de mercerie avec. Toutefois, Moussiliatou n’a pas encore tous les articles de mercerie que sa clientèle lui demande. Moussiliatou veut aussi s'approvisionner en gros désormais. Alors Moussiliatou pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients et arriver à faire plus de profit, sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Moussiliatou D. G. was born on 4 August 1971 in Parakou, the largest city in the north of Benin, in the department of Borgou. Moussiliatou is married to Abel Agoundo, a driver by profession. Moussiliatou is the mother of one boy named Orace, who is in his fourth year of primary school. Moussiliatou is a master dressmaker and, 5 years ago, opened her own sewing shop in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Moussiliatou has already benefited from three previous loans through ALIDE to sell haberdashery items. Moussiliatou repaid all these three loans perfectly and successfully developed her business of selling haberdashery items through these loans. However, Moussiliatou does not yet have all the items which her clientele asks for. Moussiliatou would also like to supply herself in bulk from now on. Thus, to satisfy the demands of her clientele and to make a bigger profit, Moussiliatou is seeking her fourth loan through ALIDE. The meaning of ALIDE in Fon, the local language of Benin, is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its annual per capita income is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dressmaking supplies in bulk

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D. is married with 2 children and has received an education through Senior High School. Rose works as a seamstress and also sells beverages such as Malt, Fanta and Coca Cola at Siwdo near Cape Coast.  She has been in business for three years and her husband is employed as a driver. Rose uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees.  Rose will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for selling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to add to the capital of her business and to further expand her enterprise.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de huit  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 46ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent dans le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de mariage. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter le volume de leur activité génératrice de revenus, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé les précédents. 
Elles font essentiellement la  vente de poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, frit, fumé et séché). 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 40 corbeilles correspondant à 500kg de poisson frais qui seront séchés dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel conçu pour la circonstance (ce séchoir est fabriqué à partir des branches d’arbre et de paille ). 
Elles se ravitaillent en poisson sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango. Le poisson ainsi séché est revendu au comptant dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Bousssin, Siribala, Niono et Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt,  l’épargne et l’augmentation du fonds de commerce. 
Elles ont pour ambition de mener des activités d’élevage des ovins et des caprins.
texts.en:
This Benkadi group is composed of 8 married women, mostly from polygamous families with an average age of 46 and 4 children, on average. They live in the Djaka kin neighborhood of Kirango Markala (4the administrative region of Mali) and met through bonds of neighborhood and marriage.

In the intention of growing their businesses, they decided to join the micro-finance program Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 4th solidarity loan, after having reimbursed all the preceding loans successfully.

They essentially sell fish in all its forms (fresh, fried, smoked and dried). They intend to use this loan to buy 40 baskets corresponding to 500 kg of fresh fish which will be dried in a corner of their homes using a traditional dryer made for this purpose (this dryer is made of tree branches and straw.) They buy their fish on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango. The dried fish is sold for cash in the weekly markets of Diamarabougou, Bousssin, Siribala, Niono and Ségou, to a clientele composed mainly of women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 31,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan, put into savings, or used to expand their working capital. Their ambition is to raise goats and sheep.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fresh fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: B. Aisha, 49, is the leader of Victoria group in Lugazi. She is a widow with 5 children aged 13-30 years. One of her children is already out of school. The others are in school, all candidate classes. She also cares for 6 dependants. She has enrolled them all into a Government school but helps to clothe, feed, pay medical bills and buy them books and school uniforms. Aisha has a restaurant business that has been functional for 3 years and fully serviced using loans from Pearl Microfinance. Her business is doing well because of the way she handles her customers. As a result of her success and reputation, she also won a tender to supply food for a fishing company in Katosi, her business location. Aisha has a dream of one day building her own house that can accommodate her restaurant business so that she can give the restaurant room for expansion and she can also stop renting.

loans.use: Buying food supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouman est composé d’une veuve et de sept femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 26ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et social (entraide dans les évènements sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles). 
Elles font exclusivement l’achat et la vente de poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, frit, fumé et séché) depuis leurs bas âges. 
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leur activité génératrice de revenus, elles  ont  intégrer le programme de crédit  de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire après avoir remboursé sans difficulté les précédents.
Elles comptent acheter, 88 corbeilles correspondant à 1,320 tonnes de poisson frais auprès des pêcheurs de Markala et en période de crise à Macina ou à Teninkou. Une partie du poisson est vendue frais en ambulant dans le quartier administrative (service kin) de Kirango et l’autre moitié est d’abord séchée dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel conçu pour la circonstance. Le poisson ainsi obtenu est revendu au comptant et en détail à Ségou,  dans les foires de Bousssin et Siribala à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent  réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 53.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour épargne et pour la prise en charge des frais médicaux des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élever des animaux (bovins) afin de construire une maison à usage d’habitation petit à petit.
texts.en:
The group Dembagnouman is composed of a widow and seven married women, mostly in polygamous families, who average 26 years of age and 3 children. They all live in the Djaka Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community, marriage, and social groups (mutual aid for societal events: marriage, baptisms, and funerals). The group members have exclusively been buying and selling fish in all forms (fresh, fried, smoked, and dried) since they were young. In order to increase the volume of their income-earning business, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding ones without a problem. They intend to buy 88 baskets of fish, equal to 1.32 tonnes, from fishermen in Markala, and in Macina or in Teninkou in times of crisis. A portion of the fish is sold fresh door-to-door in the administrative district (service Kin) of the Kirango area, and the other portion is first dried in a corner of the house using a traditional dryer designed for this purpose. The fish thus obtained is resold retail, cash or credit accepted, in Ségou, at the fairs of Bousssin and Siribala, to customers composed of men and women. The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 53,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to cover the medical costs for the children. Their ambition is to raise animals (cattle) in order to build a house, little by little, in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Kossi Mawuli

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de bè-klikamè  qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, il est célibataire et pour pouvoir subvenir convenablement à ses besoins il a commencé l’année dernière le commerce de friperie. Ce commerce marche bien pour lui car beaucoup de jeunes aiment acheter  leurs vêtements dans la friperie car ses vêtements sont en plus d’être de bonnes qualités moins chers. Il s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoè, il souhaite agrandir son commerce et sollicite pour cela son premier crédit pour acheter 2 ballots de friperie.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a resident of the Bè-Klikamè district, which is an outlying ara of the city of Lomé. He is unmarried, and to meet his needs properly, he began selling second-hand clothes last year. This business works well for him, because lots of young people like buying their clothes in his store, since his clothes, besides being of good quality, are cheaper. He supplies himself at the local market in Hedzranawoè. He hopes to enlarge his business and for this, he is seeking his first loan to buy 2 bundles of used clothing.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Djiguifa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguifa est constitué de neuf  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 33ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative  de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’amitié.
Ce groupe fait essentiellement le commerce de poissons. En plus du poisson certaines d’entre elles font parfois le commerce d’oignon et de bois de chauffe à domicile.
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir remboursé correctement leurs trois premiers prêts solidaires, elles sont à leur 4ème  qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 60 corbeilles correspondant à 900 kg de poisson frais. 
Elles se ravitaillent en poisson sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango. Une partie du poisson est séchée dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel et l’autre moitié est vendue à l’état crue. Le poisson ainsi séché est revendu au comptant et en détail dans les foires de Konobougou, Sansanding et Siribala à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles  envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51 000FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt et pour l’épargne. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir chacune un congélateur pour pouvoir conserver le poisson pendant les périodes de mévente.
texts.en:
This Djiguifa group is made up of nine married women, mostly from monogamous families, with an average age of 33 and 4 children, on average. They all live in the Djaka kin neighborhood of Kirango Markala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and they met because of being neighbors and friends.

This group essentially sells fish. Besides fish, certain of them sometimes sell onions and firewood out of their homes. So as to increase the volume of their money-earning activities, they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having reimbursed their first three solidarity loans correctly, they are on their 4th, which will be used to buy 60 baskets, corresponding to 900 kg of fresh fish.

They buy their fish on the banks of the Niger River at Kirango. Part of the fish is dried in a corner of the house on a traditional dryer and the other half is sold raw. The dried fish is sold retail and on a cash basis in the market fairs of Konobougou, Sansanding and Siribala to a clientele composed mainly of women. They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 51,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and to add to savings. Their ambition is to each have a freezer so that they can keep the fish during periods where sales are slow.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish to sell

loans.name: Nyètaa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Nyètaa sont mariés majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 35ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et d’associations traditionnelles (entraide dans les évènements sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles). 
Ce groupe fait l’achat vente de poissons sous toutes ses formes (fumé séché etc.)
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur  quatrième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé les trois précédents prêts.
Elles comptent utiliser le prêt pour acheter, 30 corbeilles correspondant à 450 kg de poisson frais qui sera entièrement séchés à l’aide de séchoirs traditionnels. 
Elles se ravitaillent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à Kirango principalement avec leurs maris et en temps de crise avec d’autres pêcheurs de la place. Le poisson ainsi séché est revendu au comptant et en détail dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Bousssin, Siribala et au marché journalier de Kirango à une clientèle constituée  généralement de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36.560FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt et  l’achat des habits pour les enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élever des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The four members of the Nyètaa group are married and mainly live in monogamous families. They are on average 35 and have 3 children, on average. They all live in the Djaka kin neighborhood of Kirango Markala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and them met through ties of marriage and through traditional associations (helping each other with marriages, baptisms, and funerals).

This group buys and sells fish in various forms (smoked, dried, etc.) With the intention of satisfying the needs of their clientele, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their 4th solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans.

They intend to use this loan to buy 30 baskets (corresponding to 450 kg) of fresh fish, which will be completely dried using traditional dryers. They buy their fish on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango, mainly from their husbands and in periods of crisis, from other local fishermen. The dried fish is sold for cash and retail in the market fairs of Diamarabougou, Bousssin, and Siribala and in the daily market of Kirango, to a clientele composed generally of women.

They each hope to make a monthly average profit of 36,560 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and buy clothing for their children. Their ambition is to raise sheep and goats.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish to sell

loans.name: Nourietou

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des pagnes, elle exerce cette activité au marché local d’atsanvé et le fait de façon ambulante les jours où le marché n’est pas animé. Elle vend ses pagnes à crédit à ses fidèles client et récupère son argent dans les huit ou dix jours. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Son stock actuel de pagnes étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour renouveler son stock avec 20 pièces
texts.en:
As a revenue-generating activity, this woman runs a business selling pagnes (brightly coloured West African cloth). She runs this business at the local market in Atsanvé and door-to-door on days when the market is not active. She sells her pagnes on credit to her loyal customers and collects her money in eight to ten days. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. Her current stock of pagnes being depleted, she is seeking (through WAGES) a loan to renew her stock with 20 sets of pagnes.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes (a type of brightly coloured West African cloth)

loans.name: Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yiriwaton sont au nombre de quatre femmes toutes mariées  majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en  moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et habitent dans le quartier Bananissabakoro  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles mènent diverses activités qui sont entre autres le commerce des tubercules, de poisson, des boissons locales, des fruits, du bois de chauffe, de savons et du charbon de bois.
Afin de pérenniser leurs activités commerciales, elles ont décidé de solliciter la collaboration du programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après huit prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans difficulté, elles sont à leur 9ème prêt.
Elles comptent acheter, 4 sacs de patate, 2 sacs de mangues, 140 kg de poisson, 10 litres d’huile alimentaire, 1sac de sucre, 4 kg de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée (dableni) et 5 cartons de poudre jus de fruits. Elles  s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Ségou, au marché du château. Quant au  poisson il est acheté au bord du fleuve Niger et quelques fois au marché du château. Une partie des patates et du poisson frais sont frits avant leur vente. Quelques fois une partie du poisson est fumée sur commande. Les feuilles d’oseille de Guinée et les poudres de jus de fruits sont transformées en boissons locales pour être vendus. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au bord du goudron traversant le quartier  et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 41.250FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt, la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (médicaments et habillements), l’épargne et l’augmentation du fonds de commerce. 
Elles désirent  toutes avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The members of the Yiriwaton group are 4 married women, mostly living in monogamous families, with an average age of 35 and 4 children. They know each other because of being related and living in the same neighborhood of Bananissabakoro in Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).

They have various activities, among others selling root crops, fish, local drinks, fruit, firewood, soap, and charcoal. So as to make their businesses secure, they decided to seek the collaboration of the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After 8 solidarity loans, all reimbursed without difficulty, they are on their 9th loan.

They plan to buy 4 sacks of sweet potatoes, 2 sacks of mangoes, 140 kg of fish, 10 liters of cooking oil, 1 sack of sugar, 4 kg of hibiscus flowers (locally known as dableni), and 5 cases of powdered fruit juice. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Segou, the Château market. As for the fish, it is bought along the banks of the River Niger and sometimes at the Château market. Part of the sweet potatoes and fresh fish are fried before being sold. Sometimes part of the fish is smoked to fill an order. The hibiscus flowers and fruit juice powder are made into local drinks to be sold. They sell on a cash basis and for credit, out of their homes, at the side of the road that cuts through the neighborhood, and on foot, to a clientele made up of men and women.

They each hope to make an average monthly profit of 41,250 F CFA which will be used for the reimbursement of the loan, to cover certain family expenses (medicine, clothing), to add to their savings and increase their working capital. They each desire to have a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en: Matthew D. is single with no children and has received an education through Junior High School. For 3 years Matthew has made and sold upholstery material at Siwdo near Cape Coast. Matthew uses his income to pay his rent and bills. He will use the loan to purchase additional upholstery material for his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Matthew plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional upholstery materials for his business.

loans.name: Louisa

texts.en: Louisa is 30 years old. She is single and independent. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. With this loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to save more to expand her business. She is a member of community group called Joyful family Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. isa 37 year-old businesswoman. She is married with three children who are currently in school. Rebecca lives with her family at Kasoa, a suburb of Accra the Capital city of Ghana. She sells beef, pig’s feet, cow legs and salt. She buys her stock from Techiman, and retails to her customers. With her small working capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities to make enough income. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to transform her business. She wants to buy bulk quantities of beef, pig feet, cow legs, and salt to serve her customers and to meet their demands. She believes the loan would allow her to expand her business. Rebecca belongs to the community group called Jonathan Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to facilitate repayment of the loans.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantities of beef, pig's feet, cow legs, and salt.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
A. Marie est née vers 1972 à Lokokoukoumè, un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. A. Marie est originaire de Xwla dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Marie est mariée à SEFOU Wassi électricien à GASA FORMATION, un école tertiaire de Cotonou. Marie a deux enfants, une fille et un garçon. La fille Zéchiath a onze (11)ans et est en première année du lycée; le garçon Massoume a six(6)ans et est en deuxième année du cours primaire. Marie est dans la restauration. Marie a un maquis dans lequel elle vent la sauce de mouton avec différentes pâtes de maïs et de caussette d'igname, ainsi que les boissons de la brasserie. Pour élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle sans cesse croîssante, Marie a besoin de moyens financiers. C'est la raison pour laquelle Marie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Marie was born around 1972 in Lokokoukoumè, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She traces her roots to Xwla, in Ouémé County. She is married to SEFOU Wassi, an electrician at GASA FORMATION, a tertiary school of Cotonou. She has two children, a girl and a boy. The girl, Zéchiath, is 11 years old and is in her first year of middle school; the boy, Massoume, is 6 years old and is in his second year of elementary school.

Marie works in the restaurant business. She has an eatery in which she sells mutton soup with different mashes (cornmeal or yam chips), as well as pub drinks. To raise her business level in order to do better in satisfying her customers, who are ever-growing in number, she has a need for funding. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of pub drinks and mutton, as well as condiments for making soups and sauces

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas A. works as a driver and he also owns a grocery store at Siwdo near Cape Coast, which he has done for 10 years.  He is single with no children and has received an education through Senior High School.  He is responsible for paying for food, rent and bills. His loan will be used to buy more groceries for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest in inventory for the grocery store.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Abla Hélène

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris le métier de la coiffure et a associé à cette activité depuis 2007 le commerce des produits cosmétiques, elle voudrait commencer le commerce de tissus, pour se faire elle  sollicite de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt  pour acheter 38 pièces de tissus.Elle est célibataire et c’est le revenu tiré de cette activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned hairdressing as a trade. Since 2007, she has included commerce in cosmetics. She should like to start commerce in cloth. To do so, she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 38 bolts of cloth. She is unmarried, and the income derived from this business is what supports her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Adelina Manuel

texts.pt:
Adelina Manuel M. nasceu em xai-xai distrito capital da província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 36 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos, com idade entre o primeiro com 17 o segundo com 13 e o terceiro tem 10 anos respectivamente.

Adelina é estudante da 10ªclasse curso nocturno, mudou se da cidade de xai-xai em 1986 na companhia da sua família onde vieram morar no distrito de Boane, local onde vivem até nesta data.

Adelina é trabalhadora nas bombas da Galpe como cozinheira desde 2000, obedecendo um calendário das 7 as 17h todos os dias excepto segunda-feira , deste emprego é paga um salário mensal de 2450,00mt assim conseguindo poupar mensalmente 500,00mt. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, teve 5 vezes na associação Gueguegue, com este pretende comprar material de construção afim de dar continuidade com a sua obra, e futuramente pretende solicitar empréstimo para construção de um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Adelina Manuel M. was born in the Xai-Xai district of Gaza, in Southern Mozambique. She is 36 years-old, married, and the mother of three children, ages 17, 13 and 10. Since 1986 she has been living in the Boane district, with her family. Adelina is currently in 10th Grade, attending night classes. Since 2000 Adelina has been working as a cook at a GALP Gas Station. Working six days a week, from Tuesday-Sunday, 7:00 am until 5:00 pm, she makes a monthly salary of 2450,00mt, which allows her to save 500,00mt/month. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva (she has had five loans with Associação Gueguegue in the past) . She plans to use this loan to buy construction material to continue building her house. In the future, she hopes to get a loan to invest in building a commercial space.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Catherina

texts.en: Catherina is a widow and has six children who are currently working. She is a 63 year-old business woman. She started trading forty years ago and she enjoys selling goods. She trades in clothing materials. Catherina believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in Kasoa market. She believes the loan would provide her with greater capital to purchase more stock of clothing materials to serve her customers. Catherina belongs to the community group called Jonathan Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothing materials.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is married, has one child and has received an education through Junior High School. Since 2007 she has sold food supplies such as rice, cooking oil, Milo and milk at Siwdo, near Cape Coast.  While Agnes works as a trader, her husband is employed as a teacher. Agnes uses her income to pay for school fees, utilities, and food. She will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for her business and with the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for selling.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice B. is 39 years old. She is divorced and has three children who are currently in school. She trades in maize and garden eggs ("mock tomato or huckleberry") in the local market of Kasoa, a town in the Central region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has been the lack of funds to support the business. She requests for a loan to enable her buy maize and garden eggs in bulk to expand her business and to upscale sales. She belongs to the community group called Abigail Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase maize and garden eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Awaou

texts.fr:
D. Awaou est âgée de 53 ans. Awaou est originaire d'AGBATO un quartier populaire de la ville de COTONOU, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Awaou est mariée à LATIFOU Déen, un pêcheur. Awaou a trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille tous majeurs. Awaou vendait de façon ambulante les crevettes que son mari ramenait de la pêche. Mais, vue son âge avancé, Awaou a changé d'activité. Awaou vend maintenant à domicile les condiments pour la sauce(tomate fraîche et en boîte, piment, oignon, épices, sel, gombo, crincrin, légumes, huile de palme et d'arachide, etc.) ainsi que les bois de chauffafe. C'est à Tokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Awaou s'approvisionne en condiments. L'activité de Awaou a connu d'évolution grâce à trois crédits qu'elle a bénéficié de la part de ALIDé. Awaou veut pouvoir continuer de développer son activité; c'est pourquoi Awaou sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Awaou is 53 years old. She traces her roots to Agbato, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to LATIFOU Déen, a fisherman. She has three children (2 boys and 1 girl, who are all of age).

From door to door, Awaou used to sell the shrimp that her husband brought back from fishing. But given her advanced age, she has switched to making sales at home. She now sells condiments (fresh and canned tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, spices, salt, okra, crincrin (mallow leaves), vegetables, palm oil, peanut oil, etc.), as well as firewood. Topka, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she acquires her supplies of condiments. Her business has experienced an improvement, thanks to the three loans she obtained from Alidé. She wants to be able to continue developing her business. This is why she’s requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments (tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, vegetables, salt, spices), two 25-liter drums of peanut oil and of palm oil, as well as some firewood

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Madame akpo aicha exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de bijoux, elle fait cette activité depuis 2007 et s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Ghana, son stock est épuisé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter 40montres en bracelet pour dame, 50 gourmettes, et 40 boucles d’oreilles. Elle est mariée et a 01 enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Akpo Aicha earns an income from commerce in jewelry. She has been in this business since 2007 and acquires supplies in Benin and in Ghana. Because her inventory is exhausted, she would like to resupply herself and is requesting from WAGES her second loan to buy 40 bracelet watches for women, 50 chain bracelets, and 40 earrings. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Domingos Francisco

texts.pt:
Domingos Francisco Z. é natural de Maputo, tem 28 anos de idade, casados maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 8, 7, 5 e um mês de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele na sua casa.

Domingos estudou até 10ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira familiares, desde a sua infância nunca mudou se da cidade, a 10 anos que vive de negocio que consiste na compra e venda de diversos produtos. Tem rendimento  por este negócio 1000,00mt diário.

Para domingos este é o 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku e sempre investiu no aumento do estoque. Desta forma domingos sonha abrir outro estabelecimento comercial e conta com o crédito para a compra de mercadoria.
texts.en:
28 year-old Domingos Francisco Z. was born in Maputo, Mozambique, where he still lives. He is married and the father of four children, ages 8, 7, 5 and one month. In addition to supporting his family, he is responsible for supporting one nephew, who lives with them. Domingos's studies were interrupted in 10th grade, due to his family's financial constraints. Domingos' general store, a business he's had for the past 10 years, brings him 1000,00 mt per day. This is his 6th loan with Hluvuku, and he plans to invest it in increasing his stock--as he has done with all previous loans. With the help of credit, Domingos hopes to be able to open a new store, in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at his general store

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is 49 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. Currently, she says, all her children are in junior high and primary school. Her husband is an operator in a sawmill firm in their community. Akosua lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 
Akosua runs a provision store. Her shop is at the local market. She sells provisions such as milo, tea, coffee, etc. She has been in business for four years and desires to expand her business. She purchases the goods from big provision shops in Oda, a nearby bigger town. She is hopeful that she will be able to give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her grocery store.

loans.name: Graça Matilde

texts.pt:
Graça Matilde L. é natural de Maxixe na província de Inhambane, tem 46 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.
Graça concluiu o 4º ano em licenciatura na área de  PAGE pela universidade pedagógica.

Graça a 4 anos que é gestora de um negocio em regime temporário da que só faz quando volta do serviço, diz ela por que ainda não conseguiu alguém que possa confiar e o mesmo ainda é de pequena escala, futuramente ao ampliar comeste financiamento vai empregar alguém para exercer a tempo inteiro. Neste momento tem um rendimento por este negócio 4500,00mt semanal e consegue poupar algum.

Graça solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, já teve vários empréstimos no Socremo outra instituição micro financeira, com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o estoque da sua banca.
texts.en:
Graça Matilde L. was born in Maxixe, province of Inhambane, Mozambique. She is 46 years old, divorced, and the mother of five children, whom she works full-time to support. Graça has completed the fourth year of her teacher's training program, at the Pedagogical University of Mozambique. When she is not at her regular job, she runs a small general store from home. She hasn't found a trusty person to manage the business for her yet, plus the business still operates at a small scale, but with the help of credit, she hopes to be able to grow it and to hire a full-time employee. The store currently brings in 4500,00 mt a week, an amount which allows her to save some money regularly. This is Graça's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She has worked with other microfinance institutions, such as Socremo, in the past. She will use her current loan to buy more merchandise to sell at her general store.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell at her general store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. All her children are still in school. Elizabeth’s husband is a palm nut and cocoa farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Elizabeth is a farmer and trader. She trades in smoked fish and tilapia. She purchases the goods from nearby towns and sells at a tabletop in the market square. She has been in business for four years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and to help her children through school.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk to sell at market.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her business four years ago. She is 29 years old. She trades in products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With the possibility of having increased inventory of different varieties, Grace would appreciate the loan very much. She belongs to the community group called Jonathan Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en: Alhassan Kubratu is 42 years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. She says all of her children are still in school – senior and junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. Alhassan is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles, clothes for both men and women and also bed linens. She also sells children’s wear. She purchases bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for fifteen years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy textiles for her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora B. is 53 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works very hard to support her husband financially to provide for the family.
Dora is a food vendor. She cooks and sells ‘banku’. Banku is a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She prepares the food in her house and sells it at the community market square. Dora purchases bags of maize and other ingredients from wholesalers in nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk. She is hopeful to sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Ricardo Paulo's Group

texts.pt:
Ricardo Paulo M. é natural de Namaacha um distrito fronteiriço com Suazilândia, tem 24 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de um filho com 4 anos de idade. 

Ricardo estudou até 5ªclase e parou por falta de condições, em 1999 mudou se do distrito de Namaacha para Boane na companhia da família. A 2 anos que gere um negocio próprio que consiste na compra e venda de produtos diversos com destaque aos refrigerantes. Deste negócio consegue um rendimento semanal de 1800,00mt.

Para Ricardo este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, tendo conhecido Hluvuku através da sua irmã que já é cliente a bastante tempo, com empréstimo pretende aumentar o seu estoque ampliando assim o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Ricardo Paulo M. is from Namaacha, a region on the border with Swaziland. He is 24 years old, and is married with a four-year-old son. Ricardo went to school through the 5th grade, when he had to give up his studies. In 1999 he moved with his family from Namaacha to Boane. For two years he's had his own business buying and selling a variety of products, especially soft drinks. He earns 1800 mt a week from this business. This is Ricardo's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He heard about Hluvuku from his sister, who's been a client for a long time. With this loan he intends to increase his stock, and thus expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is 46 years old. She is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. She tells us that all of her children are still in school - senior high, junior high and the primary schools. 
Esther lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. Esther is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles: clothes for both men and women and also bed linens. She purchases bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. Esther says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for eight years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for selling at market.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa F. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Some of the children are in the senior high school and the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. Her husband is a hard working man. He is a farmer. Yaa lives with the family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase,  a farming and trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Yaa is into palm oil production. She buys palm nuts from farmers in her community and other nearby towns. She says she distributes the oil to retailers who come from other towns to buy in gallons.

Yaa has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Sédé Y. Noellie

texts.fr:
A. Sédé Y. Noellie est née le 31 Décembre 1967 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; dans le Département du LITTORAL. Noellie est originaire de DANGBO dans le Département de l'OUEME. Noellie est Mariée à MELOME Jean, cuisinier au siège de l'Union Européenne à COTONOU. Noellie est mère de deux (2) filles et deux (2)garçons tous scolarisés. Noellie vit avec sa famille à Gankpodo, un quartier périphérique de la ville de COTONOU. C'est des divers que Noellie vend (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Noellie s'approvisionne en ces divers articles à Tokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est le mari de Noellie qui assure les dépenses familiales. Ainsi, Noellie utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Toutefois, Noellie a besoin de moyens financiers pour amener son activité à un niveau plus élevé afin pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Noellie sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Sédé Y. Noellie was born on December 31, 1967 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County. She traces her roots to Dango, in Oueme County. She is married to MELOME Jean, a cook at the office of the European Union in Cotonou. She is the mother of two girls and two boys, all schooled. She lives with her family in Gankpodo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou.

These are the items that Noellie sells: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, and tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soap for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc. She gets her supplies of these goods at Tokpa, the grand international market of Benin. Her husband is the one who ensure that family expenses are covered. Thus, Noellie uses the revenues from her business to better it. However, she has need of funding to take her business to a higher level in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. This is why she's requesting a loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of sugar, soap, canned concentrated milk, canned tomatoes, and pasta

loans.name: Felismina Augusto

texts.pt:
Felismina Augusto C. é natural de Maputo e tem 48 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de uma filha com 18 anos de idade, alem da filha cuida de um sobrinho que é arfado dos pais.

Felismina é licenciada em ciências sociais pela universidade aberta de Lisboa, a 25 anos que trabalha como professora, tem um horário de trabalho das 7 as 15:30h da segunda-feira a sexta-feira, tendo um salário mensal de 9300,00mt.

Felismina solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela segunda vez, o primeiro no valor de 10000,00mt qual foi para legalização do terreno, este pretende comprar material de construção.

Felismina pretende pagar antes do tempo afim de solicitar outro para continuar com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Felismina Augusto C. is from Maputo. She is 48 years old and unmarried, with an 18-year-old daughter. In addition to her daughter, she also takes care of an orphaned nephew. Felismina has a degree in social sciences from Lisbon's Universidade Aberta. She's worked as a teacher for 25 years, working from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Monday through Friday. She earns 9300 mt a month. Felismina is requesting her second loan from Hluvuku. The first loan, in the amount of 10,000 mt, was used to acquire land, and this loan will be used to purchase construction materials. Felismina intends to pay off her loan early, in order to request another and continue working on building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building supplies

loans.name: Kodjovi Tinin

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier d’agbalépédo qui est un quartier situé au nord de lomé,il est un tailleur, il a ouvert un atelier qu'il a appelé« TINO EXCLUSIVE FASHION ». il confectionne des habits pour hommes qu'il revend. il a beaucoup de clients ce qui fait qu’il réalise d’importants bénéfices sur ses ventes.certains de son matériel de travail étant épuisés et voulant acheter des tissus pour confectionner de nouveaux habits,il s’adresse à WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 3 rouleaux de tissus, 2 paires de pagnes « WAX », 2 paires de pagnes « HI-target », 2 paires de pagnes « SUPER ». il est marié et père de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in Agbalépédo, a district located in northern Lomé. He is a tailor and has opened a workshop he calls "TINO EXCLUSIVE FASHION". He makes clothes for men and sells them. He has many customers, which means he makes a good profit on his sales. Because he's exhausted some of his supplies, and because he wants to buy fabrics for making new clothing, he's inquiring with WAGES and requesting his first loan to buy three rolls of fabrics and two pairs each of WAX, HI-Target, and SUPER brand pagnes (colorful West African cloth). He is married and the father of four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Isabel Amélia

texts.pt:
Isabel Amélia M. é natural de Maputo no distrito de Boane, tem 26 anos de idade, mãe de um filho com 4 anos de idade, alem do seu filho sustenta uma empregada que vive com ela.
  
Isabel estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida, Isabel desde a sua infância sempre está morar no mesmo distrito, desde 2003 vive de negocio que consiste na compra e venda de produtos diversos, tem um estabelecimento sita no quilometro 16, abre o mesmo das 7 as 21h da segunda a sexta e fim de semana abra as 9 e fecha as 00h, deste negocio tem uma receita mensal de 5000,00mt do qual consegue poupar 1500,00mt periodicamente.

Isabel solicita empréstimo pela 3ª vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Futuramente Isabel continuara no aumento de mercadoria e conta com empréstimo na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Isabel Amelia M. is from Maputo in the district of Boane, she is 26 years old, and has 4 year old son, besides her son she supports an employee who lives with her. Isabel was still in high school when she got pregnant, she has been living in the same district since she was a child. Since 2003, her business has been to buy and sell diverse products, she has a store at the 16 kilometer which opens from 7am to 9pm from Mondays to Saturdays and from 9am to 12noon during the weekends, this business has a monthly income of 500,00mt from which she is able to save 1500,00mt periodically. Isabel is requesting a loan for the third time with Hluvuku and first with Kiva, in order to increase her stock. In the future Isabel will continue to increase her merchandise and count with the loans from Hluvuku.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise to buy and sell diverse products

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr:
L. Gisèle est née le 05 Mai 1973 à COTONOU, Capitale Économique du BENIN. Mais Gisèle est originaire de KESSOUNOU dans le Département de l'OUEME. Gisèle est Mariée à DJIDONOU Nicolas un menuisier. Gisèle est mère de quatre enfants dont trois garçons et une fille tous scolarisés. Gisèle vend des produits vivriers à Tokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Gisèle s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux en dehors de la ville de Cotonou. Gisèle arrive à venir en aide à son mari dans les charges familiales grâce au revenu de son activité. Gisèle veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour mieux développer son activité. Ainsi Gisèle pourra augmenter son revenu pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
L. Gisèle was born on May 5, 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She traces her roots to Kessouno, in Oueme County. She is married to DJIDONOU Nicolas, a cabinet maker and is the mother of four children (3 boys and a girl), all in school.

Gisèle sells staple foods at Tokpa, the grand international market of Benin. She gets her supplies from local marketplaces outside of Cotonou City. She manages to come to the aid of her husband regarding family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business. She wants to boost her working capital in order to improve her business. She will then be able to increase her income to do better in meeting her family's needs.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, millet, cassava flour, and rice

loans.name: Komlan Mathias

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’appareils électroménagers en détail, il a commencé ce commerce en 2006, il exerce cette activité dans sa boutique  qu’il a appelé « RIVER TECH ». Il veut agrandir son stock par l'achat de 15 téléviseur LG écran 14 et 10 Antennes. Il est célibataire et c’est avec le revenu issu de son commerce qu’il subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who earns an income from retail commerce in home appliances. He started this business in 2006 and works out of his shop he calls “RIVER TECH”. He wants to expand his inventory by buying fifteen LG televisions with 14” screens and ten antennae. He is unmarried, and with the revenues from his business, he supports himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy televisions and antennae

loans.name: Ericka Marleny

texts.es: Ericka es casada tiene 33 años de edad y 3 hijos, todos van a la escuela, su esposo la ayuda en el negocio de la venta de lácteos y productos de comida por unidad, y por mayor, ellos venden queso, crema, agua pura, refrescos, jugos, gelatinas en vaso etcétera. También tiene una lavandería, juntos salen a repartir el producto a las tiendas ya que cuentan con un vehiculo el cual les hace mucho mas fácil el trabajo por el motivo que tienen los clientes muy lejos de su comunidad, ellos salen a repartir los lácteos 4 días a la semana y los otros 3 días ella se dedica a su lavandería, el préstamo que ella solicita es porque necesitan surtir mas su mercadería por que las ventas son buenas, sus sueño mas grande es ver a sus hijos en la universidad y con un buen futuro
texts.en:
Ericka, 33, is married with three kids. All of them attend school. Her husband helps her with her business selling dairy and food products, such as cheese, cream, fresh water, beverages, juices, and jellies, etc. She also has a laundromat. Together they go out to deliver produce to the stores now that they have a vehicle that makes their work much easier, since they have customers far from their community. They distribute dair products four days a week and the other three she spends at the laundromat. This loan is requested because they need to stock more merchandise since sales are good. Their greatest dream is to see their kids at the university and with a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es casada, y su negocio es la elaboración  y venta de ropa típica bordada, el año pasado se le presento la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo y este fue de mucho éxito para su vida.
Gracias a Dios se le han abierto muchas puertas en el mercado donde vende sus productos, debido a que ahora tiene una mejor calidad, variedad y tamaño de sus productos.
