Su meta es seguir creciendo y así  cada día hacer y trabajar lo que el cliente pide, ya que tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes, por ese motivo solicita un nuevo préstamo.   Su principal sueño es crecer en su negocio y apoyar económicamente en su casa.
texts.en:
Eugenia is married and her business is the production and sale of typical embroidered clothing. Last year she had the opportunity to receive a loan and this was a great success for her life. Thanks to God many doors have been opened to her in the market where she sells her products as she now has better quality, variety and size of her products. Her goal is to continue growing and each day make and work on what the customers request as she has various orders from her clients which is her reason for seeking a new loan. Her main dream is to grow her business and economically support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials for the production of typical clothing

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio C. M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Yolanda Chambi y sus cinco hijos.
Serapio es obrero, trabajando actualmente en alcantarillado publico, dependiente de la municipalidad de esta ciudad y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de contención que ayudara a la estabilización de su vivienda que se encuentra en pendiente.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Serapio C. M. lives in his own home in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of the city of La Paz with his wife Yolanda Chambi and their five children. Serapio is a laborer, currently working in the public sewer system as an employee of the municipality of this city and his wife is a homemaker. The loan requested is for the construction of a retaining wall that will help to stabilize their home which is located on a slope. This is the fifth time that he has applied for a loan and the socio-economic analysis carried out qualifies him favorably to be able to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario T. S. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Filomena Tambo y sus cinco hijos.
Mario es constructor, realizando trabajos en construcciones particulares y su esposa teje guantes para una asociación de artesanos de su barrio.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un baño en su vivienda, dado que realizaron la instalación de alcantarillado en su domicilio.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mario T. S. owns his house, which is in the Llojeta zone, the western side of La Paz city. He lives with his wife, Filomena Tambo, and their five children. Mario is a builder, he works on private construction projects and his wife knits gloves for an artisan's association in their neighborhood. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a bathroom in their home, since they have finished installing a sewage system for their house. This is Mario's third loan request and the analysis of his application favorably qualifies him to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Max Franz

texts.es:
Max vive en la avenida Buenos Aires de la zona Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos  en un pequeño departamento el cual ocupa en alquiler. 

Se dedica al transporte público como chofer asalariado en el sindicato de trufis que recorren el centro de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos para su vehiculo. 

 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Max lives on Buenos Aires avenue in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz city. He lives with his wife and their three children in a small, rented apartment. He works in public transportation as a driver, paid on a wage basis, in a union of trufis (public transportation minibus or minivan) that covers routes in the city center. The loan will be used to buy spare parts for his vehicle. This is Max's first loan with Impro; his credit evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  vive, en la avenida Mariscal Sucre,  de la zona Urbanización Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella es ama de casa, vive junto a sus 2 pequeños hijos, su esposo trabaja en la policía boliviana.
 

 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales de construcción para la refacción de la habitación que ocupan como vivienda. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Julia lives in EL Alto, in an area called Urbanizacion Mariscal Surcre. She is a homemaker who lives with her husband, a Bolivian police officer, and her two small children. This loan will be used to buy building materials to refurbish the room they live in, which is their home. This is Julia's first loan with Impro; she has been evaluated and deemed qualified to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Rene Fernando

texts.es:
Rene P. vive en casa propia en la calle e de la zona de LLojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, en la misma casa instalo una tienda de abarrotes ya que por el lugar que es tan alejado del centro de la ciudad hacia falta una tienda, el crédito que solicita es para surtir la tienda y poder tener mayor clientela de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y también fue parte de Kiva, por lo cual puede acceder a un nuevo crédito
texts.en:
Rene P. owns a house on E Street in the Llojeta zone of La Paz city. In this house he set up a grocery store, since their neighborhood is far from the city center and needed a store. The loan he requests will be used to stock the store and thus attract more customers, improving his income. He is a client of Impro and has also worked with Kiva before, therefore he is qualified to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of capital

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio Huanta vive con sus padres en la calle 3 de diciembre de la zona de LLojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como vendedora en una tienda, el crédito que solicita es para pagar sus estudios y poder buscar un trabajo mejor, ya que como vendedora el salario que percibe es mínimo.

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Rocio Huanta lives with her parents on 3 de Diciembre (December 3rd) Street in the Llojeta zone of La Paz city. She works as a store vendor. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for her studies so that she can look for a better job, as she is currently earning minimum wage at her sales job. She is a client of Impro and has a good history of repayment, therefore she is qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Severa Rina

texts.es:
Severa A. vive en casa de sus padres en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, en la misma casa estableció una tienda de abarrotes, además de esta actividad ella es artesana y realiza diferentes trabajos en porcelana fría, con estas dos actividades genera sus ingresos y puede mantener a su familia ya que es madre soltera y su niña tiene 14 años, el crédito que solicita es para surtir su tienda.

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un crédito nuevamente.
texts.en:
Severa A. lives in her parents' house on Jaimes Freyre Avenue in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She has a grocery store in the same house and in addition she is an artisan who creates various works in cold porcelain. These two activities generate her income and she is able to support her family as a single mother with a 14-year-old daughter. The loan she is requesting is to stock up her store. She is a client of IMPRO and a good payer and consequently her new loan can be approved.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo vive en la calle J. vadani de la zona  Villa Dolores de la ciudad de el Alto

Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos los cuales son mayores de Edad y son independientes.
 

El trabaja como comerciante minorista de manera ambulante en la Ceja de El Alto zona céntrica de la ciudad.


Es el séptimo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo Via Kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Cirilo lives on Calle J. Vadani in the Villa Dolores area of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their children, who have grown up and are independent. He works as a walking salesman in La Ceja de El Alto, the central area of the city. This is his seventh loan from Impro and his second from Kiva. He qualified for this loan after undergoing an evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nidia Luz

texts.es:
NIDIA LUZ Q. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” vive en la Jr Yarinacocha Nº 201.manantay. Tiene 47 años de edad, 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 de sus hijos están aun estudiando.  Ella y su pareja trabajan juntos.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de artículos de belleza y perfumes, y la venta por catálogos.  El primer préstamo  fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  donde compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrarlos, cuenta con clientes fijos y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio ha mejorado.  Con este  préstamo de S/. 3.000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos de belleza.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
NIDIA LUZ Q. S., a member of the Communal Bank “LADIES OF THE EAST," lives at Jr Yarinacocha Nº 201, Manantay. She is 47 years old, and has 5 children, 3 of whom are still in school. She and her partner work together.

She began her business selling beauty products and perfumes, as well as catalog sales. Her first loan was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she purchased a small display case to display her products. She relies on regular customers, and her business has continued to grow.

Today, she has moved forward with her family and her business has improved. With this loan of S/. 3.000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase perfumes, cosmetics and new beauty products.

“Manuela Ramos is an NGO that supports many families with small loans that allow the women of this area to start or expand their businesses, and I am happy with this assistance," she said.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
NELLY M. N., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” vive en el Asentamiento Humano SAGRADO CORAZON DE JESUS-Manantay, tiene 45 años de edad, 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta trabajando  y su pareja se dedica al negocio de madera.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de artículos de primera necesidad (bodega) y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró golosinas, arroz, azúcar, etc. El negocio de la bodega no le ha ido muy bien, por lo que está ingresando de algún modo al negocio de la madera en conjunto con su familia.

Con este  préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de combustible, moto sierra, víveres para que su esposo viaje equipado al monte a talar árboles.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Nelly M. N. is a member of the Communal Bank "Loreto". She lives in the Sagrado Corazon de Jesus-Manantay Settlement. She is 45 years old and has two children, one of whom is working, and her partner works in the wood business.

She started in the business of buying daily necessities (groceries) and with the first loan of 300 Nuvo Soles, she bought candy, rice, sugar, etc. The grocery store didn't go very well, which is why she is joining her family in the wood business.

With this loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles, she will invest in buying fuel, a chainsaw, and supplies so that her husband is fully equipped to cut down trees.

"Manuela Ramos is an NGO that supports a large number of families with small loans to women in the area to start or improve their businesses and I am happy for their help," she says.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fuel, a chainsaw and supplies

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
LUCINDA L. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS LABORIOSAS” vive en la calle  caballo cocha Nº 127, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 25 años de edad, 2 hijos muy pequeños, y su pareja es mecánico.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, inició el negocio de venta de artículos de belleza y perfumes (venta por catálogos).  Cuenta con clientela fija.  El negocio ha mejorado por lo que necesita un mayor capital.

Con este préstamo  de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de media docena de perfumes, 1 paquete de  cosméticos y nuevos productos de belleza.

“Manuela Ramos me dio la oportunidad de poner mi propio negocio y me permite manejarlo sin descuidara mis pequeños hijos”.
texts.en:
Lucinda L. T. belongs to the Las Laboriosas (Hardworking Women) Communal Bank. She lives Caballo Cocha Street in the city of Pucallpa. Lucinda is 25 years old with two very small children. Her husband is a mechanic. With her first loan of 300 New Sols, she started her catalog sales business selling beauty products and perfumes. She has regular customers and the business has grown, but what it needs is more working capital. With this loan of 1,500 New Sols, she will buy half a dozen perfumes and an assortment of cosmetics and new beauty products. She says, "Manuela Ramos gave me the opportunity to set up my own business and it allows me to manage it without neglecting my little children."

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, cosmetics and other merchandise.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
LLERME R. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. LIBERTAD Nº 820, CALLERIA, tiene 40 años de edad.  Se dedica a la estética (salón de belleza).
La señora Llerme tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos son menores de edad.  Ella y su pareja están casados desde hace 19 años.

Ella tiene 8 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar productos de belleza y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, ya generó el primer puesto de trabajo directo, debido a que tiene una joven ayudante laborando en su pequeño negocio, ubicado en su domicilio.

Ese préstamo de S/ 1.200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo de su local y comprará una docena de tintes para cabello, un juego de tijeras, un paquete de Sampoo, etc.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Llerme R. R. belongs to the Damas del Oriente (Ladies of the East) Communal Bank. Her home is located on Libertad Avenue, Callería (Pucallpa). She is 40 years of age and has three children, two of whom are minors. She and her partner have been married for 19 years. She works as a hairdresser in her own beauty salon. She has been working with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for eight years. She used her first loan of 300 New Sols to buy beauty products and so that she could continue developing her small business which is located in her home. At present, her business has generated additional employment since she now has a young assistant working in her little business. With this loan of 1,200 New Sols she will fix up her shop and buy a dozen hair dyes, a set of scissors, a case of shampoo, etc. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because no other bank would give her a loan while Manuela Ramos, without a lot of paperwork, trusted in her and motivated her to be responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, scissors, shampoo.

loans.name: Juana Noemi

texts.es:
JUANA NOEMI F. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” su negocio está en su propia casa ubicado en el Jr Carmen cabrejos N°  341, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 62 años, 3 hijos y todos profesionales.

	Ella pertenece a MANUELA RAMOS desde hace 2 años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en comprar algunos abarrotes, para surtir su pequeño puesto.

Ella anima a sus socias que sean puntuales con sus pagos.
Con este  préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá  en la compra de 2 paquetes de gaseosas, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de leche y además pintará su pequeño local para darle más vida al negocio.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Juana Noemí F. M. belongs to the Communal Bank “Ladies of the East”. Her business is in her own house located in the District of Calleria. She is 62 years old, and has 3 children all of which are professionals. She has belonged to the Manuela Ramos Group for the past 2 years; the first loan that she received was of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase groceries to add variety to her small stand. She encourages her fellow group members to be punctual in their payments. With this loan of 1,200 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of 2 soft drink packages, 1 sack of rice, 1 box of milk, and she will also paint her small locale to give her business more life. She thanks Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community with the services it provides, it also contributes to the lives of the women in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as soft drinks, rice, and milk. To carry out maintenance on the locale (infrastructure).

loans.name: Rene Lucia

texts.es:
Rene Lucia Dávila V. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada.
Doña Rene tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Rene es la venta de mercadería en general. Doña Rene es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 7 años que de se dedica a este negocio. Doña Rene dio inicio su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenia que mantener a sus hijos. El propósito de Rene es proporcionar a sus clientes diversidad en sus productos y satisfacer a sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de ropa, prendas de oro laminado, plata, bolsos, calzado entre otros. El deseo de Rene es de proporcionarle a su hijo la educación necesaria para que sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Rene Lucia Dávila V. is 29 years old, and married. Rene has 1 child and sells general merchandise. Rene is a very determined and enterprising woman, which leads her to greatly enjoy her business. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 7 years. Rene began this business due to her desire to get ahead in life given that she had to support her child. Rene’s intention is offer her clients variety in her products and to please them. The loan is destined to serve as work capital, and the money will be used to purchase clothing, gold plated jewelry, silver, bags, and shoes amongst other items. Rene hopes to give her son the necessary education so that he becomes a skilled professional.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase clothing, gold plated jewelry, silver, bags, and shoes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA A. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” su negocio está ubicado en el Mercado N° 2 Distrito de Calleria, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos mayores de edad.
Su esposo es coadministrador del negocio (venta de prendas de vestir).

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de ropas para Damas y niños, desde hace 7 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
Su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con el préstamo  de S/.1,400.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará 1 docena de blusas, 2 docenas de polos para niños y niñas y 1 docenas de pantalones para damas. 

“Si no fuese por Manuela Ramos, no tendría el negocio ni tampoco a mi familia unida porque gracias a la oportunidad que me dieron, pude educar a mis hijos”.
texts.en:
Juana A. L. belongs to the Communal Bank “Ladies of the East”. Her business is located in the District of Calleria. She is 59 years old, and has 3 older children. Her husband is the co-administrator of the business (sale of clothing). The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of clothing for women and children; she has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 7 years. Her business has been growing as time has passed, and because of that she has found it necessary to increase the loan amounts. With the loan of 1,400 PEN, she will purchase 1 dozen blouses, 2 dozen children’s polo shirts, and 1 dozen women’s pants. “If it had not been for Manuela Ramos, I would not have this business nor would my family be united because thanks to the opportunity that I was given, I can educate my children.”

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, polo shirts for children, and pants.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
S. C. D. A. PILAR 
90001727


La señora Pilar  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia D. Azangaro, departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada con 06 ya independientes, vive en el Jr. Julia Paredes, Barrio Vilca Apaza, ella posee estudios D. superior incompleta, (trabajo social). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 meses, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. productos veterinarios, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, a fin D. comprar mas productos veterinarios  para su tienda.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que piensa pagar en 06 cuotas; el mismo que le servirá para poder adquirir mas mercadería productos veterinarios (vacunas, vitaminas, alimento balanceado),  su esposo es veterinario y los dos manejan el negocio; su deseo seguir trabajando para poder en el futuro vender al por mayor sus productos.

Le gustaría  comprarse una casa en Arequipa, y continuar apoyando a sus hijos. 

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha la puntualidad  y la facilidad con que dan los préstamos, y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por  el apoyo que les brindan.
texts.en:
Pilar S. C. D. A.
90001727

Pilar is a member of the Community Bank "Aswancaris II" in the province of Azangaro, in the Puno region. She is 56 years old and she is married and has 6 children who are already independent. She lives in Jr. Julia Paredes, in the Vilca Apaza colony. She earned a post secondary degree in social work.

She has been involved with the Manuela Ramos program (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 10 months. Her business is the buying and selling of veterinary products. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.500 nuevos soles and it was invested in purchasing veterinary products for her store.

She requires a new loan in the amount of S/.800 neuvos soles, to be repaid in 6 payment installments. The funds will be used to acquire more verterinary products merchandise (vaccines, vitamines, balanced food). Her husband is a veterinarian and they both manage the business. Her dream is to keep working towards her goal of one day being able to sell her products on a wholesale basis.

She would love to be able to purchase a home in Arequipa and to keep supporting her children.

She mentione that she really appreciates the expediency and ease of receiving loan funds, and she feels very grateful towards Manuela Ramos for the support they have provided her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase veterinary products such as vitamins, vaccines, and food.

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es: Aleyda E. Narváez tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Aleyda tiene 3 hijos todos estudian. La actividad económica de Aleyda es la venta de gaseosas y brinda el servicio de billares. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Aleyda inicio este negocio por la necesidad de una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Este negocio de Aleyda esta ubicado en su vivienda porque la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma comarca, Aleyda dice que tiene que trabajar muy duro para obtener el pan de cada día. Los propósitos de Aleyda son de ampliar su negocio y obtener más productos. El financiamiento que solicita es especialmente para capital de trabajo y con este dinero podrá comprar gaseosas, golosinas, pollo y además proporcionarle mejoras a las mesas de billar. Los sueños de Aleyda  son de mejorar cada día con el servicio ofrecido y además con el paso del tiempo convertir su negocio en restaurante.
texts.en:
Aleyda E. Narvárez, 45, is married and has three children who go to school. Aleyda sells soft drinks. She also has billiards tables. She has been working at this for over eight years. Aleyda started the business because she needed a source of family income. Her business is located in her home because the majority of her customers are from her area. Aleyda has to work very hard to earn her daily bread. Aleyda plans to expand her business and get more products. The loan she is asking for is especially for working capital. With this money she will be able to buy soft drinks, sweets, chicken, and also make improvements on her billiard tables. Aleyda’s dreams are to get better every day with the service she offers. In the future she also wants to convert her business into a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.es: La señora Ma. Isabel D. vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ellos tiene una tienda de abarrotes de nombre “Aiko” con 2 años establecido. El negocio lo tiene muy surtido, porque producto que sus clientes les solicitan producto que compran y ya que desean invertir en mas mercancía para su negocio es por lo que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Isabel D. lives with her husband and two children. They have a grocery stored named Aiko. They have had the store for two years. The business is well stocked because the products her customers ask for are the products they buy. They would like to invest in more merchandise for their business. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Alejandra Celene

texts.es: Alejandra Celene B. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Alejandra tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de esta Alejandra es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio consiste en una pequeña pulpería que apareció con las intenciones de mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, y fue así como le gusto tanto este negocio por lo que es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo. Sus propósitos mas grandes para su negocio son de ofrecer a sus clientes todo para todos y ofrecer la mejor atención. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así invertir en la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, gaseosas y refrescos. El deseo de Alejandra es de crecer lo suficiente y mantener esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Alejandra Celene B. is 43 and married. She has one son, and he goes to school. Alejandra has a mini market. She has had this business for more than ten years. She started her small mini market with the intention of improving her family’s quality of life, and it has. She really likes this business. She is a woman who likes the work. Her bigger plans for her business are to offer her customers everything for everybody and to offer better service. That is why she is asking for a loan for working capital. She will buy sweets, bread, cookies, soft drinks and sodas. Alejandra’s wish is to grow sufficiently and maintain her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto vive con su esposa la señora Juanita, ellos son una familia estable y unida.
El labora para una empresa en el área de mantenimiento desde hace 2 años, la señora Juanita tiene un negocio propio de abarrotes, y cuentan además con el apoyo de su hija la señorita Judith Verenice que contribuye para el pago de los gastos familiares. 
Ellos tiene un proyecto para mejora de su hogar, ya que le han ido construyendo un cuarto para ampliarse, pero solo les esta haciendo falta el techo y es por lo que solicitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto lives with his wife, Juanita. They are a stable and united family. He has worked for a maintenance company for two years. Juanita has her own grocery business. They also count on support from their daughter, Judith Verenice. Judith helps with the family’s expenses. They have a project to improve their home. They have been constructing a room to make the house bigger. The only thing they are lacking is the roof. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putting a roof on the front of their house

loans.name: Johanna Oswalda

texts.es: Johanna Oswalda Calderón P. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Johanna tiene 2 hijos y ambos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y gaseosa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Johanna inicio este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante con sus hijos, por lo que decide buscar este medio de supervivencia. Los propósitos propuestos por Johanna para su negocio son de incrementar en la venta de oro laminado ya que es el más solicitado por sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar ropa interior, oro laminado, plata y además gaseosa. El deseo de Doña Johanna es darle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda y lograr esta oportunidad de superación.
texts.en:
Johanna Oswalda Calderón P. is 34 years old, and married. Johanna has two children and both are studying. She sells general merchandise and soft drinks; she has dedicated herself to this business for over 4 years. Johanna began this business due to her necessity to get ahead in life with her children, for which she decided to look into this means of survival. Johanna’s business objectives are to increase the sale of gold platted jewelry given that it is highly solicited by her clients. The loan is destined to serve as work capital to purchase underwear, gold plated jewelry, silver, and also soft drinks. Johanna’s wishes are to carry out the necessary improvements on her home, and to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase underwear, gold plated jewelry, silver, and also soft drinks.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
La señora Abigail es ama de casa y vive con su esposo el señor Guadalupe que es albañil en una Constructora obteniendo un muy buen ingreso mensual.
Ellos tienen el proyecto de la colocación de una losa de concreto, para ampliarse y tener una mayor comodidad. 
El crédito que están solicitando solamente lo requieren para la compra del material ya que Don Guadalupe realizara la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Abigail is a homemaker and lives with her husband, Gaudalupe, who is a construction working for a company. His monthly income is very good.

They wish to install a concrete slab to expand their home for greater comfort.

The loan they are requesting is only for the price of the building material because Guadalupe will be doing the work himself.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a concrete slab as the roof of a room, currently under construction.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel Z. es dentista en una institución medica familiar desde hace 23 años; vive con su esposa la señora San Juana y juntos tiene una familia incorporada por dos hijos, tiene un proyecto que es para mayor seguridad de sus hijos y del hogar, ya que desean construir una barda en el frente de su casa, y así sus hijos podrán jugar tranquilamente en el frente de su casa sin ninguna preocupación, por esta razón el esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel Senteno has been a dentist in a family medicine facility for the past 23 years. He lives with his wife San Juana and together they have two children. They would like to build a wall on the front of their house for greater security of their children and their home. Their children will be able to play safely in the front yard without concern, and for this reason they are requesting this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in the front of their house.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
La señora Ana Laura y su esposo el señor Jaime son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.
Ellos son comerciantes independientes, ella tiene su propia estética de nombre “Nenas” desde hace 2 años, el por su parte tiene un negocio de auto Eléctrico, se encarga de verificar las fallas de la computadora de los automóviles, negocio que tiene desde hace 3 años. Pero el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito es para la compra de un scanner verificador de fallas reciente modelo, y también en la inversión de la compra de mercancía tal como tintes, uñas de acrílico, tratamientos y otros productos que se requieran para el manejo de la estética de la señora Ana Laura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Laura and her husband, Mr. Jaime, are a very united and hard-working family. They are independent merchants. She has had her own beauty shop called "Nenas" for two years; he on the other hand has an auto electronics business. He verifies errors in the computer of automobiles, a business he's had for three yers. But the reason why they're requesting this loan is for the purchase of an more recent auto diagnostic scanner, and also to invest in the purchase of merchandise like dyes, acrylic nails, treatments, and other products that are required to run Mrs. Ana Laura's beauty shop.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in products for two businesses

loans.name: Fransisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisca del Socorro Flete tiene la edad de 55 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Francisca tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Francisca es la elaboración y venta de repostería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, pero es importante resaltar que es un negocio que surgió por la falta de empleo, ya que este negocio surge por su Mama. Y por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio. Ya que el propósito de Francisca es de obtener cada día mas recursos para la compra de los productos y lograr una excelente elaboración de su repostería. El financiamiento es destinado para capita de trabajo y comprar productos como mantequilla, huevo, harina entre otros productos. El sueño de Francisca es establecer una panadería en su casa ya que actualmente se encarga de la elaboración y mas tarde las distribuye de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Francisca del Socorro Flete, 55, is civilly married. Ms. Francisca has two kids, both of whom study. Her job is making and selling pastries. She's dedicated herself to this for 16 years, but it's important to stress that it's a business that emerged through a lack of employment, since this business comes down to her from her mom. And through her finances she's been able to get ahead with her business. Since Francisca's goal is to earn more resources every day to buy products and improve the quality of her pastries, the loan is to buy products like butter, eggs, and flour, among other things. Francisca's dream is to establish a bakery in her home, since currently she makes her pastries and sells them in the street.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for work

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel Ángel es casado y vive con su esposa y un hijo, el trabaja para una empresa en el área de ventas, contando con la confianza de la organizacion ya que tiene una antigüedad de 4 años. 
El desea construir un barda en la parte trasera de su casa para mayor protección de el y principalmente de su familia; es por lo que se acerca a solicitar este crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is married and lives with his wife and son. He works for a business in sales. He has worked for them for four years, and they have faith in him. He wishes to build a wall in the back part of his house. The wall is to offer better protection primarily for his family and for him. That is why he is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in the back part of his house

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
La señora Laureana es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II”, de la provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y con 02 hijos a su cargo, ella posee estudios superiores incompletos. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, a fin de comprar mas abarrotes y venderlo  en su tiendita. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que piensa pagar en 06 cuotas; el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas mercadería (fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite), y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su mayor deseo es darle su profesión a sus hijos.

La sra. Indica que le gustan mucho las reuniones  y las facilidades de de pago que les brindan en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Laureana is a member of the “Aswancaris II” community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 32, a single mother, and she is raising her two children. She went to college, but did not finish. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She buys and sells groceries. Her first loan was for 500 PEN. She bought more groceries to sell in her small store. She currently wants a loan for 2,500 PEN, which she will repay in six payments. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise (noodles, rice, sugar, oil). This way her business will continue to grow. Her biggest desire is to give her children a profession. She really likes the meetings and the loan facilities that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rices, noodles, oil, sugar.

loans.name: Victor Bacilio

texts.es: El señor Víctor es casado con la señora Diana Vásquez, el trabaja en una fabrica desde hace 2 años en el área de  producción, pero su lucha para salir adelante al igual que su esposa no para ahí; ellos perciben un ingreso extra ya que se dedican a la elaboración y venta de menudo casero desde hace tres años, y ya que cuenta con clientela también desean iniciar su negocio propio de tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Victor is married to Diana Vásquez. He has worked in production in a factory for two years. In their fight to get ahead, he and his wife do not stop there. For three years they have been getting extra income from making and selling menudo, a traditional soup made from tripe. They have a client base. They hope to start their own business of having a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a grocery business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Armendáriz es casado con la señora Betty, el trabaja como promotor de diversos comercios desde hace 5 años, ella también es promotora de una empresa de carnes frías, son padres de 3 niños, son una familia unida y trabajadora porque saben que solo así se pueden lograr sus proyectos.
Ellos están solicitando este crédito para la colocación del vitropiso en su casa y lograr así una mejor comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando Armendáriz is married to Betty. He has worked as a promoter of various products for 5 years. Betty is also a promoter of a business of cold meats. They are parents to 3 children. They are a united, working family because they know that this is the only way they can achieve their goals. They are requesting this loan to place a “vitropiso” [a type of ceramic floor] in their home, and in this way, gain more comfort for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a ceramic floor in their home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro y la señora Lorena son una familia emprendedora e independientes comerciantes.
Se dedican a la elaboración de tortillas de harina para su venta en mayoreo y menudeo, desde hace 6 años, pero también obtiene otros ingresos mediante la tiendita de abarrotes que tienen de nombre “M Y M” desde hace 1 año. Ellos desean ampliarse en el mercado por ello solicitan este crédito para así invertir en mayor mercancía para su venta.
texts.en:
Pedro and Lorena are an enterprising family and are independent merchants. They have dedicated themselves to making flour tortillas to sell at wholesale and retail prices for 6 years. However, they also make income by the means of the little grocery store named “M Y M” that they have had for 1 year. Pedro and Lorena would like to expand in the market. For this reason, they are requesting this loan so that they can invest in more merchandise to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand their business

loans.name: Horinchon

texts.ru: Хоринчону недавно исполнилось 30 лет. Он женат но еще не имеет детей. Живет он вместе с родителями. После окончания школы Хоринчон сразу стал заниматься мелким предпринимательством. Начинал он с купли продажи сухофруктов на местных рынках. Постепенно наработав собственный капитал стал покупать и сухофрукты оптом и привезя домой проводить сортировку. Это позволяло получить большую прибыль, так как разделение по сортам улучшало качество сухофруктов. Постепенно стал также заниматься куплей продажей корма для скота. Для этого он приобрел маленький грузовичок, на котором ездит за кормом в соседний Кыргызстан. На сегодня оборот его бизнеса вырос и позволяет содержать не только его семью, но и семью его родителей. С МикроИнвест Хоринчон сотрудничает уже больше года. Он и дальше планирует расширять свой бизнес, и поэтому решил подать новую заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Horinchon recently turned 30 years old. He is married but does not have children yet. He lives with his parents. After finishing school Horinchon right away became a small entrepreneur. He started by purchasing and selling dried fruits at the local markets. Gradually after earning his own capital he started purchasing dried fruits in wholesale quantities and sorting them at home. This allowed him to earn big profits, because sorting by grade improves the quality of dried fruits. Gradually he also started to purchase and sell animal feed. He purchased a small truck for this on which he travels to neighboring Kirgizstan for feed. By this point his turnover has grown and allows him to support not only his own family but also his parent’s family. Horinchon has been working with MicroInvest for over a year. He plans to grow his business further and this is why he decided to put in a new application for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino Padrón vive con su esposa la señora Nicolasa Gamez, ellos son padres de dos hijos pequeños los cuales son el motivo de esta pareja para salir adelante. 
El labora para una empresa de ediciones y publicaciones desde hace 6 años, a parte cuenta con otro ingreso ya que tiene su propio taller de soldadura y herrería desde hace 8 años. 
El esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de materia prima para seguir produciendo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcelino Padrón lives with his wife, Nicolasa Gamez. They are parents of two small children who are the motivation of this couple to move ahead in life. Marcelino has worked for a publications business for 6 years. He also has another source of income from his blacksmith workshop that he has had for 8 years. Marcelino is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing raw materials so that he can continue with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his blacksmith business

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходуру 32 года, женат и имеет 3 детей. Работает на заводе по производству строительных материалов. Работа постоянная и занят на ней Баходур почти всю неделю. Заработную плату получает вовремя. Но семья растет, и чтобы покрыть все растущие потребности Баходур открыл у себя дома маленький магазинчик по продаже продуктов питания. В качестве продавца работает его жена и мать. Баходур привозит товар один раз в неделю с оптового рынка и в течении недели у местных оптовиков. Баходур планирует приобрести оптовую партию товара и поэтому нуждается в дополнительном финансировании. Также он собирается приобрести морозильник для продажи мороженного и поэтому подал заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Bahodur is 32 years old; he is married and has 3 children. He works at a factory that makes construction materials. The job is permanent and Bahodur is busy at it for almost the entire week. He receives his salary on time. But the family is growing and in order to cover growing needs Bahodur opened a small store in his home to sell food products. His wife and mother work as sellers. Bahodur brings products in once a week from the wholesale market and during the week from local wholesalers. Bahodur plans to get a wholesale quantity of products and needs additional financing. Also he plans to purchase a freezer to sell ice cream and this is why he applied for a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and a freezer

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith A., 39, is pictured here with her husband. She is married with five children. Ith and her farmily live in the Takeo province.

Ith raises pigs and she works as a rice farmer. She typically earns $1.50 each day. Her husband helps her to sell the pigs that she raises. Her husband, Chea Tha, typically makes about $25.00 in revenue each day as a pig dealer.

Ith A. would like a loan of $700 to purchase more pigs to breed. She will also purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sitri

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sitri - (DNR.M-0655) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Ni Ketut Sitri owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Sitri has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 Indonesia Rupiahs (US $29 - $38) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Ketut Sitri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Sitri has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 rupiahs (about US $95) from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Ni Ketut Sitri is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 rupiahs which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th she has taken out from DINARI. Ni Ketut Sitri plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Sitri - (DNR.M-0655) merupakan 51 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Sitri memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Sitri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 20 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Sitri menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut Sitri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Sitri meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Sitri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: Livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv O. is 56 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She works as a rice farmer, weaver and also raises pigs. On average, she is able to make US $1 per day. Her husband sells mangoes in the local market and earns approximately US $12 per day. This family is also supported by two children who work as taxi drivers.

To make more money, Iv would like to take out a loan for her husband to purchase mangoes from a grower to sell at the market. (Iv O. is pictured with her husband at home)

loans.use: To purchase mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Ni Made Lina Rahayu

texts.en:
Ni Made Lina Rahayu (DNR.M-0656) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has an infant. To making a living, Ni Made Lina Rahayu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Made Lina Rahayu has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 450,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Made Lina Rahayu joined DINARI, Kiva's partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ni Made Lina Rahayu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. The previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Ni Made Lina Rahayu is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Made Lina Rahayu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Made Lina Rahayu - (DNR.M-0656) merupakan 29 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Made Lina Rahayu memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made Lina Rahayu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made Lina Rahayu menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 450,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Made Lina Rahayu bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made Lina Rahayu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Made Lina Rahayu berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin S., 33, pictured here with her husband, lives with her husband and four children in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she makes and sells food in the local market. On average, she is able to make US $20 per day. Her husband works at an electricity company and makes around US $4 each day. All of their children are in school.

Sin is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her family transportation to reduce the family's daily expenses. With this purchase the family believes that it can increase its income and raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Subeg

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Subeg (DNR.M-0657) is a 65 year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has an adult child. To making a living, Ni Wayan Subeg owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the primary source of income for the business is raising pigs for sale. Ni Wayan Subeg has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 300,000 to 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Wayan Pori joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Wayan Pori has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Ni Wayan Pori is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her fourth from DINARI. Ni Wayan Pori plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her child's tuition fees.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Wayan Pori - (DNR.M-0662) merupakan 54 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Pori memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Wayan Pori sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Pori menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Wayan Pori bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Wayan Pori meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Pori berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Эшбоев Абдумачид-мужчина 48 лет. Женат отец 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Абдумачиду помогает его жена и дети. Абдумачид имеет 20 летный стаж работы и у него большой опыт. Жена Абдумачида занимается переработкой молока. Абдумачид хочет на полученный займ купить два средних бычка также купить корм для них. Абдумачид продает свой скот мясникам на рынке Кансая.
texts.en:
Abdumajid E. is a 48 year old man. He is married and has 2 children. He fattens and resells livestock. Abdumajid’s wife and children help him. Abdumajid has been working for 20 years and has a lot of experience. Abdumajid’s wife processes milk. Abdumajid would like to use his loan to purchase two medium bulls and also to purchase feed for them. Abdumajid sells his livestock to butchers at the market in Kansaya.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sell livestock

loans.name: Iymonali

texts.ru: Эшбоев Ийманали- мужчина 28 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей. Ийманали занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Ему помогают родители, брат и жена. У Ийманали одна корова и 10 баран. Мама Ийманали занимается переработкой молока а его женя продаёт на базаре молоко. Ийманали молодой и энергичный и имеет, достаточным опыт он также является мясником и имеет мясной ларек.
texts.en:
Iymonali E. is a 28 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. Iymonali fattens and resells livestock. His parents, brother and wife help him. Iymonail has one cow and 10 sheep. Iymonali’s mother processes milk and his wife sells the milk at the market. Iymonali is young, energetic and has sufficient experience; he is also a butcher and has a butcher shop.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten livestock

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Назаров Абдусамад- мужчина 44 лет. Женат отец  2-х детей. Абдусамад занимается откормом скота. Также  Абдумачид имеет магазин хозяйственных товаров. Абдумачид на хочет купить овец  на полученный займ. Также у Абдумачида имеет 10 коз которые пасутся  в горах у чабанов. У Абдусамад друг мясник которому он сдает свой скот для убой. Абдусамад признателен нашей организации за полученный займ ему полностью нравятся все наши условия.
texts.en:
Abdusamad Hazarov is a 44 year old man. He is married and is the father of 2 children. Abdusamad fattens livestock. Also, Abdumasad has a store selling household products. Abdusamad would like to purchase sheep using his loan. He also has 10 goats that are out to pasture in the mountains with the shepherds. Abdumasad has a friend who is a butcher to whom he gives his livestock to butcher. Abdumasad is grateful to our organization for the loan that he received and he completely likes our terms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wenti

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Holdorov

texts.ru: Турсунов Холдор- мужчина 53 лет. Женат отец 4-х детей. Холдор получил потребительский заем для  строительства сарая. Холдор является клиентом нашего Фонда с 2008 года. Ему очень нравятся наши условия. Холдор по специальности водитель. Он работает в колхозе водителем. Также Холдор на выходные на своем легковом автомобиле занимается частным извозом.  Жена присматривают за домашним скотом , которое также дает, прибыль семье.
texts.en:
Holdor T. is a 53 year old man. He is married and has 4 children. Holdor received a consumer loan in order to build a shed. Holdor has been a client of our Fund since 2008. He likes our terms. Holdor is a driver by profession. He works at a collective farm as a driver. In addition, on the weekends Holdor uses his car to provide rides. His wife takes care of the livestock which also brings income to the family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build shed

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Рахимбердиев Азимжон- мужчина 32 лет. Женат отец  4-х детей. Азимжон занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Скот Азимжон покупает с Киргизии. Ему помогают  дети  Азимчон, раньше был, чабаном имеет 10-летный стаж в сфере скотоводства, и он очень любить животных. На полученный займ он хочет расширить своё стадо, купив овец. Жена Азимджона занимается переработкой пряжи.
texts.en:
Azimjon R. is 32 year old, married and a father of four children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales. Azimjon brings the livestock from Kyrgyzstan. His children help him with the business. Azimjon used to be a shepherd and has a 10-year experience in the animal husbandry field. He loves animals. He wants to use this loan to grow his herd by buying sheep. Azimjon’s wife is involved in yarn processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Абдурахимов Улугбек-мужчина 23 лет. Женат имеет 1-го ребенка. Улугбек занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Улугбек на полученный займ хочет купить дойную корову и корм для него .   Жена Угулбека раньше работала в ферме дояркой поэтому он хочет купить дойную корову и это для семейного бюджета хорошая прибыл. Улугбек также является членом фермерского хозяйства и занимается посевом картофеля, лука, зелени помидоров сезонно.
texts.en:
Ulugbek A. is 23 years old, married and has one child. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales. He wants to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and cattle feed. Ulugbek’s wife used to work as a milk maid at a farm. This is why Ulugbek wants to buy a dairy cow and add income to his family’s budget. Ulugbek is also a member of a local farm and plants potatoes, onions, greens and tomatoes seasonally.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow and feed

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumarmi

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: A 44 year old husband and a father of 4 children, Mr. Dante A., resides in his home town of Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte.  He is a carpenter and, together with his wife, operates his picture lamination business to feed and send his children in college. Mr. Dante and his wife dream of expanding their small business so they can provide a better future for their children and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: Materials for picture lamination
